story:
There is a growing movement in this country to end homelessness that is being driven and inspired by houseless people themselves.  They are building the solutions themselves provided that we simply get out of the way.  But the movement has not come easy as we struggle against business development interests who would rather we be invisible.

A team of street warriors in Denver, Seattle, Portland, Atlanta along with a professional documentary crew led by Carlos Mireles (blubambu.biz/about-us/) are taking it to the streets to capture the story of this underground movement exploding onto the scene.  We are raising $30K to complete this documentary short as a platform to introduce the Tiny Home Movement into new cities across the United States. 

We have already built a tiny home village in Denver and have traveled to six cities to learn the best practices in growing this movement.  Your contribution will enable us to share the movement with a broader community and serve as a road map to bringing the movement to your town!

There is considerable opposition to Tiny Homes in every major city in the US because it puts power back into the hands of the people rather than big business and government funding.

Along with this video, we plan to bring Tiny Homes to over 10 new cities in the next five years and demonstrate the efficacy and compassion of this simple solution. 

You are welcome to follow our exploits on facebook as we are not only filming the documentary, but are the very ones sleeping outside, confronting the police, negotiating with mayors and governors and building Tiny Home Villages. 

The reason we are crowd sourcing this video and not seeking grants, is that we want to be able to tell the raw truth about the crisis and solutions without any filters or artificial drivers.  Many invested in the status quo do not want this story to be shared.  They have built their careers in the poverty industrial complex.
 
Our proof is in the tiny home villages themselves.  They are working everywhere but not without considerable risk, challenges and sacrifice.  Our hope is that this video will illuminate the pathway toward solving this crisis without having to criminalize one more poor person. 
 
Please make a contribution, follow me on facebook over the next six months as we make the film together.  Please share this post with your friends.  Maybe share the video short at your next dinner party.  And be sure to click here to share.

story:
The Story

This film will dive into the story of the Puerto Rican people, who are currently recovering from Hurricane Maria. We’ll be following the story through Chef Ventura Vivoni, of Adjuntas, Puerto Rico.

Like much of the island, his restaurant, Hacienda Luz de Luna, was decimated during Hurricane Maria. Chef Vivoni decided to stay on the island after the storm and began cooking meals for all who needed it. With the help of World Central Kitchen, he’s impacted more than 200 communities and served over 80,000 hot meals in Puerto Rico for those who still don’t have power. On top of feeding the hungry, Chef Vivoni has also been teaching communities about agricultural independence & sustainability. We’ll be following the story through Chef Vivoni's eyes, learning about his personal history, what he experienced during the storm, and what he’s doing now on the island for his people. While telling Chef Vivoni’s story, we’ll provide context and background information on these main topics: Puerto Rican Culture, Puerto Rican History, and the weather and infrastructure of Puerto Rico.

What We Need & What You Get

Making a documentary is not only hard work, but a lot of money

  • We're planning on traveling down to Puerto Rico and shooting with a small team. We'll need funding for the equipment rentals, crew, and lodging. Plus insurance, that's pretty important too.
  • In addition, we have a lot to film in the states in terms of interviews with historians, cultural experts and government officials. We'll be renting the same gear and using the same team to make it all possible.
  • When everything is shot, we'll need hard drives for the project, as well as paying our editor, illustration/animation team, composer, and any music rights we may need.

Chef Vivoni
 

Our Team

 Tristan Seyek - Director

 Marc Baill - Producer

 Sammy Blivaiss - Producer

 Melanie Nieves - Producer

 

 Alexa Carroll -  Director of Photography

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course, we need funding, but we also need exposure...

  • Tell all your friends about the campaign, share our project on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter. Let's spread the word!

story:
An Introduction

Hi, my name is Isabella FitzGerald Harewood. I am a Film and English double major at Wesleyan University. I have produced five films and web-series, as well as written and directed two short films of my own. This fall, I am making a short film as a culmination of my film studies education and the beginning of my career in the film industry. But I can’t do it without you! I need your help to make this dream a reality. Being both a woman and a person of color I hope to bring diversity and a new perspective to the screen with my approach on cinema. I am already well into the pre-production of EXIT but I need your help to carry this film to completion.

 

Budget Breakdown:

Pre-Production: 5%

This money will go towards the cost of administrative work, casting, rehearsals, location visits and production scheduling.

Cast/Crew: 15%

The cast and crew of this film have enthusiastically agreed to collaborate on this film for free! This money will allow me to provide for them the amenities they deserve while shooting including food and transportation costs.

Transportation/Locations: 15%

This percentage of the cost would go towards locations fees, equipment transportation, insurance and safety measures. This film is set in two central locations: A swimming pool and a household. Shooting in or near water is a challenging task, that is why I want to make sure that the right personnel are hired to regulate safety as well as attentively manage our locations. 

Production Design: 20%

The visual design of my film fluctuates the lead character, Ama, between two different worlds: one of serene simplicity and another of overwhelming aesthetic. To achieve this chaotic space, a significant cost must be dedicated to dressing the locations of Ama's house and office. The more detail oriented the production design is the more successful the emotional heart of the film can be.

Filming Equipment: 20%

The Wesleyan Film Department is incredibly generous in the equipment they provide for their film students. However, they cannot encompass all the production needs of every student. The visual design of my film relies on creating a safe space for the lead character, Ama. I have decide to rent a tilt shift lens to achieve this effect. Your contribution will go towards renting these lenses as well as providing other necessarily gear for shooting safely in a pool setting.

Post- Production: 25%

This money would go towards sound mixing and color correction. As many filmmakers know, shooting your film is only the first step in the filmmaking process. Post-production requires a significant amount of attention to make the end product look professional and distributable. 

 

Timeline:

September: Script Editing

October: Test Shoots, Casting, Location Scouting

November: Rehearsals, Scheduling, Production Design

December: Production - Shoot dates: 12/3, 12/4, 12/10, 12/11

January - March: Post- Production

May: Premiere Screening at Wesleyan University!

 

Meet the team:

Isabella FitzGerald Harewood (Writer/Director/Editor): Isabella is a senior at Wesleyan University studying Film and English. She holds a specific interest in how gender and racial issues impact to the public through visual media. At Wesleyan, Isabella acts as both Executive Producer and Diversity Coordinator for the student run film organization Cardinal Pictures. Isabella's passions include writing and filmmaking with a focus on telling the stories of women and people of color. Isabella hopes to become a filmmaker whose films have a social impact on her audience. 

Sarah Wax (Producer): Sarah is actively involved in the film and theater scenes at Wesleyan. In her four semesters at Wesleyan thus far, she's been in three Second Stage productions (including Cabaret, in which she played Fraulein Schneider), independently produced and directed a one-act play, acted in two short film projects, and worked as a crew member on four different short films. Sarah also currently serves as the Vice President and Treasurer of Cardinal Pictures, the largest student filmmaking group on campus.

Ali Arminio (Producer): Ali is a junior Film Studies and English major at Wesleyan. She currently serves as Secretary and Graphic Designer of Cardinal Pictures. In the past she has written and directed several short films, including an macroeconomic music video parody of Jay-Z's "Holy Grail," a zombie comedy, and a documentary that made people cry.

Matt Kleppner (Director of Photography): Matt is a Film and American Studies double major at Wesleyan University who works primarily as a DP on short films and music videos. Experienced with both the technical and creative sides of cinematography, he endeavors to enhance the emotional context of a story through lighting, camera, color, and lens. He also works as a freelance filmmaker and most recently as a 2nd AC on Investigation Discovery's "A Crime to Remember."

Kira Newmark (Assistant Director): Kira is a rising sophomore who hopes to pursue a film and history double major at Wesleyan University. She is an executive producer for Cardinal Pictures and a member of the Film Board, which organizes four movie showings each week on campus. She is also involved in the theatrical world, having stage-managed multiple Second Stage productions and interned at the 52nd Street Project and Atlantic Theater Company.

Sofie Somoroff (Production Designer): Sofie is a film studies and theater double major at Wesleyan, where she is heavily involved in film and theatre production and design. In the greater NYC area, she has produced and coordinated shorts films, advertising campaigns and documentaries. Her work has received awards from the New York Film Festival as well as a New York State Proclamation as a Woman of Distinction. 

Emily Feher (Make-up/Costumes): Emily is a film studies major at Wesleyan University. She is an executive producer for Wesleyan's student film group, Cardinal Pictures, where she has worked as a producer and co-director on a number of productions. She has previously worked on senior film theses as a costume designer, on-set photographer, and graphic designer.

Wilson Lai (Script Supervisor): Wilson is going to be a sophomore at Wesleyan this year with an intention to double major in Film and History. He has worked on short films since high school and has a keen interest in film. He mainly works as a DP or an editor on projects. He has worked on a few on campus web series last year, and he has operated as an editor for STUDENT RUN and THORNFIELD, and as a producer, editor, and DP for 32 CREDITS.

Gandharv Chawla (Gaffer): Gandharv is a Senior Film Studies Major who has worked on several student productions. Since his sophomore year, he has been absolutely obsessed with light.

 

Risks & Challenges

Like all forms of art, filmmaking can be a process of controlled chaos. However, I am working with a dedicated group of individuals who are as passionate about this project as much as I am. All of them are wesleyan educated Film Majors or Minors and have experience working with this specialized equipment. Additionally, as stated before shooting in or near water comes with it's concerns. I am hiring lifeguards as well as getting insurance for all of my locations to ensure the safety of all individuals and equipment. Battery powered LED lights will be exclusively used when shooting at the pool to guarentee the safety of my cast and crew while on set.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can’t contribute in Cash? Please share this project on Social Media or simply spread the word. Any help can make a difference! Thank you for considering this project. Any help would go a long way in making this it possible!!!

story:
About ci2i

 

THERE'S ALWAYS SOME ROOM

FOR IMPROVISATION

 

ci2i is a film that captures the essence and ephemeral beauty of Contact Improvisation: intimate, playful, raw, unfiltered, often wild, Contact Improvisation – or C.I. for short – is a dance form that requires connection, presence and a willingness to take risks.

 

The Contributors

 

THERE IS NO SUCH THING

AS SOLO DANCING

 

ci2i was shot by professional dance film maker Dan Farberoff at the 2016 Freiburg International Contact Festival, one of the world's foremost festivals, and is accompanied by beautiful music from improvisation virtuoso David Leahy.

 

Film Maker, Dan Farberoff
Website

Musician, David Leahy
Website

 

To make it this far, the film maker, composer and festival organisers and participant have given freely of their time, skills and resources. The many hours of footage have been sifted through and made ready to cut.

All that is needed now is your support.

 

 

What Do Backers Get?

 

IMPROVISATION IS TOO GOOD

TO LEAVE TO CHANCE

 

The funds raised will help cover some of the costs involved in completing the film: editing, colour-grading, sound-design, graphics, as well as music-licensing and additional expenses.

In addition to the completed film, backers receive a whole video-album with a dozen additional short films, composed of bonus material from the many hours of footage shot at Freiburg, and accompanied by a full collection of beautiful musical compositions from David Leahy.

Also on offer are signed, high quality, large scale, limited edition photographic prints of ci2i original artwork, and a chance to win 2 days pro bono of the film maker's time to help you in creating your own video project, and also an opportunity to become a project Sponsor.

 

Paypal & Credit Card Payments

Indiegogo collects payments via PayPal. When making a contribution you can choose to either sign in to a PayPal account or, in some countries, elect to "Pay as a Guest" and use a credit card without having a PayPal account. However, PayPal has restricted the use of guest checkout for some international customers.

If you wish to support the project and are experiencing issues making payment via Paypal please don't despair! Send me a message and I will reply with alternative payment options.

 

How We Get There

 

YOU CANNOT IMPROVISE

UNLESS YOU KNOW EXACTLY

WHAT YOU'RE DOING

 

Film post-production can be a daunting effort, involving many long hours of going over the edit again and again. The support of the community can make all the difference.

ci2i relies on the film maker's extensive experience working with dance and camera, and his substantial track record of works that explore the crossover between embodied presence and visual art. Previous projects include successful and highly acclaimed collaborations with major choreographers, dance companies, dancers, fine artists and others, ranging from the English National Ballet and the Olympics to a space-walking NASA astronaut.

 

YES! AND...

 

Share

Spread the word. The more people who know about our project, the greater the support it will receive. Share it on social media, through email, by word of mouth. Do it now! (feel free to use the share options above)

 

Follow

    

 

International Contact Festival Freiburg
Website

story:
It's Time for a Documentary that Truly Helps People in Pain.

 

Bring Narcotica: Breaking Free to Life, Show Your Support Today!

 

There are more than 100 Million patients suffering from chronic pain in North America alone. Our friends, families and loved ones are struggling and, in some cases, dying everyday in search for relief.

Our physicians are forced to walk a tightrope, treating their patients with fear of malpractice, revoked licenses and jail.

Both physicians, and those in despair, have their hands tied, navigating between terrifying government guidelines and the uncertain maze of insurance policies.

Media and regulatory bodies all too often focus on a superficial problem, Opioids, instead of the root cause–chronic pain and the lack of access to alternative treatments. The public is talking about the problem, but few, if any, focus on the groundbreaking therapies or options that exist to treat it

It's Time to Break Free from this Vicious Circle

 

 

There is Hope and Alternatives to Treating Pain

With your support, Narcotica: Breaking Free – Hope for People in Pain will steer through the politics to dive into the lives of chronic pain patients and the families of those who are struggling. We believe that the media is only addressing the issue of “opioids and overdoses”, but we know that isn’t the entire story. With your support we will take a look at life changing treatment options, speak with chronic pain patients, caregivers and healthcare specialists to discuss their successes and failures.

Dr. Ketan Patel, Executive Producer, has dedicated more than 15 years to the study of pain management. After treating an overwhelming population of patients and witnessing first hand their battles with pain, he knew he needed to tell their story–and the story of millions of people who are suffering. Narcotica: Breaking Free will demystify chronic pain, alter the focus away from the opioid epidemic, shining the light on alternative therapies and help patients break free from their medication dependence.

People are Suffering and Desperately Seeking Help

Please Pledge Now

We are asking North America to band together. Chronic pain touches us all, in one way, or another and there are countless, passionate people out there who are seeking information and help. One of the fastest ways to have your voice heard is to support our crowdfunding project. Help us tell the stories of millions of patients who are hurting and honor those who have passed, by informing and educating Americans on alternative methods to find relief. Keep the legacy alive by supporting our documentary, Narcotica: Breaking Free – Hope for People in Pain.

If we raise less than one millionth of the budget currently spent on pain annually in the USA, our documentary will unravel the story and provide actionable knowledge and advice for ALL those suffering from this disabling disease.

 

We Need to Raise $486,000 to Produce and Distribute "Narcotica: Breaking Free" Globally

 

What you'll Get from Us!

We appreciate your support and want to thank each and every one of our backers. In return, we will provide you with perks to help you, or a loved one suffering with pain. We're positive with your support and backing to get the word out there, we will reach our goals and change the lives of people everywhere!

 

We know some people cannot contribute financially, there are other important ways you can help the cause and show your support.

LIKE & SHARE our Indiegogo Link on your social pages

FOLLOW us on Facebook and Twitter to share the project with others.

TALK about the film, use tags #NarcoticaFilm or #NarcoticaBreakingFree

SIGN UP for our mailing list on our website for updates and sneak peeks of the documentary

CONTACT your local media outlet, politicians/representative to help get the message out.

 

Yellow Dog Productions has a history of creating quality award-winning documentaries. Along with the expertise of Dr. Ketan Patel, we are well aware of the challenges and risks that come with creating a documentary of this nature. Our shared competencies, professional networks and YOU will make Narcotica: Breaking Free a reality.

RISKS AND BENEFITS

We understand the importance of getting this message out to the public, so if we don't reach our goals in 60 days, we will use the money we have raised to start filming and fulfill the perks that we have promised. We will then continue to raise funds until the documentary is complete.

It’s extremely important to reach our goal by the end of the campaign, so that we can create the film as soon as possible! We want this film to touch each and every person it can, and shine the light on the chronic pain problem and the options that exist for people who are suffering.

 

Meet the Team

Our  2x EMMY & 7x Telly Award Winning Design & Production Company (Yellow Dog Productions) has tackled major issues around the world in locations such as: Bosnia, Uganda, the Congo and Haiti. They have helped build the stories of countless organizations and brands. We know that people that give to crowdfunding campaigns value transparency. We are 100% dedicated to getting this film out there and we have already put our own names and money behind it.

 

 

 

 

ACTION! Make Your Voice Count

This is your chance to get the healthcare system to stand up and listen to the millions of pain patients in North America. Please let the community know that you care about how people see your pain and the pain of others.  

Thank you so much for all of your support and stay tuned for updates!

The Narcotica: Breaking Free Team!
story_txt: It's Time for a Documentary that Truly Helps People in Pain. Bring Narcotica: Breaking Free to Life, Show Your Support Today! There are more than 100 Million patients suffering from chronic pain in North America alone. Our friends, families and loved ones are struggling and, in some cases, dying everyday in search for relief.Our physicians are forced to walk a tightrope, treating their patients with fear of malpractice, revoked licenses and jail.Both physicians, and those in despair, have their hands tied, navigating between terrifying government guidelines and the uncertain maze of insurance policies.Media and regulatory bodies all too often focus on a superficial problem, Opioids, instead of the root cause–chronic pain and the lack of access to alternative treatments. The public is talking about the problem, but few, if any, focus on the groundbreaking therapies or options that exist to treat itIt's Time to Break Free from this Vicious Circle  There is Hope and Alternatives to Treating PainWith your support, Narcotica: Breaking Free – Hope for People in Pain will steer through the politics to dive into the lives of chronic pain patients and the families of those who are struggling. We believe that the media is only addressing the issue of “opioids and overdoses”, but we know that isn’t the entire story. With your support we will take a look at life changing treatment options, speak with chronic pain patients, caregivers and healthcare specialists to discuss their successes and failures.Dr. Ketan Patel, Executive Producer, has dedicated more than 15 years to the study of pain management. After treating an overwhelming population of patients and witnessing first hand their battles with pain, he knew he needed to tell their story–and the story of millions of people who are suffering. Narcotica: Breaking Free will demystify chronic pain, alter the focus away from the opioid epidemic, shining the light on alternative therapies and help patients break free from their medication dependence.People are Suffering and Desperately Seeking HelpPlease Pledge NowWe are asking North America to band together. Chronic pain touches us all, in one way, or another and there are countless, passionate people out there who are seeking information and help. One of the fastest ways to have your voice heard is to support our crowdfunding project. Help us tell the stories of millions of patients who are hurting and honor those who have passed, by informing and educating Americans on alternative methods to find relief. Keep the legacy alive by supporting our documentary, Narcotica: Breaking Free – Hope for People in Pain.If we raise less than one millionth of the budget currently spent on pain annually in the USA, our documentary will unravel the story and provide actionable knowledge and advice for ALL those suffering from this disabling disease. We Need to Raise $486,000 to Produce and Distribute "Narcotica: Breaking Free" Globally What you'll Get from Us!We appreciate your support and want to thank each and every one of our backers. In return, we will provide you with perks to help you, or a loved one suffering with pain. We're positive with your support and backing to get the word out there, we will reach our goals and change the lives of people everywhere! We know some people cannot contribute financially, there are other important ways you can help the cause and show your support.LIKE & SHARE our Indiegogo Link on your social pagesFOLLOW us on Facebook and Twitter to share the project with others.TALK about the film, use tags #NarcoticaFilm or #NarcoticaBreakingFreeSIGN UP for our mailing list on our website for updates and sneak peeks of the documentaryCONTACT your local media outlet, politicians/representative to help get the message out. Yellow Dog Productions has a history of creating quality award-winning documentaries. Along with the expertise of Dr. Ketan Patel, we are well aware of the challenges and risks that come with creating a documentary of this nature. Our shared competencies, professional networks and YOU will make Narcotica: Breaking Free a reality.RISKS AND BENEFITSWe understand the importance of getting this message out to the public, so if we don't reach our goals in 60 days, we will use the money we have raised to start filming and fulfill the perks that we have promised. We will then continue to raise funds until the documentary is complete.It’s extremely important to reach our goal by the end of the campaign, so that we can create the film as soon as possible! We want this film to touch each and every person it can, and shine the light on the chronic pain problem and the options that exist for people who are suffering. Meet the TeamOur  2x EMMY & 7x Telly Award Winning Design & Production Company (Yellow Dog Productions) has tackled major issues around the world in locations such as: Bosnia, Uganda, the Congo and Haiti. They have helped build the stories of countless organizations and brands. We know that people that give to crowdfunding campaigns value transparency. We are 100% dedicated to getting this film out there and we have already put our own names and money behind it.    ACTION! Make Your Voice CountThis is your chance to get the healthcare system to stand up and listen to the millions of pain patients in North America. Please let the community know that you care about how people see your pain and the pain of others.  Thank you so much for all of your support and stay tuned for updates!The Narcotica: Breaking Free Team!

story:
The Story of "Let Go"

Let Go, inspired by true events, tells the story of Katie-- a small town introvert with aspirations to be a writer in the big city. While working towards her writing, Katie has a not-so-quiet evening when her old high school, party best friend Briana comes back into Katie's life. Will it be the reunion Katie will remember or want to forget? Has too much time apart to a strain on their friendship or made them even stronger and closer?

Why This Story Is Important.

It may be a passion project if anything, but it really explores the idea of strained relationships or falling outs with those once close to us. It's something we believe everyone has experienced and can relate to, with change being inevitable and how people don't always stay the same. It also reflects that moment of realization where someone may realize their friend isn't who they thought they were, they used them or any other red flags they may see years later in the relationship. It's a topic no one likes to think about or go through, but life isn't easy and is always teaching us important lessons. And understanding which friends to keep and those you have to let go of is one of them.

What We Need & How You Can Help

Though we have story, it takes more than that to make it come to life onscreen. Many things will be needed to make the film happen like:

  • Cameras
  • Lights
  • Audio Equipment
  • Hair and Wardrobe
  • Props
  • Production Design
  • Craft Service
  • And much more

With your help and contribution, we can bring this coming-of-age story to life. Every dollar helps out immensely! Whatever you can donate will bring us one step closer to making this film real. 

Perks and Prizes!

We won't let you go away empty-handed. What you donate will get you a perk or two. Such as:

  • Name in Credits
  • DVD Copy of film
  • Autographed Posters
  • And more!

If You Can't Donate

No worries. We understand. You can help us out by spreading the word out. Tell others by:

  • Sharing our Indiegogo website 
  • Sharing our Facebook page
  • Sharing our Instagram

Thank you so much in advance for your time and contribution to our project. We're all storytellers with big dreams and any donation you make will make a huge difference towards making this project. We're so excited to get started on production and present Let Go!

story:
Who Am I?

Hi, my name is Victoria, the director of Passbrook, and I am a Senior Digital Cinema Major at John Brown University.  I grew up in Tulsa, Oklahoma, as a theatre enthusiast, acting in stage productions, but it wasn't until high school that I dipped my toes into the realm of filmmaking.  I attended the 2013 Austin Film Festival for the first time, and it was there the decision was made to start a career as a filmmaker.  Since then, I've worked on feature independent films, short films, and music videos.  Several of the films I have had the opportunity to work on have made it into film festivals around the country.

What Am I Doing?

My Senior Thesis Film, Passbrook, is about a young burnt out musician who is struggling to find direction and meaning in his life.  Everything changes, however, when he totals his car and becomes stuck in the odd small town of Passbrook, unaware that the atypical folks he encounters will be the ones to help him change the course of his life.

Passbrook could be best described as a quirky narrative drama that relies heavily on visual stylization.  My intent is to not merely capture the action and dialogue in a way that is coherent and properly assembled, but in a way so every building block or aspect of the film is intentionally motivated to tell the story in the best and truest way possible.  We have put together an incredibly talented cast and crew who have already invested a great deal of time and effort towards this movie.  Shooting will begin now and wrap at the end of March.  It will be ready for an official screening on April 30th, 2017!

What Do We Need?

In order to take this story from paper to reality, we need funding to cover these specific areas:

Budget Breakdown:

35% is allotted to our Art Department for wardrobe, set decoration, props, and special effects.

25% is allotted towards Craft Services for feeding the cast and crew on all shooting days.

15% will finance film festival application fees in order to submit our film nationwide.

10% is allotted to Grip & Electric for light bulbs, tape, blackwrap, batteries, etc.

10% is set aside for contingency. 

5% will cover the cost of transportation.

As a team of artists who are hungry to create, we would very much appreciate any form of contribution.  As college students, money is particularly hard to come by, and so we humbly ask for your support!  In appreciation of your generosity, our crew would like to assemble our skills as masters of a variety of crafts and provide you with special gifts and perks!

Why Are We Doing This?

Storytelling is a powerful and influential tool, because it allows us to access the inner core of our human emotions.  If done correctly, the transparency of the characters' thoughts and feelings allow the audience to relate to and understand people in our society that are different or similar to ourselves.  The reason I want to make this film in particular, is because I believe this story can take people away, even if for a short amount of time, from the chaos and hardships that consume their every day lives.  And in return, bring them into a place where they can freely step into the shoes of fascinating and relatable people.  The everyday struggles and obstacles encountered by the characters in this film are what I believe to be issues that many of us face in real life, and oftentimes have trouble coming to terms with.  My hope is that by the end of the film, whoever is watching will feel and see differently than they did before the movie began.

How Will I Struggle?

Making a film in general is no effortless picnic, yet alone while you are a student attempting to balance a life of filmmaking and academic studies.  The pressure to give yourself entirely to your art, while making sure you pass that bio quiz the next morning is quite strenuous.  The only way for this balance to be maintained is time management, a mundane social life, and LOTS of caffeine.

The potential and probable mishaps will be due to our wishy-washy Mother Nature here in the good ol' mid-west.  Filming during consistent weather conditions are crucial to our continuity; therefore, we could have to cancel shooting days on short notice due to a rapid change in the forecast.  We must keep that in mind while we shoot and try to keep ahead of schedule in order to wrap the film on time.

Overcoming these challenges and struggles will be manageable if we strategize our time efficiently, plan ahead, and always have a Plan B.  Every film set has their dilemmas, but I believe in the abilities and dedication of this team to make a fantastic film!

Any Other Ways You Can Help?

If you are unable to fund this project, no hard feelings.  I get it.  In this day and age, money is hard to come by.  As student artists, we understand that factor entirely.  Why else would they call us starving artists?  We would be thankful just to have your support by getting news out about our campaign by word of mouth and social media!  Sharing the link to this page on your Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, etc., would be doing us such a huge service!  Thank you for your contribution and support. Without you, none of this would be possible.  Stay tuned for updates!

story:
Raising the dead for dummies is a Horror comedy in where after a night of partying, four friends end up stealing the book of the dead from a voodoo priest. After reading from the book Jimmy (our main character) becomes cursed and slowly begins to transform into a demon that will bring hell to earth. Now armed with demonic powers, Jimmy and his friends have to find a way to reverse the spell before the demon is fully able to take over, all while being pursued by Mr. Ke'yama Voodoo priest they stole from, who wants the book for his own sinister reasons.

With this film, we are aspiring to recreate some of the great story-telling techniques used in the iconic '80s horror movies such as; practical effects, prosthetics, and special effects make-up. This is where the majority of our Indiegogo funding will go; ensuring that our special effects are as good as they can be and consistent with the quality of the movie we are hoping to make. We've put together an incredible cast and crew, our locations are all set and the script is, in my opinion, the pinnacle of movie making (I wrote it lol). With everything else in order, your funding will mean that we are able to go to camera almost immediately and start making this dream a reality. Thank you very much for your consideration.

        

 

Giovanni Fleming - Director/Producer

From a young age Giovanni Fleming has been passionate about film, Born in Los Angeles California, he was raised surrounded by the film industry. As a child He would re-create scenes from films with his videocamera, often experimenting with stop motion. After High School, Giovanni studied film and anthropology at The Los Angeles City College. Looking to further hone his filmmaking skills, He then moved to Vancouver Canada to attend the Vancouver Film School, After graduating Giovanni went on to work in the film industry, he Produced and Directed a web series and multiple shorts. Heavily influenced my Directors like Edgar Wright, Stephen Spielberg, and Chan Wook Park , His unique Directing style bring something truly special to his work.

 

Connor Rielly - Writer/ Producer

Raised on the rough streets of West Vancouver, B.C. Connor knew he would have a unique voice and view of the world when his father showed him the film Goodfellas at age seven. Growing up heavily influenced by the works of Martin Scorsese and Shane Black, he began writing short scripts while completing his B.A in Communications and Criminology at Simon Fraser University. During his final year, his first script was produced into the short film, No Good Deed. Having loved the experience, he enrolled in Vancouver Film School under the SXSW Scholarship in pursuit of a career in screenwriting. During his time at VFS, Connor wrote and produced his second independent short film, Pendulum. He also wrote the short film Parallax and the web series Night Owl High. Connor is a genre writer with a passion for writing crime stories, often supplementing them with comedic, thriller, or film noir, elements.

 

Francis Belanger -  Director of Photography/ Producer

Crash, bang, BOOM! Then silence... a baby cries in the distance, but no one's there to help it. It cries and cries until it can no longer produce a sound. We see a light. A light of hope... it took an hour to light, but since then he was never the same. Even at a young age, Francis had a love for cinema. It was while attending the Vancouver film school that he discovered this love and further developed his skills in cinematography. Now, two years later, after numerous independent short films, documentaries, commercials, web series', as well as working in the Vancouver film and television industry, Francis is ready and excited to get started on his first feature film. 

 

Kofi Effah - Producer

A natural story-teller, Kofi Effah is a producer who seemed destined to make the transition into the world of film. From grades nine through twelve, he enrolled in his secondary school's theatre and drama program and fell in love with the art. After studying Sociology and English at the University of Windsor, Kofi decided to renew his passion for film by moving from Toronto to Vancouver in 2012. Since then, he has immersed himself within BC's thriving film industry, and has worked on such television shows as 'The Flash,' 'Prison Break: Sequel,' and 'The 100' as a lighting technician. In his free time, Kofi enjoys producing his own independent projects by day and moonlighting as a hard-boiled detective by night.

Mark Anthony Hogan - Producer

Mark Anthony Hogan began working in the film industry within the independent scene in Vancouver, BC. After freelancing for several years as a 1st assistant director and other various roles he decided to take the leap into the union community. Mark has worked his way up from being a production assistant for such films as Deadpool and The Interview, to being set dresser for The Romeo Section, When We Rise, and Van Helsing, but he found his true calling as a producer. Mark currently produces independent feature films, short films, commercials, corporate, promotional and music videos, weddings and web series. Mark decided to focus on producing projects with passionate people who are hungry to create and tell stories.

 

Bram Cole - Producer

Bram was born and raised in Calgary, AB and Moved to Halifax in 2008 for school. He received his Bachelors of Management in 2012 from Dalhousie University. Throughout his time at university he worked as a computer technician and as a retail salesperson in local electronics stores. After taking some time off to travel He teamed up with two small business ventures in Calgary, helping get them off the ground. Bram graduated from the Film Production program at Vancouver Film School in 2013. He formed the production company Rolling Peaks Media with his associates Joseph Ahn, Steve Hayes, and Connor Rielly. Since then, he has been working as an assistant coordinator for 20th Century Fox and plans on producing as many passion projects as possible in his free time.

story:
THE TEAM:

Zach Huber is a Writer, Director, and Comedian from Kansas City.  He's a senior film student at Columbia College Chicago and a rather simple guy. Zach just loves to entertain audiences and make them laugh, and he's looking forward to bringing people a fresh take on the action comedy with this senior capstone project!

Austin Crowley is a Director of Photography from Chicago and Zach's right hand man. When he isn't free style rapping, he's constantly refining his ability to express his quirky perspective visually. He's worked on numerous projects in his time at Columbia, and upon graduation is excited to continue working on his goal to master cinematography.

John Breihan is the man that quite literally does it all. He's the producer on this project and will be putting all his experience writing, working on set, and proving Zach wrong to good use in making this film the best it can be. John looks forward to finishing up his degree in film and continuing to develop his unique brand of content for the masses!

 

OUR MOST IMPORTANT MEMBER: YOU!

Simply put, we can't bring this project to life without the help of you all! By helping us fund this project not only will you be aiding us in making a strong, professional portfolio piece that we can use to seek jobs upon graduation, but you'll be a part of a fun team that's devoted to bringing fresh concepts to screen! With this piece we'll be pushing the envelope with some never before seen stylized comedic action elements and our rewards are dedicated to bringing you along for the ride. Consider yourself a part of the family!

WHAT WE NEED:

We've taken our script and broken it down into the essential elements we need to make this film a reality, and after some careful budgeting we have settled on a budget of $2,600 as a bare minimum that we need. We are a student production so thankfully  we have things like cast and crew covered. That being said if raised the money will go towards:

  • Feeding the crew.
  • Location fees and permits.
  • Renting a camera gimbal for running action scenes.
  • Van rental for gear.
  • Special effects and art.

OTHER WAYS TO HELP:

So you don't have the means to help out our production monetarily at this time? No big deal! You can always help us in other ways like sharing our campaign on social media or even just talking to your friends and family about it.

story:
'Still Caught'

My name is Liam Petite from Halifax, Nova Scotia. In 2012, I started my first film, a mockumentary telling a fictional tale of a factual band "Spirit of the Wildfire". Growing up in the same hometown, we have similar inspirations of expressing our environment through our art. What started as a class assignment in the midst of my two years in film school turned into a wild and "hooliganistic" adventure. When starting this project, the then four member group was in a similar stage of their career as I was. We were just getting started on bringing our passions to reality. The project immediately ignited into something much more than what we expected. Since the making of this film, their talent in music and my knowledge in film has skyrocketed resulting in us being even more equipped to produce a high quality collaboration. With a heavy resume on my end and a recently released album with another on the way from them, we think it is perfect time to create a sequel showcasing the progression in both careers and continue the story of 'Caught in the Wildfire'.

One of our biggest struggles during our original production was producing a film while also being starving students. Not that any of us are pulling in anything close to big bucks now, but the first film was entirely made from nothing but creativity of the 5 involved parties. Though we will continue to be resourceful, we are seeking means to be able to let us take a step further in our production value by increase our capacity to book locations and rent necessary equipment. If our goal of $2000 is reached, we will be able to have the freedom to bring more production value to this project and step outside of amateur film making into a film festival worthy production.

Any money that is funded will go entirely towards this project. We are going to keep our followers up to date on where the money is going on our facebook page, from however much we start with to the last Canadian dollar. With every donation, you can get some awesome merchandise including: Posters,T-shirts,CD'S,DVD'S. Also, you may get to be an extra in our movie or even have a romantic date with the whole band.

We are fully aware that just like us, not everyone has the means to donate free-fully as much as they would like to. If this is the case for you but you'd still like to see us succeed with our goal, you can still help. Get this out there and let people know about our campaign. View and Share the original film and help create a buzz for us and this project. Anyone and Everyone can help and be apart of something that we know we will all be proud of.

"Because we all are"

-Misfits&Masterminds

 

R.I.P Dan Whattam 1995 - 2013

story:
YOU, the TDPS audience, have been the primary, most important driving force of the growth of our program. We've had an impact, surpassing and outlasting 99% of the independent programs that started back in 2005, years before President Obama’s first term. Our goal has been to stand up to corporate media and the status quo of the political world, and the time has come to start the next chapter of not only The David Pakman Show, but of political activism.

The progressive movement lost big league on November 8, 2016. If there’s a silver lining, it’s that it's is now clearer than ever that the status quo of corporate media and Republicans out-organizing progressives at the local & state level cannot continue. Oh, and half the country didn’t vote. We all remember the sinking feeling as we realized that Donald Trump would be the next President; that should motivate us to put together an effective progressive playbook.

Corporate media could not have failed us more acutely, ignoring Bernie Sanders until they had no choice, reporting timidly about the outrageous ideas of Donald Trump. We cannot be wandering aimlessly for strategy and candidates to move the country forward, we cannot accept the hate that has risen, and we must have strong and well-funded independent progressive media.

Even with a Hillary Clinton win, we would still have Republicans controlling the House and Senate, and we would be ignoring the urgency of fixing Congressional gerrymandering with 2020 census.

Bernie Sanders’ candidacy, while not perfect, showed us that progressive engagement has a huge impact. The halt of the Dakota Access Pipeline after relentless progressive protesting and organizing confirmed that activism can have a major impact. As we get past the despair and confusion from November 8th, we must have a plan.  The David Pakman Show has one, and we want you to be a part of it. We need you to be a part of it.

We’ve built a successful independent media platform at The David Pakman Show, but the show alone simply is not enough, so we are launching a major campaign to fundamentally grow our reach and influence in extraordinary new ways. This campaign ends on inauguration day. That's not a coincidence. Let's do this!

We’ll be growing not only the media presence of The David Pakman Show, but the activism and progressive engagement arm. This campaign will allow us to:

  • Hire a Progressive Engagement Coordinator to organize and coordinate progressive action on issues and candidates that matter
  • Organize & partner with existing independent progressive shows to coordinate activism & exponentially increase the impact of our efforts
  • Upgrade the TDPS studios to the next level of professionalism, including a professional set design and the professionalization of the guest interview technology platform
  • Bring The David Pakman Show to Amazon Prime, a major opportunity for a much larger audience. Tech & staff requirements for Amazon Prime are extensive enough that it exceeds current staff capacity
  • Creation of TDPS mobile broadcast capabilities. Currently David can broadcast "from" remote locations "to" the Boston, studio, which is limiting in many ways. To truly do remote broadcasts, we need the ability to edit the program remotely. This will greatly expand our activism capabilities by being able to produce a full show from anywhere without being tied to the technology and staff physically in the Boston studio.
  • Addition of long form interviews with brilliant progressive minds who can truly equip us to be change agents, and also teach us how to most effectively lobby for progressive change.

How can you help?

Please donate what you can! Share the campaign on social media, via email, to friends and family, to anybody that understands the predicament progressives are currently in! Repost and share YouTube videos, including those talking about this campaign. Read at the bottom for a referral contest!

We have tremendous perks for those willing to contribute to the campaign. Check them out!

Get the total package!

Hang Out with David at TDPS Studios!

Yes, come to TDPS studios where David will give you a personal studio tour. Then, hang out while we do a taping of The David Pakman Show!

Get a Piece of TDPS History!

David has been talking into this microphone for YEARS...and it can be yours!
 

Let us answer your calls!

How will you explain this to your friends and family?

Guest Host The David Pakman Show!

If you LIKE the show, why not participate in it?

Perk Pictures

2017 TDPS Calendar
Exclusive "Established in 2005 t-shirt"
Exclusive "Hatriot Mail" t-shirt"
TDPS Hoodie sweatshirt
TDPS men's style t-shirt
TDPS women's style t-shirt
 

The Contest

There's also a CONTEST in conjunction with our campaign!

Log into your Indiegogo account and share our campaign with your friends, family and followers using the Facebook or Twitter buttons on our campaign page! The top five people who refer the MOST contributions will win an extra special gift! What is it? A FREE "Complete Package" perk, valued at $299!

The David Pakman Show (TDPS) started in 2005, then called "Midweek Politics," as a community radio show and podcast in Northampton, Massachusetts. We expanded through radio syndication through 2009, when the television and video version of the show started, airing on YouTube, on public access television stations, and ultimately on Free Speech TV on DirecTV and DISH Network. Since then, distribution has grown to 200 radio and television stations across the US, a hugely successful podcast, over 260,000 subscribers and 7 million monthly views on YouTube, and as the nightly Monday-Friday 11pm EST program on Free Speech TV (DirecTV& DISH Network).

Visit us at our website: www.davidpakman.com
Subscribe to our YouTube channel: www.YouTube.com/thedavidpakman.com

What are your plans for the studio improvements?

  • We have already received proposals from a studio design company that are AWESOME! The next step is raising the money, and we'll be off and running with our new set. It will continue to be a simple look, but significantly more professional, in addition to allowing for more advanced technical production

When will I get my stuff?

  • We've set up delivery estimates for all perks, listed within the perk description on the right side of the campaign page. These are estimates and can vary depending on shipping location. We will do our best to get all perks to you as quickly as possible!

How can I get David to record my voicemail greeting?

  • There are two ways: (1) David can record the voicemail greeting from a script you write in our studio and we will send it to you as an MP3, which you can then play into your phone when setting your greeting. (2) You can send us your phone number and voicemail code, which will allow us to record the greeting into your voicemail directly.

How can I give away the memberships in the 10-membership perk?

  • We will give you a code that you can send to your gift membership recipients. They can then use that code when signing up for membership, making it free for a year!

If I buy the "lifetime membership" perk but am already a member, what happens?

  • You can cancel your prior membership, because you'll be a member for life!

How will we figure out when the "guest host the show" or "guest host the Bonus Show" perks will happen?

  • We will work with you to determine what date will work for both you and our filming schedule

How do we work out the studio or camera dedication?

  • We will work directly with you after the close of the campaign to finalize details, and then we'll take care of everything! TDPS reserves final approval rights on all naming.

I have a great idea for a perk. Who can I tell?

  • Please use the contact form on this page: https://davidpakman.com/contact/

story:
"Don't Cry Over Spilt Eggnog" is a story about a tortured soul named Jarvis. Jarvis lives as a homeless man even though he has the resources to live a normal life. One night his sister Tracy ( who loves Jarvis very much ) and his sister Charlie (who is an uncaring bitch ) have Jarvis over to Tracy's trailer for an intervention to try to help him get off of the streets. Things do not go as Tracy planned, and an odd series of horrific events take place, revealing a dark secret about Jarvis. This is a short film with an estimated running time of 12-15 mins long.

My name is Michael Patrick Rogers and I am the writer/director of "Don't Cry Over Spilt Eggnog". I am an indie game producer known for making really strange games based on personal experiences using dark atmosphere and unique characters. I've released two games on the Steam platform ("The Lady"  and "The Grandfather" ) and am currently working on my third, I've sold nearly 20K games since Jan of 2015. "Don't Cry Over Spilt Eggnog" will be my first film under the same label as my games, and is an extension of the style of storytelling that I use in my games. To give you an idea of my storytelling style here is an example from my current release "The Grandfather", this is the short film version of the game. Some of my biggest influences include David Lynch, John Carpenter, Rob Zombie, Wes Craven, and Paul Thomas Anderson.
​
WE ARE FILMING ON MAY 6TH, PLEASE FOLLOW THE FILM ON FACEBOOK!

 

Meet the Actors

Jarvis is being portrayed by Chip Carriere 

 Chip is a diverse actor with a background in theater and vocal groups, this will be Chip's darkest and most emotionally challenging role to date. Some of Chip's credits include Zoo (CBS), NCIS New Orleans, Focus, Joe Dirt 2, and Underground. 

Tracy is being portrayed by Rachel Whittle 

Rachel is a powerful actress who's range is very impressive, her range will be on full display in her portrayal of Tracy. Some of Rachel's credits include the lead in an upcoming Lifetime movie called "Mother of the Year", Scream the TV series (MTV), Zombie Shark (SyFy), and Cryptid: The Swamp Best. 

Charlie is being portrayed by Amy Wickenheiser 

Amy is an actress from Regina Saskatchewan , some of her credits include The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn  Part 2, and The Shelter. Amy and Rachel are real life close friends, which will make great chemistry for the "loving sister/bitch sister" contrast in the script. 


 

Challenges, Festival Goals and BEYOND!

My goal with this film is to create an intriguing piece of story telling and bring it to the Film Festival circuit to be seen by as big of an audience as possible. I also intend to pitch the main character/concept for feature film or episodic development, as Jarvis is a complex character that could go in so many different directions. Some of the festivals I will be submitting to include the New Orleans Film Festival, SXSW, Toronto Film Fest, Sundance, Tribeca, AFI, Rhode Island Film Fest, Palm Springs Film Fest, Aspen ShortFest, Austin Film Fest, Telluride, and many more.

  • What if we don't reach our goal of $3000? Your funds will still go towards getting the film made, when I want to get something done I get it done and I ALWAYS  find a way. As a game developer it is part of my job to be a problem solver, filmmaking is very much the same thing, problem solving. If I am unable to get the film fully funded for $3k I will have to put on my problem solving hat and find a cheaper way to make the film. This would compromise the overall quality of the final product, which is something I would hate to do, I feel it would not be fair to the actors or the story, and this is why I am asking for help on IndieGoGo. 

Other Ways You Can Help

One way to help is to follow the film on Facebook and to share our campaign on Facebook/Twitter and all of your social media. Please consider using the IndieGoGo sharing tools to let your friends know about our campaign. In  addition to this IndieGoGo campaign, we have a separate ongoing GoFundMe specifically for helping fund our festival submissions, which can add up and be very expensive, $5 on our GoFundMe will go a long way in helping, and there's also a simple $20 reward on the GoFundMe which will secure you a digital download of the film (after our festival run). 


Thank you for taking the time to read our campaign, I hope you will consider helping out in anyway you can by choosing a reward from the Perks section, and please feel free to email me with any questions about the film at MPRart@Gmail.com

Follow Michael Patrick Rogers on Twitter

Follow Michael Patrick Rogers on Instagram 

Follow Michael Patrick Rogers on Snapchat @ IEatWaffleHouse

In  addition to this IndieGoGo campaign, we have a separate ongoing GoFundMe specifically for helping fund our festival submissions, which can add up and be very expensive, $5 on our GoFundMe will go a long way in helping, and there's also a simple $20 reward on the GoFundMe which will secure you a digital download of the film (after our festival run). Thank you for taking the time to read our campaign, I hope you will consider helping out in anyway you can by choosing a reward from the Perks section, and please feel free to email me with any questions about the film at MPRart@Gmail.comFollow Michael Patrick Rogers on TwitterFollow Michael Patrick Rogers on Instagram Follow Michael Patrick Rogers on Snapchat @ IEatWaffleHouse

story:
Short Summary

 We come from different places such as Italy, Spain, Portugal and Greece, and have all converged in the colourful and multicultural city of Barcelona to pursue careers in the art and movie industry.

 Our backgrounds are varied, we have members with experience in film and television, some that work in the theater and others from such areas as fine arts, psychology, advertising, fashion design and architecture. We are also working with first-time actors for the roles of the children, which is a challenge we are eager to undertake.

 This campaign aims to take our concept to a higher level of production, shooting with higher value and image quality all-around. We believe we have a unique idea that, if invested in, could find its way into movie festival circuits and the hearts of auteur film-enthusiasts around the world. It means a lot to us as young people who want to build a career in this area, to have this kind of visibility and recognition for our work.

 We want to explore some very personal themes in human relations, such as the frailty of childhood when exposed to the harshness of the real world, and feelings of displacement and loss in life, as one approaches death.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 We need at least an additional 5000 euros to cover the expenses of production.

  • Since this will be a very visual story with a lot of set manipulation, we have 1000 euros projected just for art direction, for things such as set design and materials to use on set.
  • Another 1000 will be for make-up, costumes and lighting.
  • The biggest part of our budget (at least 2000) will go towards the rental of film equipment to improve the quality of the finished project. A high quality camera with screen, equipment to make travelling-shots possible and sound equipment are among the things we will invest in.
  • 500 euros will be directed to the distribution of the movie once its finished, meaning the entrance fees for prestigious festivals,
  • the remaining 500 will be for the catering and travel fees for the cast and crew.

 

 How do you make a movie out of an idea, a picture or even a word?

The process of making an independent movie from scratch is a journey we are happy to share with you, from concept art to film, passing by script, location scouting, castings, storyboarding and gathering the crew. Meet us for the shooting and be a part of this project, attend the premiere and have dinner with the team, get one of our exclusive posters signed by the whole team!

 Any funding will help us improve the quality of our original idea, so any money we can gather from this platform will be put into that. If we fail to achieve our goal we will direct the money towards what we consider to be the priorities to improve the quality of the movie.

 

The Impact

This project reflects the paradigm of the independent filmmaking circuit, from which stem numerous personal and thought-provoking ideas, that try to break through the layer of commonality that exists in the mainstream.

We want to make something that is equal parts enjoyable and distressing, something that does not leave the viewer indifferent after watching it, because that is the cinema we love and the one we would love to see more of.

This speaks to the forgotten child in all of us, the one we hid from the world in order to protect it. It delves into the things that scorched us as children, our traumas, and how we learn to deal with them.

 

Risks & Challenges

An independent production is always a volatile thing, everyone is working for free on the time they have off from their jobs and public locations are always hard to control. We are however very confident in our preparation and in the team we have working on this project, we are already in a rehearsal stage and we see things going very smoothly during shooting and post-production.

We have planned everything obsessively since October of last year and have already spoken to all the entities that allow for shooting on location, so everything is ready for shooting.

Cast Crew

 

Crew

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like our idea but are unable to donate, you can still help us by spreading the word about our project! Check our facebook page out on this link:  https://www.facebook.com/thelabyrinthBCN/?ref=a... 

Don´t forget to use the Indiegogo share tool too!

We thank you very much for your support!

story:
What Makes This Project Unique

Marina Aguerre is a senior film production student at the Loyola Marymount University School of Film and Television with a background in theatre and visual arts. She is also an avid gamer and personally understands the implications of creating entire relationships online. This short film has been 2 years in the making.

We are creating a short film that pools together the different incredible talents available to us from our peer group, including 3-D Animation by a team of students, graphics by an LMU alumn, original score by a multi-instrumental musician, and visual design by a group of experienced filmmakers. 

This project is unique in that we include artists from all backgrounds to create a diverse and distinguished crew. Your help will ensure that we can provide each artist involved with the necessary tools to render an artistic, visually striking story.

The Story That Drives It All

Lonely videogame-wiz Luke (22) wins an underground Gods of Gaia tournament, landing him respect among the gaming community, and a hefty cash prize of $8,000. When he is approached after class by Robin - a beautiful fan - he cannot resist the attention and agrees to meet her late that night. Luke soon finds out that in real life, things may not always be as they seem. People hold dark secrets that come out in times of desperation, and without a screen between them, how will Luke stay safe?

Why We Need Your Help

Several students have been offered payment to complete a challenging task within a short timeframe, while simultaneously handling a full load of classes and extracurriculars. We value their time and understand compensation can greatly help the process, especially for students who take time off work for this project.

Since the visual feel is futuristic and very specific in terms of color and lighting, production design is taking a huge chunk of our budget.

Your donations will allow us to respect students' time and energy, and ensure that we can produce the project to its full visual potential.

The Impact

Every day people meet on the internet, through dating sites or social media sites or even gaming sites like MMORPGs (Massive Multiplayer Online Roleplaying Games). We have gotten comfortable with the idea of building entire relationships without actually speaking face to face. While this creates a global community and connects people who would otherwise never meet, it also puts us in an incredibly vulnerable position, oftentimes without realizing it.

Identity theft, cyber bullying, hurtful statements said under the veil of internet anonymity... These are just some of the dangers we face from blatantly trusting strangers - something we would be hesitant to do in real life.

By exploring the real life implications of a character living entirely online, we hope you will question yourself: how many of your friendships and relationships actually involve human contact? How do you know who you can trust online

Other Ways You Can Help

Monetary contribution is not at the top of our list! More than donations, we want you to spread word and make some noise about this unique project.

Share this campaign with your friends, family, gaming buddies...

and start the conversation. Make people question their Online Lives.

We are so grateful for any help you can provide, and we can't wait to share this short film with you.

story:
Synopsis

The latest work of occult artist Miki Aurora, Death, Resurrection, Ascenion marks the artist’s premier foray into the medium of film with a work that blurs the divide between arthouse movie and documentary. A sea of glitches floods the visual landscape of the work--documented on security cameras-- causing the movements of the characters, a ritualist (Aurora), and a seeker, engaged in a sacred rite, to merge with the aether of the surrounding, sterile room.

Throughout the course of the ceremony, the two women oscillate between various frontiers of the seeker’s psyche, as Aurora engages with occult technologies in an effort to aid in the excavation process of psychological trauma from within the subconscious mind of her cohort. As her layers unfold, a window into the shrouded world of the ritual arts is opened, a world rich with canonical visions, and iconography surrounding the work’s scriptural namesake--told through the swan song of one woman’s archetypal sorrow.

story:
LILI'S MIRACLE (A SIGN LENGUAGUE SHORTFILM)

 

Lili, Soledad and Ofelia are three young deaf women, who live in La Casona, a cocoa farm located in a lost bay on the coasts of Venezuela that can only be reached by boat. The communication between the girls and Augusto; The farm owner; Is a constant uncertainty. He does not know how to speak in sign language and they don't know how to read or write. In spite of this, the young women take care of all the domestic work in the Casona.

One day an accident happened  in the cocoa farm and Augusto is forced to look for help in the nearest town. He meets Margarita, a hypoacusic photographer, an expert in sign language who thanks to a cochlear implant can speak and listen perfectly. She will have the difficult task of teaching each one of the girls to communicate through the Venezuelan sign language. However, the arrival of Margarita will encourage Lili, Soledad and Ofelia to start a revolution that will break with the orthodox rules of Augusto. The Girls will have to decide if they stay on the farm under Augusto's rules or go out and discover what's beyond the sea.

-

This is a story about the fear to the unknow but also it’s a story about accepting yourself the way you are. Why is this so important? Well, this will be a Sign language shortfilm and we want to create conscience about deaf culture, to encourage people to learn sign lenguague.

When I came up with the idea of ​​telling a story about a group of girls who live with auditory sensory diversity, but nevertheless are capable enough to keep a whole cacao farm afloat, i started to realize that deep down I was writing a story about discoveries.

Despite being a photographer, I have always believed that the script is the most important thing before making a film and for that reason I took the decision with Gabriel Marín; Co-writer, to dedicate as much time as possible to write the script. So, after a year of constant questioning about story and a lot of trial and error, we achieved a final version.

My intention with our film is to create awareness about the deaf culture so that the listeners learn to speak more with our hands and less with our mouth. That way we can realize that as much as we worry about learning another language, we can learn sign language too. And the same way try to speak with any foreigner, we take the time and effort to speak with our deaf brothers. Because deafness is not an inability but a lifestyle. And if they are able to overcome all their fears despite their lifestyle, why cant we be able to overcome ours?

CAST

CREW

WHAT WE NEED?

We're trying to raise $5,000 to cover production and post-production costs of the shortfilm.

WHERE THE MONEY WILL GO?

REWARDS

If you help us, you will have wonderful rewards  that includes Venezuelan Cocoa (The best cocoa in the world) and exclusive updates from the shortfilm and much more. Be sure to check out our list of perks in exchange for your donations.

FAQ

When do I receive my perks?

We will begin to send our perks (only cocoa) on April 2017 via DHL, the Blu-ray copies will be sent on july 2017.

When will the film be finished?

We will finish the short film on july 2017 after all production and post-production process are done.

What will we do with the exceeded goal money? (in that case)

Use it for the promotional and distribution purposes of the film as film festival entries, printing press kits, photo books and why not? Travel to film festivals if it’s possible.

What if I can’t support with money?

Every single help is very important to us, share our project through social media in FB an IG.

RISE YOUR HANDS TO THE WORLD

We're super-appreciative of your donations, and we'd also love you to share this page and tell your friends about our Project. Also you can get more information about this Project on:

INSTAGRAM: @miracleforlili

FACEBOOK: /milagrodelili 

If you have any doubts or questions about the project or the rewards You can write us to our mail: Lilismiracleshortfilm@gmail.com

 

¡THANKS FOR BELIEVING¡

story:
About the film

PINK is an upcoming short, it's a story about a drug deal gone wrong. After three petty criminals are trapped in a warehouse by an unseen entity, the group accidentally inhale a new powerful drug called PINK, now the group must escape before the psychedelic substance kicks in and they start losing there minds.... 

PINK's overall goal is to recreate the wild and anarchic style of transgressive cinema that was last seen during the '70s.  In recreating a style of cinema that was both wild and brimming with ideas, our film PINK takes on a number of different influences, both thematically and from the written word. The colourful, violently vivid and baroque films of Dario Argento provided a huge inspiration for PINK. The works of cosmic writer H.P. Lovecraft have also proven a large influence towards our film. Due to part of our film dealing with mind expanding drugs, Lovecraft's stories of cosmic terror serve as the prime inspiration. Combining these main influences as well as our unique approach to our film genre, PINK is a thrilling, dark and psychedelic new breed of film that we have dubbed: 'Acid Thriller'.

PINK will be 10-15 minutes long and shot and edited between the months of February & May around Portsmouth, England. It is planned to be premiered at the BFI and will be shown at various other film industry events.

 

Where's is the money going?

All donations will be spent on:

  • CAST & CREW: this includes transport for our professional actors to come down to Portsmouth for the shoot, accommodation for them to stay during the filming (due to filming early hours of the morning) and food to keep them fed.
  • PROPS: make up and practical effects: PINK will feature a number of practical effects which will require us to hire make up artists and the various materials to make these effects come to life. Some of the props include vehicles, weapons, chemistry equipment and various other pieces of set dressing.
  • LOCATION AND FEES: Due to the nature of our film, Pink will take place in a number of bizarre and atmospheric locations, these locations include a military fort, World War 2 tunnels, and potentially a closed down casino.

 

The Impact

Your donations will go towards making this the best possible way of achieving the purest vision of the film. Our film PINK will be made regardless, but the contributions we receive will go towards improving the visuals of the film. This includes the special effects, locations as well as the overall production of the film.

Your donations will really help us achieve our dream for this film, without your support we wouldn't be able to film the entire production at night or get skilled actors involved. Money in this case is essentially due to location cost and putting our actors up in hotels as we plan to film early hours of the morning in remote locations. PINK also requires a number of props such as a cross bow, a car and chemistry equipment.

     

    Risks & Challenges

    Most of the challenges we as a group face are to do with locations, the first is the fees of some of the potential locations. Ensuring we obtain the locations is a huge aspect that will ultimately determine the success of our film. Equipment hire and cast availability as well as working to a tight deadline all serve as existing changes that we as a group must face. To ensure quality is not lost we have created a tight schedule that takes into consideration filming on locations and the number of days it will take to shoot PINK. We have one of the top editors who will ensure all visual effects and colour will be the best it can be. We will be shooting on an Arri Alexa, which is provided by the University of Portsmouth.

     

    Who are we?

    We're a group of students looking for funding for our graduate film PINK. We want to make a dark psychedelic thriller short film. Our crew includes:

    Paolo Orza

    Director/ Writer

    Bio: Born in Islington, London. Writer, Director Paolo Orza is responsible for a number of short slasher films, one of which was banned on its premiere, due to its extreme content. Other works include writing, directing and editing a number of dark surrealist animations, along with left leaning political documentaries. Orza’s latest work saw him producing horror short Horrible Things, which is currently on festival tour.

     

    Dawn Tracey

    Producer

    Bio: Born near Croydon London; Producer, Dawn Tracey is accountable for putting together a creative and talented cast and crew, and being responsible for all aspects of a film's production. Dawn has taken on the role of Producer in numerous short films in and outside of her educational degree. This alone emphases and exhibits her passion and commitment within the role, demonstrating the ability and skillset which enables a profitable successful film.

     

    Perry Higgins

    Editor/ Assistant Director

    Bio: Perry grew up in Essex, England and is mostly know for his 2nd year production "A Ride with the Buffalo" 2016, Perry is mostly focused on post production but has also had credits for producing, directing and sound recording.

    Josh Tysoe

    DOP/ Script editor

    BIO: Born in Mansfield, Nottinghamshire, Tysoe's focus is largely on horror. His last film was Horrible Things, which he directed alongside Producer Paolo Orza: https://vimeo.com/170358234

    Gabriel Alejandro Perez Yegres

    Key Grip/ Line Producer

    Bio: Gabriel Alejandro has been dreaming of film making since he was a child, he's worked on a number of short movies since he was in high school but his latest was the short comedy film 'Sh*t just got real'. Gabriel Alejandro has had the luxury of living his life alternating between England and the United States. He's very excited to work behind the scenes on 'Pink' because of it's unique genre and visual style.

     

    Qiang Qiu

    Sound Recordist

    A Chinese student studying Television and Film Production at the University of Portsmouth, he likes to travel and shoot films. He often makes videos with his friends in places to which he has traveled. He used to study photography for three years.

    How can you help?

    We've got all sorts of unusual social media up and running. A donation of any amount to help fund our film would mean the world to us. Share the trip and support us by liking and sharing our Facebook page, which will keep you up to date with everything PINK! 

    https://www.facebook.com/PINKshortmovie/

    https://twitter.com/PinKofficalfilm

    https://www.youtube.com/channel/UClnhKdA9uhS08au7jXT6mPg
