Where's is the money going?
All donations will be spent on:

CAST & CREW: this includes transport for our professional actors to come down to Portsmouth for the shoot, accommodation for them to stay during the filming (due to filming early hours of the morning) and food to keep them fed.
PROPS: make up and practical effects: PINK will feature a number of practical effects which will require us to hire make up artists and the various materials to make these effects come to life. Some of the props include vehicles, weapons, chemistry equipment and various other pieces of set dressing.
LOCATION AND FEES: Due to the nature of our film, Pink will take place in a number of bizarre and atmospheric locations, these locations include a military fort, World War 2 tunnels, and potentially a closed down casino.



 
The Impact
Your donations will go towards making this the best possible way of achieving the purest vision of the film. Our film PINK will be made regardless, but the contributions we receive will go towards improving the visuals of the film. This includes the special effects, locations as well as the overall production of the film.
Your donations will really help us achieve our dream for this film, without your support we wouldn't be able to film the entire production at night or get skilled actors involved. Money in this case is essentially due to location cost and putting our actors up in hotels as we plan to film early hours of the morning in remote locations. PINK also requires a number of props such as a cross bow, a car and chemistry equipment.



 
Risks & Challenges
Most of the challenges we as a group face are to do with locations, the first is the fees of some of the potential locations. Ensuring we obtain the locations is a huge aspect that will ultimately determine the success of our film. Equipment hire and cast availability as well as working to a tight deadline all serve as existing changes that we as a group must face. To ensure quality is not lost we have created a tight schedule that takes into consideration filming on locations and the number of days it will take to shoot PINK. We have one of the top editors who will ensure all visual effects and colour will be the best it can be. We will be shooting on an Arri Alexa, which is provided by the University of Portsmouth.

 
Who are we?
We're a group of students looking for funding for our graduate film PINK. We want to make a dark psychedelic thriller short film. Our crew includes:
Paolo Orza

Director/ Writer
Bio: Born in Islington, London. Writer, Director Paolo Orza is responsible for a number of short slasher films, one of which was banned on its premiere, due to its extreme content. Other works include writing, directing and editing a number of dark surrealist animations, along with left leaning political documentaries. Orza’s latest work saw him producing horror short Horrible Things, which is currently on festival tour.
 
Dawn Tracey

Producer
Bio: Born near Croydon London; Producer, Dawn Tracey is accountable for putting together a creative and talented cast and crew, and being responsible for all aspects of a film's production. Dawn has taken on the role of Producer in numerous short films in and outside of her educational degree. This alone emphases and exhibits her passion and commitment within the role, demonstrating the ability and skillset which enables a profitable successful film.
 
Perry Higgins

Editor/ Assistant Director
Bio: Perry grew up in Essex, England and is mostly know for his 2nd year production "A Ride with the Buffalo" 2016, Perry is mostly focused on post production but has also had credits for producing, directing and sound recording.
Josh Tysoe

DOP/ Script editor
BIO: Born in Mansfield, Nottinghamshire, Tysoe's focus is largely on horror. His last film was Horrible Things, which he directed alongside Producer Paolo Orza: https://vimeo.com/170358234
Gabriel Alejandro Perez Yegres

Key Grip/ Line Producer
Bio: Gabriel Alejandro has been dreaming of film making since he was a child, he's worked on a number of short movies since he was in high school but his latest was the short comedy film 'Sh*t just got real'. Gabriel Alejandro has had the luxury of living his life alternating between England and the United States. He's very excited to work behind the scenes on 'Pink' because of it's unique genre and visual style.
 
Qiang Qiu 

Sound Recordist
A Chinese student studying Television and Film Production at the University of Portsmouth, he likes to travel and shoot films. He often makes videos with his friends in places to which he has traveled. He used to study photography for three years.

How can you help?
We've got all sorts of unusual social media up and running. A donation of any amount to help fund our film would mean the world to us. Share the trip and support us by liking and sharing our Facebook page, which will keep you up to date with everything PINK! 
https://www.facebook.com/PINKshortmovie/
https://twitter.com/PinKofficalfilm
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UClnhKdA9uhS08au7jXT6mPg

story:
What You Need To Know:

We're making a feature length comedy film and we need your help. A starting cost of $30K to be exact. 

We called in a lot of favors and shot the above concept trailer for $1k. Imagine what we can do with an initial $30K! As you can see, we are passionate about filmmaking and comedy. Let's make this happen!

Our team has been working together for 5 years. We have written and produced hundreds of comedy shorts and sketches on various digital platforms. Our group has had material selected at the 2015 Salt Lake City Comedy Carnival Festival and has won the 2015 iO West 48 Hour Comedy Film Competition.  It's been a lot of fun, and now it's time to take our talents to the next level. We are shooting a feature film and we want to do it right. That means hiring crew, renting gear, paying our talented actors, and securing must-have locations. 

More About The Story:

The Impact

We have spent over a year collectively working on this project. From joke punch-ups, table reads, pre-production meetings, and trailer shoots, there are a growing number of people involved with this film. Here's an example of what one of them has to say:

"There's a sense of Workaholics, The Hangover, and There's Something About Mary with a Judd Apatow vibe that is infused in the writing." -Tory  Devon Smith, Actor: Netflix's The Get Down

Additionally, our screenplay has been accepted in the Portland Comedy Film Fest!

 

Risks & Challenges

Making a film is hard work. Not everything goes as planned. We are aware of the challenges and the need to grow and adapt during the creative process. The risks of independent filmmaking are lack of funding, minimal resources, playing within actor and crew union rules, needing to call in favors, and marketing the film in an over saturated industry. By pledging funds to this project, you will help us achieve our goal. 

How do we find success? With originality, boundary-pushing jokes and scenes, proper itemized budgeting, deferring payments to the creative team, utilizing locations we already have access to, and trusting in each others' abilities to get the job done right!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share, share, share our campaign! Like us on Facebook, share the trailer, tweet it out, and share this page!

story:
THE STORY

Devotion is a suspenseful drama that focuses on a heroin addict named Desi Larkin who moves back home with his mother Rose Larkin while he becomes the lead suspect in his wife's suspicious death.

Desi has been in and out of rehab for about a decade. His bouts with the drug have been extremely taxing on Rose, who always envisioned Desi going on to do something exceptional with his life.

Desi seemed to find something of a balance in his life when he met Jade, another longtime heroin addict, in rehab. They shared a common bond through their battles with drug addiction and depression, and helped each other stay clean. Yet as time went by, they found themselves giving in to their demons once again, and it’s in the midst of this relapse period that Jade turns up dead.

While Desi finds himself back in his mother’s care for the first time in years, a veteran detective attempts to discover the truth behind what happened to Jade…

HOW YOU CAN HELP!

There are a number of ways you can help bring Devotion to the big screen in 2018. We'll be filming the feature in the Detroit, Michigan area this September. We're currently in the process of looking for some additional crew and talent based in Michigan for the shoot. If you're available and able or you know anyone available and able, we'd love to be connected. We have an array of different side characters to cast, the biggest need being women in their 50s/60s to play Rose’s friends, and we’ll need help in various areas of production during the shoot.

We're also in the midst of securing locations for the film. We're looking for a few more houses to use and we're in need of a dive bar and an office room as well. 

You can also help by spreading this campaign around. Follow us on social media (devotion2018 on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter) and share the link to this page with your friends and followers.

Any donations you make to the crowdfunding campaign will go a long way in supporting the production. The primary cost of the production will be equipment but we also need funds to feed our cast and crew on set and for transportation and housing for some of our out of town cast and crew members. There'll also be several costs associated with post-production, after the film is cut, such as sound mixing. Following that, we'll need to pay for festival submissions and most likely publicity.

THE BIG PICTURE  

The hope with Devotion is that it will have a strong run in prominent film festivals that will lead to it being purchased by a distributer. It will then have a theatrical run before becoming available through streaming services. 

Amazon and Netflix are bloodthirsty for standout indie films. Here's a great Wired article about their approaches, after their active purchasing at Sundance in 2016:

https://www.wired.com/2016/01/netflix-and-amazon-offer-indie-filmmakers-hope-and-lots-of-money/

Films are meant to be seen on the big screen amongst a crowd of other filmgoers. We know the film will have interest from a streaming distribution standpoint, but we want more. We want the film to be shown in as many theaters across the nation as possible.

MEET THE TEAM!

Andrew Ericksen – Writer/Director

Andrew's written several feature film scripts, one of which was a Second Round Selection at the 2016 Austin Film Festival. He studied film and English at the University of Michigan, where he worked on a number of short films as a writer, director, director of photography and editor. Since graduating in 2011, he's lived in Los Angeles, working on various film projects. Devotion will be his feature film directorial debut. 

Greg Davis - Producer

After making the move to Los Angeles, Greg found his passion for on-hands production in all phases of the movie-making process. He was a producer on the 2017 feature film Drifter, which secured distribution in the U.S. and abroad, including a limited theatrical release this February. He has also worked on a number of short films as a producer and production manager. 

Taylor Holland - Director of Photography

Taylor graduated cum laude with a degree in Television and Film production from the University of Alabama. He works as the lead Videographer/Editor for Circa News in the L.A. Bureau.  He moved to Los Angeles with the intent to become an Editor, but soon realized his passion for visual storytelling couldn't be limited to a single role.  Taylor has helmed many projects as a freelancer ranging from commercial advertisements to music videos.  As a Director of Photography, he uses his experience in all aspects of production to help bring an image to life. Taylor recently worked as a Producer, Director of Photography, and Editor on a short film that he has set to release this year.

Rachel Pietron – Producer

Rachel has always been drawn to storytelling and as a result spent much of her childhood traversing the fields of Gondor and treasure hunting with Dr. Henry Jones. Equipped with a BA in English Literature and a JD she is delighted to do her part in telling this unique story. 

Vicky Dawson – “Rose Larkin”

Vicky is very excited to be a part of the Devotion team! She has worked as an actor and director in theater, TV and film for over 40 years but counts her kids Josh, Hannah and Grace as her best productions.

Aria Emory – “Desi Larkin”

Aria graduated from Marquette University with a BA in Broadcasting and is a former member of the Repertory Theater Company, Playhouse West, a West Coast division of Sandy Meisner's Neighborhood Playhouse. He played leading roles in the feature films Drifter, Sleepless and I Believe, which he starred in alongside Tom Sizemore. He is currently off in England getting an MA in Screen Acting at the University of the Arts Drama Centre London. 

Rebecca Fraiser - "Jade Larkin"

Rebecca grew up in Mississippi. She attended Mississippi State University where she studied Broadcast Journalism and Theatre. Shortly after attending college she moved to Los Angeles to pursue a career in acting. She received her first break in 2010 from director Sophia Coppola in the film Somewhere. She has since starred in numerous short and feature length films. She made her television debut on HBO's Project Greenlight. In 2015, she was selected as an "up and rising star" at the Cannes Film Festival. Her recent work includes a television pilot and comedy feature she shot this past fall. She also stars in the post apocalyptic film Drifter, released on Feb 24th.

Peter Lownds - "Detective Cain"

A veteran of both Off-Broadway and Hollywood combat, Dr. Lownds went back to grad school in his fifties and got an M.A. in Latin American Studies and a Ph.D. in Social Science and Comparative Education from UCLA.  Now he's  returning to his first love (acting) with the verve of a seasoned amateur. 

Hadley Alley - Script Supervisor

Hadley is a film enthusiast who ended up living in Los Angeles by way of Portland, OR. As a monumental consumer of entertainment he decided it was only fitting to pursue a career in the industry. He considers himself on "active duty" within the entertainment business and can be seen wearing a number of hats.

Drew O'Donnell - Sound Recorder

Drew is a Los Angeles native passionate about sound and great story telling. Currently devoted to speaker design and psychoacoustics. He loves the freqs so much it hz.

DIRECTOR'S NOTE

My name's Andrew Ericksen. I'm the writer/director of Devotion. 

I love all kinds of films from absurd comedies to heavy dramas to off the wall horrors, etc. I've been writing feature length scripts since college, with the focus of writing unique and fresh stories fueled by strong, complex characters. I love delving deep into a character's psyche, putting them in difficult situations that challenge their comfort zones and force them to grow. Crime dramas, psychological thrillers and suspense films come most natural to me.

Devotion is the first feature length script I've written with the plan of filming myself. 

At the heart of Devotion are two extremely different people who are connected solely by their mother/son relationship. They've had to overcome their differences throughout their respective lives, but as our feature begins, they go through their most trying period as Desi is investigated for the murder of his wife, while he lives under his mother's roof for the first time in years. 

Devotion is a harrowing story at times. Definitely not something suitable for all ages and definitely not meant to be casually watched while you take care of your taxes or grill some burgers or whatever you do while you pop on Netflix. It's an engaging story that asks its audience to question A) whether or not Desi is innocent and B) whether Desi and Rose will be able to find harmony while they live together again.

I wrote the script with a few things in mind in terms of minimizing the budget. For Rose Larkin's house, we'll be filming at my parents' house in Huntington Woods, Michigan, the house I primarily grew up in. We'll also be using locations provided by other friends and family members in the metro Detroit area. 

There were two main reasons why we filmed the trailer for Devotion.

1) Even though, as I said above, I wrote the feature with a microbudget in mind, we still do need something of a budget. The $5K we're hoping to raise isn't the entire budget. I've been working double duty as the COO of the website FamousBirthdays.com and as a Lyft driver extraordinaire for the past year to build a substantial base for the film's budget, but being the COO of a startup and a contract worker chauffeur can only go so far. 

We needed some visual component to help launch this campaign to help give an idea of the world we’re capable of creating and the style and tone of the project as a whole. 

2) Apart from just providing a style and tonal aide for anyone viewing this crowdfunding campaign, the trailer also helps me and the rest of the team get a feel for what works and what doesn’t work in terms of the project, the trailer being sort of like a short rough draft of the feature in a lot of ways. So when we begin filming the feature this fall, we’ll already have had the preparatory steps of the trailer behind us.  

I believe we have a very compelling, thought-provoking and important story to tell. If there's anything we can do to better present our vision or goals for the film, please don't be afraid to contact me at andrew@anticoplaya.com. We’d love to hear any thoughts you have. 

TRAILER CREDITS

“Devotion Trailer”

Vicky Dawson – Rose Larkin

Aria Emory – Desi Larkin

Rebecca Fraiser – Jade Larkin

Peter Lownds – Detective Cain

Jamie Saavedra – Valerie

 

Directed by Andrew Ericksen

Produced by Greg Davis, Andrew Ericksen and Rachel Pietron

Director of Photography – Taylor Holland

Script Supervisor – Hadley Alley

1st AC/Key Grip/Gaffer – Kelly Wourms

Grip/Gaffer – Josh Bayer

Makeup Artist – Jenny Goldberg

2nd Makeup Artist – Michaela Ginter

Sound Operator – Drew O’Donnell

Assistant Director – Rachel Pietron

Production Design – Rachel Pietron

Production Assistants – Ashley Tolusic, Brittany Boxley

Editor – Josh Bayer

Colorist – Taylor Holland

Music by Nico Grossfeld

Special thanks to: Sid Mitra, Robert Paris, Alfie, Clancy, Grey Thing and White Thing for letting us intrude your respective house; Tommy Souza for providing several pieces of art for the shoot; Josh Gardner for some key consulting; and Thomas and Vidcam for the equipment and for helping us find an adequate replacement for those behemoth flags that can fit into no standard car man has ever built.

story:
About This Film

Synopsis

Upload follows Dr.James Green, a neuroscientist, and his wife Meredith, whose health has fallen into a state he fears she can't come back from. Frantic and out of options, Dr.James acquires the help of a promising young student to help him defy mortality and ethics. Ultimately, James must choose whether he should play God or do what he knows is right. 

  • Alabama isn't often thought of to be the hub of technological break-throughs. This film wants to reshape that ideal. 
  • This film is important to many crew and cast members. We owe it to them and this story to make it as great as it deserves to be.
  • As student filmmakers,  creating a great sci-fi short is no easy task. That is why we need your help!

Funding

  • Funding in this film will go towards
  • Lodging out of town actors
  • Equipment rentals
  • Craft Services for our cast and crew.
  • Production Design and Props
  • Entrance into Film Festivals 
  • Wardrobe
  • Marketing

Our Crew

Our crew will be comprised of undergraduate students completing their degrees in Media Production at the University of Alabama. Many of these students plan to go on to Los Angeles, Atlanta, New York, etc. to start their careers in the entertainment industry. 

Risks & Challenges

A common challenge in student films is a limited production value due to a lack of funding. Upload is no exception to this, but with your help and the hard work of our talented cast and crew, it is possible. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this post on all of your social media outlets.
  • Tell a friend!

Thank you again in advance for any and every contribution.
story_txt:
About This Film
Synopsis
Upload follows Dr.James Green, a neuroscientist, and his wife Meredith, whose health has fallen into a state he fears she can't come back from. Frantic and out of options, Dr.James acquires the help of a promising young student to help him defy mortality and ethics. Ultimately, James must choose whether he should play God or do what he knows is right. 

Alabama isn't often thought of to be the hub of technological break-throughs. This film wants to reshape that ideal. 
This film is important to many crew and cast members. We owe it to them and this story to make it as great as it deserves to be.
As student filmmakers,  creating a great sci-fi short is no easy task. That is why we need your help!


Funding

Funding in this film will go towards
Lodging out of town actors
Equipment rentals
Craft Services for our cast and crew.
Production Design and Props
Entrance into Film Festivals 
Wardrobe
Marketing


Our Crew
Our crew will be comprised of undergraduate students completing their degrees in Media Production at the University of Alabama. Many of these students plan to go on to Los Angeles, Atlanta, New York, etc. to start their careers in the entertainment industry. 

Risks & Challenges
A common challenge in student films is a limited production value due to a lack of funding. Upload is no exception to this, but with your help and the hard work of our talented cast and crew, it is possible. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this post on all of your social media outlets.
Tell a friend!

Thank you again in advance for any and every contribution.

story:
WE PROMISE: Action, Drama, Thrills and an ending which questions a taboo subject.

WHAT WE ARE ASKING FOR:  The absolute bare minimum to help our film compete with Hollywood productions.   This campaign would go towards adding an extra level of production value to our already ambitious low budget film, with our incredible cast, crew and locations. 

WHO'S ASKING:  We are award winning filmmakers from London:

Dom Lenoir - Director  (vimeo.com/87993639)

Chris Hardman - VFX/Producer (chrishardman.co.uk)

Nancy Bressolles - Line Producer/Producer (niceonefilm.com)

WHY WE ARE ASKING:  We love Cinema and want to make an Indie film that blows people away. Stepping away from the small town drama model and aiming to do what Luther did for London, by making something bold, dramatic and with noir undertones, whilst showing off Britain's most rugged landscapes.

WHO WE HAVE: 

We have an incredible cast and crew that are making this film with us.  

Cast:

Olwen Kelly - (The Autopsy of Jane Doe)

Hannah Waddingham - (Game of Thrones)

Michael Mckell - (Allied)

Bryan Larkin - (London has Fallen)

Matt Hookings (Maleficent)

Crew: 

Sound - Paul Saunderson - Kick Ass

VFX - Chris Hardman - Kingsman, Avatar, Spectre

Costumes - Adrian Gwillym - Les Misérables, Skyfall

Winter Ridge Sizzle Reel -  https://vimeo.com/200561650

DIRECTOR'S VISION:  Cinema begun for me with 'Star Wars', 'Indiana Jones' and 'James Bond'  - always loving big stories told in a big way.  As I progressed with my career I found my real passion in powerful films like Clint Eastwood's 'Million Dollar Baby', as well as high stakes Drama's with high concept themes, emotions and atmosphere such as Christopher Nolan's 'Insomnia' and Denis Villeneuve's ' Prisoner's'.  My goal is to bring together the elements that inspire me and create a memorable, thought provoking story with 'Winter Ridge' that never shrimps on pace but packs an emotional punch too, all the while drawing you into a stunning and engaging visual world of shadows, fog, and mystery.

DIRECTOR'S MOOD-BOARD -  (References taken from existing films)

Thank you so much for reading and we appreciate your Help and Support!

story:
WHO WE ARE

James Sirois is a Writer/Director/Actor who is from Quebec and Ontario. He formed himself as a film maker in Vancouver, BC. for three years before coming to Montreal. 

Alex Biro is an Actor and Music Producer who moved from Toronto to Montreal to pursue film and music.

Check us out on Facebook! We'll add you as friends :)

WHAT IT IS

This film is intended to entertain the audience as well as, through the story, expose people's ridiculous motivations in a subtle way, all the while staying current with the events of our time…

Your contribution will truly make a difference as every dollar goes straight into the actual, physical things we need to make it happen which is pretty cool!

What We Need & What You Get

The funds go towards renting the film equipment and the locations, paying the actors, props like weapons and squibs, makeup and special effects.

If you donate $150.00 You get to be in the film as a DEA agent that gets to shoot blanks!

If you donate $50.00 You get a producer credit in the film and a ticket to the premiere.

If you donate $25.00 You get a producer credit in the film.

We may not attain our financial goal however the money will still be used to make the film as we will downgrade the quality of equipment to make it - there is no stopping this movie!

Other Ways You Can Help

Connections are everything, perhaps you are in contact with a producer who is interested in this genre of film so sharing the link to our campaign could very well be the thing that funds us!

story:
The Story: 

APPLE BLOSSOM

Genre: Black Comedy, Road Movie

Young Jack hasn't always been the most rational in his life choices. When he decides to hitchhike fromTennessee to Kentucky in the name of love, he finds he may have bitten off more than he can chew. 

Potential backers of this project would aid the filmmakers in tackling the biggest challenge of travelling down to the Tennessee Valley and creating a beautiful project on the mountainous highways and back-roads of Johnson City, TN. 

This particular project is very near and dear to our hearts. It is our way of paying homage to a dearly beloved friend who passed two years ago. The writer, Brianna Dorn, has tried to honor his legacy by including him in the script as one of the few people to help Jack along in his journey. If we can somehow bring this project into fruition, it would be one of numerous ways of showing his loved ones - and the world - the light that he was capable of bringing to others within his short time on this earth.

Who We Are:

Brianna Dorn 

(Writer, Director, Co-Producer)

Brianna Dorn is an avid creative, who enjoys translating her love for storytelling through the medium of film. Her extensive background in acting has translated to more in-depth understandings of the characters she helps bring to life on screen. She recently co-directed her first feature film, Dead Tongues, which won "Best Feature" at the H.P. Lovecraft Film Festival in Portland, Oregon.

Below are links to some examples of her prior directorial works. 

https://vimeo.com/183128619

https://vimeo.com/160991562

Olivia Moses

(Co-Producer)

A Senior at East Tennessee State University, Olivia has recently branched out into the world of film outside of her major in Psychology. She currently writes, directs, and produces her own web series, Roommates, which follows the lives of three very different people living together in college. Her background in psychology has allowed her to have a breath of understanding for human emotion, which was a driving factor in her reasoning for joining this specific project.

Roberto Drilea

(Cinematographer)

Roberto Drilea is a DP and director currently living and working in New York, focused on creating works of documentary and fiction that illuminate the angles of society and humanity that are often left in shadow. Most recently, he was selected as one of ten filmmakers in the Oculus VR For Good program, which partners rising filmmakers with nonprofits to create virtual reality experiences that demonstrate the potential of the medium to expand storytelling and empathy. He also co-directed the feature film, Dead Tongues, which won "Best Feature" at the H.P. Lovecraft Film Festival in Portland, Oregon.

See more of his work on http://roberto.tv

Anthony Nelms

(Composer)

A songwriter, music producer, and new found composer, Anthony comes from an extensive background in audio production. He has joined this project in order to help curate a soundtrack that fits into the general aesthetic that has been based on The White Stripes. As this is his first film project, he is excited to create original and moving content for this production and has been working non-stop to do so. It is sure to not disappoint future viewers. 

 

What We Need:

We need about $2000 to complete funding for our project!

This is a Senior Directing Project within a module at Northwestern University. The University has already gifted us $1500, but we need an extra $2000 in order to cover the costs of travel to shoot on location, as well as to help pay for the cost of shipping equipment to and from location. Below is a quick breakdown of the budget:

  • About $1000 is going towards covering the cost of travels for the director, actors and cinematographer.
  • About $1070 is going towards paying for the shipment/rental of basic film equipment needed on our set.
  • Around $250 + will go towards feeding our cast and crew
  • Around $680 will paying for lodging whilst in Tennessee
  • All leftover funds will help pay for professional sound design on the film following wrapped production (about $500)!

The Impact:

We believe that anyone who has ever experienced grief can understand how difficult it is to find positive outlets for expressing the memories that are left behind. This project is just that outlet for many members of the team.

In addition, Apple Blossom also tells the story of a young man who, even in this day and age, can’t afford a bus ticket and thus must walk to his destination – which is the kind of narrative that hardly ever reaches the light of day. We believe that every story has the right to be told - especially by those who don't fit into society's mold of normality.

Risks & Challenges:

If we are unable to reach our funding goal, it will be near impossible for us to be able to create this piece in the way that it should and needs to be told. 

In the event that we do not reach our full goal, we will make due with what we have raised to fulfill this project to the best of our ability, but it would difficult. This would still require at least 50% of what we are asking to make this project in the most minimalist way possible.

However, we want to curate a product that people can not only relate to, but will also enjoy watching. So please, donate what you can in order to help our cause!

Other Ways You Can Help:

Even if you cannot contribute, share this campaign with your friends, families - anyone you know who might want to help! Get the word out! We appreciate you.

-Team Apple Blossom

story:
WHAT IS MATCH ABOUT?

MATCH, a 3D animated student film, challenges us to open our eyes about the idea of what a true love match is. Join us in making a student short film that will showcase this message. Your donation will help filmmakers grow their story-telling abilities, actors develop their character performance skills, and your buddy, Danny Munoz, will be able to graduate on time.  

This thesis film isn't just about me being able to graduate on time. It's about building character and touching people's hearts through the medium of cinema. This film is for the three women in my family who have supported me so this far and have encouraged me to chase my dreams. My mother and two sisters are the reason why I decided to create this film which showcases a strong female character as the story's lead protagonist - Rainbow.



THE STORY OF MATCH

MATCH  is about two socks, Lefty - our male lead and Rainbow - our female lead, who undertake a dangerous journey to find love's true match. Having to navigate through a busy laundromat where humans are washing their clothes, Lefty and Rainbow discover more about what a "match" means.

Lefty has lost his match to a marauding janitor and desperately goes for help. Behind the laundry machines lies a cardboard sock city where Lefty encounters Rainbow who lends her assistance.

As the main heroine of the story, Rainbow helps Lefty during a painful time of his life. She gives Lefty the hope that he will find his perfect match. Although their journey is wrought with uncertainty, Rainbow and Lefty give each other hope that things will get better. Love comes in many forms - each and everyone of us has a match.

 

WHO IS MAKING THIS?

Danny Muñoz is a video editor when he is not focusing on school work and a 3D animator while finishing his BA in animation at the school of cinematic arts in USC. He loves both video editing and animation, however he is taken more of an editorial route for his career path. He got his jumpstart into the world of editing from the short film “Shellshock” (2013). As a first time editor, he was not afraid of the challenge, and the result of his efforts lead him to win “Best Editor” while attending UCSB. After working in many short narrative film works, and expanding to new mediums such as trailers, sizzles, documentaries, and a feature, he was fortunate to have earned internships with NBC Bravo Digital, Trailer Park, and freelance work with National Geographic for “La Cuba De Hoy” as additional editor. He currently is working under Davis Guggenheim on upcoming work.

Danie Hakimi has spent most of her life producing, directing, and designing for different creative projects and events. Her past work includes producing and developing an animation/video game industry event called Graphic Voices, serving as production manager on a stop-motion short, directing a number of short plays, and acting as assistant director and costume designer for a number of large scale theater productions. When she’s not working with Danny on ‘Match’, she acts as producer, designer, and story artist for another upcoming animated short (which she’s very excited about) and works part-time in a Los Angeles cafe. She also practices illustration, creates cosplays, talks to her dogs, and reads graphic novels when she finds time to sit still. 

For more life and work updates, you can find her on Twitter @Danie_Hakimi
 

Margaret Spencer is a concept designer studying animation at the school of cinematic arts in USC. She just recently won the 12th annual NYTVF 2016 along with her team and landed a development deal with Bento Box for their upcoming show. When she is not studying, she focuses on fan art, character designs, and landscape drawings all in digital and paper. 

Follow her on Tumblr: http://mmspencerart.tumblr.com/

 

Tracey Aivaz is a director and actor from Burbank, CA. She is currently studying Film & TV Production at the University of Southern California. Through filmmaking, she would like to tell stories that express powerful ideas and deeper messages to connect with a wide audience. She's keen on emphasizing the importance of standing up and being stronger every time life knocks one down. Aivaz is an avid feminist. She plans to represent women’s voices and visions that have not been represented much at all in cinema and show that women can go beyond the glass ceilings that have been imposed upon them. She likes to take a narrative approach to her stories rather than documentary. Entertaining yet instructive; that is her motto. 
 

Steve Pacilio grew up in Rochester NY, where he developed a knack for character acting and voices . Making his move to Los Angeles in September 2015, Steve is now represented by Melissa Prophet Management , and Lounge sings at Primo Italia in the South Bay . His favorite roles to play are nostalgic time piece characters . His biggest influences are Rodney Dangerfield and Dean Martin.
 

Ramiro Cazaux is a designer and filmmaker from Los Angeles. He specializes in Direction, Art Direction, and Production Design for animation, live-action, live entertainment, as well as 3D modeling. Ramiro teaches at USC from time to time teaching advanced story boarding, and modeling pipeline in Maya. Ramiro has worked for animation studios such as SOUTH PARK, BentoBox, and Partizan. He co-founded Yozux Studios, a successful animation and visual effects boutique studio. Ramiro worked for South Park in the Art Department, creating storyboards and production design for the weekly show as well as their video games.
 

Zoltan Vass is a CG modeler and character rigger for video games and animation. He is from Hungary. He has worked for Slitscan Images as a modeler and texture technician from 2006-2009. Later he went on to UPP Prague as a modeler. His feature work comes from Puppetworks Budapest as a modeler, rigger, and character setup from 2011-2013. He has landed jobs with the film Red Tails and video games War of Legions.
 

Myware Studio is a design and creative arm of Myware Solutions Pvt Ltd (INDIA). Myware Solutions Pvt Ltd provides services from software application development, web development, web design, IT consulting, Mobile app development to AR development. Myware started its design arm in late 2014 to primarily focus in 3d and 2d animation, 3d printing and hence Myware Studio is formed. Myware Studio comprises of a robust and scalable team. Myware studio is top rated agency in over 4 different marketplaces. Myware has delivered its services to over 22 countries.
 

Erick Schroder is a film, theater, and video game composer originally from San Diego, California.  His compositions have included works for vocal and instrumental soloists, choral groups, stage musicals, jazz, and orchestral ensembles. After several years in the musical theater industry, his musical interests expanded to include the world of composition and film scoring. He later went on to attend the prestigious Scoring for Motion Picture and Television Program at the University of Southern California. While attending USC, Erick honed his composition skills under the guidance of Bruce Broughton, Frederick Weidmann, Garry Schyman, and Jack Smalley.  In 2012, Erick was granted the valuable opportunity to be mentored by Emmy and Grammy winning composer James Newton Howard. In 2013, Erick was one of twelve internationally selected composers to be accepted into the renowned ASCAP scoring workshop. He recently worked with NBC on their show Siberia and provided mock-ups for a new Disney film.


 

HOW CAN I HELP?

The best way to make this all happen is to donate of course, but there are other ways to help:

  • Like this page
  • Comment on this page
  • Like the Facebook page
  • Invite your friends to like the Facebook page via "Invite All" a free extension for Google Chrome. Fast and easy way to invite ALL of your friends to a page and/or event.
  • Share our story to others via Facebook, Twitter, and Email

If done so, then words haven't been invented to describe the appreciation and gratefulness I will have for you in contributing to this film. By doing so, this will help take this film to a higher level and at the same time, support freelance animators across the globe, here domestically and get this 1st-generation Latino student his degree! So help us keep moving forward!


Where does the money go?

Match (Money Chart)

  • A team of 3D character animators that can perform in key animation, and tweening
  • 3D modelers to create missing objects we will need later in production
  • Render Farm Services so that we may get our rendered final images faster, thus focusing more on the animation phase
  • Compositing
  • Music & Sound Design
  • Perks

She just recently won the 12th annual NYTVF 2016 along with her team and landed a development deal with Bento Box for their upcoming show. When she is not studying, she focuses on fan art, character designs, and landscape drawings all in digital and paper. Follow her on Tumblr: http://mmspencerart.tumblr.com/ Tracey Aivaz is a director and actor from Burbank, CA. She is currently studying Film & TV Production at the University of Southern California. Through filmmaking, she would like to tell stories that express powerful ideas and deeper messages to connect with a wide audience. She's keen on emphasizing the importance of standing up and being stronger every time life knocks one down. Aivaz is an avid feminist. She plans to represent women’s voices and visions that have not been represented much at all in cinema and show that women can go beyond the glass ceilings that have been imposed upon them. She likes to take a narrative approach to her stories rather than documentary. Entertaining yet instructive; that is her motto.  Steve Pacilio grew up in Rochester NY, where he developed a knack for character acting and voices . Making his move to Los Angeles in September 2015, Steve is now represented by Melissa Prophet Management , and Lounge sings at Primo Italia in the South Bay . His favorite roles to play are nostalgic time piece characters . His biggest influences are Rodney Dangerfield and Dean Martin. Ramiro Cazaux is a designer and filmmaker from Los Angeles. He specializes in Direction, Art Direction, and Production Design for animation, live-action, live entertainment, as well as 3D modeling. Ramiro teaches at USC from time to time teaching advanced story boarding, and modeling pipeline in Maya. Ramiro has worked for animation studios such as SOUTH PARK, BentoBox, and Partizan. He co-founded Yozux Studios, a successful animation and visual effects boutique studio. Ramiro worked for South Park in the Art Department, creating storyboards and production design for the weekly show as well as their video games. Zoltan Vass is a CG modeler and character rigger for video games and animation. He is from Hungary. He has worked for Slitscan Images as a modeler and texture technician from 2006-2009. Later he went on to UPP Prague as a modeler. His feature work comes from Puppetworks Budapest as a modeler, rigger, and character setup from 2011-2013. He has landed jobs with the film Red Tails and video games War of Legions. Myware Studio is a design and creative arm of Myware Solutions Pvt Ltd (INDIA). Myware Solutions Pvt Ltd provides services from software application development, web development, web design, IT consulting, Mobile app development to AR development. Myware started its design arm in late 2014 to primarily focus in 3d and 2d animation, 3d printing and hence Myware Studio is formed. Myware Studio comprises of a robust and scalable team. Myware studio is top rated agency in over 4 different marketplaces. Myware has delivered its services to over 22 countries. Erick Schroder is a film, theater, and video game composer originally from San Diego, California.  His compositions have included works for vocal and instrumental soloists, choral groups, stage musicals, jazz, and orchestral ensembles. After several years in the musical theater industry, his musical interests expanded to include the world of composition and film scoring. He later went on to attend the prestigious Scoring for Motion Picture and Television Program at the University of Southern California. While attending USC, Erick honed his composition skills under the guidance of Bruce Broughton, Frederick Weidmann, Garry Schyman, and Jack Smalley.  In 2012, Erick was granted the valuable opportunity to be mentored by Emmy and Grammy winning composer James Newton Howard. In 2013, Erick was one of twelve internationally selected composers to be accepted into the renowned ASCAP scoring workshop. He recently worked with NBC on their show Siberia and provided mock-ups for a new Disney film. HOW CAN I HELP?The best way to make this all happen is to donate of course, but there are other ways to help:
Like this page
Comment on this page
Like the Facebook page
Invite your friends to like the Facebook page via "Invite All" a free extension for Google Chrome. Fast and easy way to invite ALL of your friends to a page and/or event.
Share our story to others via Facebook, Twitter, and Email
If done so, then words haven't been invented to describe the appreciation and gratefulness I will have for you in contributing to this film. By doing so, this will help take this film to a higher level and at the same time, support freelance animators across the globe, here domestically and get this 1st-generation Latino student his degree! So help us keep moving forward!Where does the money go?Match (Money Chart)
A team of 3D character animators that can perform in key animation, and tweening
3D modelers to create missing objects we will need later in production
Render Farm Services so that we may get our rendered final images faster, thus focusing more on the animation phase
Compositing
Music & Sound Design
Perks

story:
Hi my name is Steven Reyes. This film was made to focus on the impact that a persons life can have on the people around them. The story shows the relationship between two siblings as one of them lives out their last few months of their life. This piece was made to honor my sister and allow people dealing with cancer, whether its someone who has cancer or someone with a loved one that has this awful illness to have a story that they can relate to and find some comfort. 

By contributing to this project you will be helping to cover the cost of music and festival fees for this film. 10% of whatever is raised will be donated to a non profit (Susan G Komen's Breast Caner foundation) to help further the fight against cancer.  And once music and festival fees are covered any remaining funds will be donated as well. Any help is greatly appreciated whether you donate or use the Indiegogo share tools to help get the word out. I want to thank everyone for their help.

story:
My name is Ken Wolf. I am a Yogi, a Personal Trainer, an Actor, a Playwright and the Artistic Director of Manhattan Repertory Theatre in New York City.

13 years ago, I developed severe PTSD and conversion disorder from training in Yoga. As I entered my second 200 hour Yoga Teacher training, I started to feel random emotion coming out of my body as I did Yoga.  I was fascinated by what was going on so I started working with a Yoga trainer privately and I dove in deeper, and I re-traumatized my nervous system from an old forgotten abusive event that was somehow trapped, lost in my body.  I developed severe PTSD where my body would literally bounce around somatically, my muscles would cramp unexpectedly, and I experienced random crazy emotion emanating from my body. I was so frightened, so I started filming my PTSD experience as I searched for a cure.  I made a commitment to myself that I would cure myself and then help people with similar issues.

I filmed over 200 hours of Yoga sessions, psychotherapy sessions where I literally bounced as I did the work, along with video journals of my daily experience dealing with my severe affliction.

After three years, I cured myself 100% of my affliction, after learning a myriad of ways to deal with the PTSD and conversion disorder through Yoga and physical body work, and simple mental techniques to deal with random emotion.

The story didn't end there. I didn't know the source of the trauma that caused my affliction. But through the help of my sister, Margie Wolf, together, we discovered the source of my trauma. I was savagely beaten with a baseball bat by a neighbor.

This documentary will tell our story, but more importantly, it will offer information and support for individuals who suffer from PTSD, conversion disorder and random anxiety.  We want to get this information out to the world.

In conjunction with The People in my Hips documentary, we are going to release The People in my Hips IPAD IBOOK which will document my story, and my strategies to deal with my affliction, along with real video from my battle with PTSD and more.

And we are going to start the website HEALINGANDMOVINGON.com which will be a place for people to share their stories of healing, and to voice their pain, where we intend to create a community to help individuals who suffer from the trauma of abuse.

One traumatic abusive event, has a ripple effect. Trauma changes beliefs, behaviors and most importantly, it changes thinking, and these beliefs, behaviors and distorted thinking, ripple off into the future and adversely change the course of one's life.  We want to help people understand that there is hope, and that there is possibility of change, no matter what the past has created. 

Please help us on this mission -  the last piece of a 47 year journey for my sister Margie and me, as we finally get this story out into the world.

 

Why we are raising money to do this:

We want to do this right.  We want to create a stunning, compelling, professional documentary that will be shown all over the world.

We need to purchase:

  • A high end professional camera, microphones, and sound processing equipment
  • Lights, reflectors
  • A high powered computer to edit the documentary
  • Scores of hard drives to store and back up the footage
  • Stock video footage for B roll that we cannot film

We need to hire:

  • A camera technician
  • A sound technician
  • A make up artist
  • Actors for re-enactments

We need to pay for:

  • Space and locations to film
  • Editing
  • Sound design
  • Website and web services
  • Promotion when the documentary is finished.

 

Why this film will make a difference!

Millions of people suffer from PTSD, conversion disorder and random anxiety, and for many, their affliction is kept a secret for they fear people will reject them or they fear people will see them as being crazy.

PTSD is not crazy. Conversion Disorder is not crazy. Experiencing random anxiety is not crazy. They are symptoms of trauma.

And these disorders are treatable, and curable, even with severe abuse.

With this film, we want to get the word out to the world that PTSD, conversion disorder and random anxiety can be cured.

We want to get the word out that you don't have to hide that you suffer from PTSD, conversion disorder or random anxiety. Both are simply a "ripple effect" from trauma, and often, a natural part of the healing process.

And we want to make it clear that abuse of any kind is wrong.

story:
What will "The Clexa Project" be doing, exactly? 

The project will be exploring how the mainstream media misrepresents, baits, and erases diverse LGBTQ+ characters, specifically queer women and their corresponding relationships. With the support and participation of various stakeholders in the movement, we will be producing this film with the intention of cultivating a culture that humanizes diverse communities and challenges limiting media stereotypes.

We believe that the LGBTQ+ community deserves better the same way we believe all marginalized communities deserve better. Not only are queer and trans experiences misrepresented or excluded on some level, but there's also very little positive representation of LGBTQ+ people of color as well as folks with other ignored intersections (i.e. disability, size, class, religious affiliation, documentation, etc.). This documentary aims to illustrate the necessity and beauty in implementing authentic, intersectional media representation. 

Negative stereotypes have the capacity to perpetuate discrimination; unrealistic standards provoke low self-esteem; and compulsive heteronormativity ultimately erases queer and trans folks' humanity. Since the media influences the young minds of our future generations, we think it's vital and necessary to keep the conversation going. 

But, why "Clexa"? 

Clexa is named after the portmanteau or "ship" of two iconic LGBTQ+ characters, Clarke and Lexa, from the tv show CW's The 100. Following the sudden and violent death of Lexa (a mere 64 seconds after their love scene) the storyline inspired fans to push for positive representation and raised over $100K for The Trevor Project with the help of LGBT Fans Deserve Better.

The 2015/2016 TV season alone has managed to kill off an unprecedented number of queer women characters belonging to an already underrepresented community, further perpetuating the "Bury Your Gays" trope. For more information on this trope, please visit the LGBT Fans Deserve Better website.

Although 'Clexa' was indeed a catalyst for us, we know that the current state of the movement is much deeper and more complex than one fandom. It is our mission to cover representation as it relates to diverse queer women using an inclusive and intersectional lens, utilizing 'Clexa' in a symbolic sense along the way.

Who are you, anyway?

We are a few queer college students from California exercising our passion for inclusivity, grassroots activism, and everything Clexa. Funding this film out of our own pockets, we will be relying on your generous donations to make the highest quality documentary we possibly can.

While pursuing gender and sexuality studies, we also volunteer for our community and work part-time for our university’s student-run activist center. This work has allowed us tremendous experience in designing, planning, and marketing of various women-, queer-, and trans-centered events and resources.

We hold this project near and dear to our hearts, meaning we will stop at nothing to create something our community deserves: a beautiful and respectful documentation of our struggle, experiences, and mobilization following so many unparalled deaths of fictional queer folk. We will be pouring all of the money, time, and energy we can spare into this project. Everything you give towards and beyond our budget will be used in the most innovative, responsible way we can muster. 

We are also currently in the processing of identifying and adding new members to the project team. If this is something that interests you, please tweet at @theclexaproject or email us at theclexaproject@gmail.com for more information.

So, how much are you asking for?

After a lot of careful calculation, we are asking for contributions supporting a relatively low budget of $2500. Funds generated from this campaign will be allocated to the following:

Equipment and Post Production Costs
Our film will look and sound better with higher quality cameras, lenses, microphones, tripods, memory cards, external hard-drives, editing software, and any other necessary equipment. We want to ensure that the final product is filmed, edited, and polished so that it’s something we will all enjoy watching. 

Transportation
This film would not be anything without an array of diverse interviews concerning the most relevant stakeholders in the queer representation movement and diverse media representation in general. In order to conduct these, we’ll need to pay for gas and sometimes stay when visiting “krus” on the west coast. 

What if I can't afford to contribute? 

You can still support us by spreading the word! Help us make some noise by encouraging the people in your life to get involved as well. Everyone can play a role, because at the end of the day positive and diverse media representation benefits everyone. Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you all so much in advance for your support and consideration. We cannot wait to enjoy the final product alongside all of you!

story:
Summary

A forensic student, CARL, struggles himself with his necrophiliac desires but after encountering himself with a new cadaver at the morgue table, he can't resist the sexual needs he feels and starts performing cunnilingus on the cadaver; this brings the lady back to life. As they start getting to know each other, she seduces him and convinces him to try the 'erotic asphyxiation', a pleasant way to get killed. Did she kill him? Or is it only his guilty imagination punishing him for cheating on his girlfriend with dead bodies?

 

THE TEAM 

CROSSWALK ENTERTAINMENT (Production Company): Crosswalk Entertainment is a bilingual content creator brand whose mission is to close the gap between the American and Latino Market,  founded by Triana Garcia S and Andreina Perez A early in 2015 and ever since, Crosswalk already launched two projects: 'Tito: Peace of Heaven' and #MyLove - Benavides Music video. 

http://www.crosswalkentertainment.com/about-us.html​

Manolo Gonzalez Vergara (Director):

    When he is not horse-back riding through the open wilderness, he can be found featured in world-wide advertising campaigns for products such as Head & Shoulders Shampoo, Got Milk, and Quaker Oates. While studying in Emerson College, he directed and hosted his own successfull webseries on YouTube, called “Mi Vida Con Toty.”. He also most recently hosted the limited-run short-format series “Vergaraland” on Fusion’s Snapchat portal.  He has also appeared in the role of Henry in ‘White Rabbit” (2013),  as DJ in “Hot Pursuit” (2015),  as Vincent in “Leviticus 20” (2014), and as Jorgi in the upcoming “Vandal” (2017). Aside from acting projects, he has several writing projects in the pipeline, including an in-development television series, ‘The I.T Guy,” and a teen comedy for AwesomenessTV.

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm7304486/?ref_=fn_al_nm_1

Steven Cohen (Lead Actor): 

After studying architecture in Boston, MA. Steven moved to Los Angeles to persuade his acting career, after a year of studies at the Lee Strasberg Theatre and Film Institute he got his first Lead Role in POST MORTEM. 

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm8280323/?ref_=fn_al_nm_1​

Triana Garcia Simon (Productora):  Después de estudiar Cine en Los Ángeles, Triana comenzó a representar películas en el mercado internacional; teniendo múltiples títulos a diferentes distribuidores alrededor del mundo. Pero su pasión por la producción nunca fue opacada y ella continuó ejerciendo esta disciplina en múltiples cortometrajes, comerciales y videos de música. 

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm5028066/?ref_=fn_al_nm_1

 

Andreina Perez (Productora): Desde el 2015, Andreina ha tenido la oportunidad de ejercer sus estudios de producción de Cine, colaborando como productora en multiples cortometrajes, de los cuales 3 han sido seleccionados en festivales de cine, su mas reciente producción 'Tito: Peace of Heaven' esta por estrenarse este mes de Mayo. 

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm6546318/?ref_=fn_al_nm_1

story:
What's It About?

Where Is My Mind? tells the story of Liam, a quiet, antisocial teenager who shows signs of suffering from autism. Throughout his life, Liam has had one friend, one confident, someone who has been alongside him through thick and thin. This is Jacob. Jacob is everything Liam wishes he could be. Jacob is suave, cocky and cool. Despite the two being so different, their bond has become unbreakable throughout their lives. However, there is one problem. Jacob's cocky attitude often gets Liam into situations he isn't able to defend himself in.

One day after Liam finishes school, Jacob gets him seriously beaten up by the resident school bullies. Liam is rushed to hospital and is placed in an induced coma, due to life threatening injuries. However, when he is in the coma, he also finds himself in a strange, exaggerated dream world with Jacob. Events that take place in the real world, where Liam lies in hospital, fighting for his life, transcend into the dream world. Everything is trying to get through to Liam and tell him that this world and in fact Jacob, aren't real and that Liam needs to wake up. Will Liam be able to break Jacob's hold on him and escape the dream world, or will he become trapped inside his own mind forever?

 

Why Is It Important?

We believe that mental illness has been stereotyped and negatively portrayed in film for too long. Sufferers of mental illness are consistently shown as violent, unhinged protagonists, such as Hannibal Lecter in Silence Of The Lambs. Mental illness is also frequently used in comedies for cheap, offensive laughs, often at the expense of the mental illness sufferer. We hope to portray mental illness in a positive, accurate light through our film, whilst also creating something that is engaging and exciting to watch.

 

The Team

 

Director - Marina Fistal

Producer - Angel Marinov   

Writer - Courtney Male


Cinematographer - Darren Leung

1st AC - Bogdan Nohai

Gaffer - Morgane Tatard

Sound - Suraj Rathod

Editor - Denis Irimia

Production Designer - Levi De Sousa

How Will Your Donations Help?

As university students, we unfortunately do not have the money to completely fund this project ourselves (The cliche about students being poor is true you know!). We believe this project has the potential to be extremely successful and we are all very passionate about telling this story in the best way possible. However, this requires a lot of money!

We are currently scouting the best locations available for our film that will really help us tell the story and bring it to life. We hope to shoot in a variety of really interesting places, such as a hospital, a school and a diner, but great locations aren't cheap! A large majority of our budget will go towards negotiating incredible locations.

The roles of Liam and Jacob are extremely complex and layered and as such, we believe we need a fantastic cast to bring them to the screen in the way we imagine them. With your help, we will secure great, professional actors for the lead roles of 'Where Is My Mind?' and pay them what they deserve. We are currently in the process of casting and trust us, from what we have seen so far, you won't be disappointed!

There is so much more that will go into making 'Where Is My Mind?' the best film it can be, such as props, costumes, transport and equipment. With all of this, we really need your help to make up the biggest budget we possibly can!

 

What You Get

Everyone who donates, no matter how big or small, will recieve a digital download to the final version of the film, so you can see how the final film has come together with your support. However, that's not all! As you can see, we are offering a wide variety of perks for different levels of donations, such as a special thanks in the end credits, a signed poster and even the chance to have a line in the film! Grab this chance to get yourself a piece of film history (We hope!).

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, we completely understand! Times are hard and there are so many great projects out there that are asking for your contributions. However, if you are unable to donate, we'd really appreciate your support in other ways. Please, if you could share our Indiegogo page with your friends and family and spread the word and hopefully help us raise donations.

You can also find us on a variety of social media platforms, such as Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/mirageproductionsfilm) and Instagram (whereismymind2017). We'd really appreciate if you could follow our social media pages and share our journey with your friends and family and spread the word about 'Where Is My Mind?'.

If you're based in London and are interested in filmmaking, please don't hesitate to get in touch, as we may be able to offer you a role on the set of 'Where Is My Mind?', such as a runner or production assistant. Don't miss this chance to secure a credit on a highly ambitious film that will be shown in a variety of film festivals and see how a real film set works!

If you have any questions about our film, we are more than happy to answer them. Please email the address provided and we will get back to you as soon as we can.

Thankyou,

The Crew of 'Where Is My Mind?'
story_txt:
What's It About?
Where Is My Mind? tells the story of Liam, a quiet, antisocial teenager who shows signs of suffering from autism. Throughout his life, Liam has had one friend, one confident, someone who has been alongside him through thick and thin. This is Jacob. Jacob is everything Liam wishes he could be. Jacob is suave, cocky and cool. Despite the two being so different, their bond has become unbreakable throughout their lives. However, there is one problem. Jacob's cocky attitude often gets Liam into situations he isn't able to defend himself in.
One day after Liam finishes school, Jacob gets him seriously beaten up by the resident school bullies. Liam is rushed to hospital and is placed in an induced coma, due to life threatening injuries. However, when he is in the coma, he also finds himself in a strange, exaggerated dream world with Jacob. Events that take place in the real world, where Liam lies in hospital, fighting for his life, transcend into the dream world. Everything is trying to get through to Liam and tell him that this world and in fact Jacob, aren't real and that Liam needs to wake up. Will Liam be able to break Jacob's hold on him and escape the dream world, or will he become trapped inside his own mind forever?
 
Why Is It Important?
We believe that mental illness has been stereotyped and negatively portrayed in film for too long. Sufferers of mental illness are consistently shown as violent, unhinged protagonists, such as Hannibal Lecter in Silence Of The Lambs. Mental illness is also frequently used in comedies for cheap, offensive laughs, often at the expense of the mental illness sufferer. We hope to portray mental illness in a positive, accurate light through our film, whilst also creating something that is engaging and exciting to watch.
 
The Team
 
Director - Marina Fistal

Producer - Angel Marinov    

Writer - Courtney Male
Cinematographer - Darren Leung

1st AC - Bogdan Nohai


Gaffer - Morgane Tatard

Sound - Suraj Rathod

Editor - Denis Irimia

story:
My name is Marianne Amelinckx and I'm going to tell you a story:

Three years ago I had an idea for a story and in May of 2016 I had the bliss of making that idea into a short film called "Salta" (Dive, in English).

"Salta" tells the story of Julia, who comes back to the pool to remember that sometimes life challenges us to make decisions and to teach us that all the experiences we live are made to make us stronger.

Nowadays, we are very proud of our short film. We have received very good reviews from friends and colleagues who suggest we should compete in film festivals by saying we have a great movie and, although it's a bit scary: we want to try it, we want to compete!

Until now, we found friends and family who decided to support us and pay some of these festivals submissions fees. However, we do this crowdfunding campaign because we believe that, as in filmmaking, we can do more things if we work together as a team. And it's precisely at this moment that we need you, so we can submit our short film to different film festivals and show "Salta" to the world!

We want to compete in the most important film festivals: LA Film Festival, Outfest Los Angeles, Brussels Short Film Festival, Toronto International Film Festival, Austin Film Festival, Iris Prize, Raindance Film Festival, Holly Shorts, Heartland Film Festival, BendFilm Festival, Cucalorus and more!

Besides this, we have to buy some Blu-ray's and pen-drives for distribution, we want to print some posters and postcards for advertising purposes. 

 

However, although we can not offer too much in return we want to thank you for your help with some rewards like the original music, making-of pictures, a pass to a festival near you and more!

If you can not collaborate with our campaign, share this link by clicking any of the share buttons (facebook, twitter). Send it to your godfather or your aunt who you think can help us and tell them the reason they should help us, convince them! We count on you!

THANKS!

_____________________________________________________________________________

Mi nombre es Marianne Amelinckx y quiero contarles algo:

Hace 3 años tuve una idea para una historia y en Mayo del 2016 tuve la dicha de que esa idea se convirtiera en mi primer cortometraje profesional titulado "Salta". 

"Salta" cuenta la historia de Julia, quien vuelve a la piscina para recordar que a veces la vida conspira para que tomemos decisiones y nos atrevamos. Que muchas veces creemos que no estamos preparados para ciertas situaciones, pero la idea es siempre seguir adelante.

 

Hoy en día tenemos un cortometraje del cual todos los miembros del equipo estamos muy orgullosos. Hemos recibido muy buenas críticas de amigos y colegas quienes nos aconsejan competir en festivales, argumentando que tenemos un trabajo de excelente acabado y, aunque da miedo aceptarlo: queremos intentarlo, queremos competir!

Hasta la fecha hemos conseguido amigos y familiares que decidieron apoyarnos y pagar algunas de estas inscripciones, sin embargo hacemos esta campaña pues creemos que, como en el cine, en equipo se logran más cosas. Y es justamente en este momento que los necesitamos a ustedes para poder llevar nuestro cortometraje a distintos festivales y mostrarle "Salta" al mundo.

Queremos competir en los festivales de cine con más renombre a nivel mundial: LA Film Festival, Outfest Los Angeles, Brussels Short Film Festival, Toronto International Film Festival, Austin Film Festival, Iris Prize, Raindance Film Festival, Holly Shorts, Heartland Film Festival, BendFilm Festival, Cucalorus y más!

Además de esto, tenemos que comprar discos blu-rays, pen-drives para la distribución e imprimir pósters y postales que funcionen como material publicitario de nuestra película.

 

Aunque no podemos ofrecer demasiado a cambio queremos agradecer con algunas recompensas por su ayuda como la música original, fotos del rodaje impresas, postales y más!

Y si no puedes colaborar con nuestra campaña, comparte y difunde este link dándole click a cualquiera de los botones de compartir (facebook o twitter). Mandáselo a tu padrino o a tu tía que crees que puede ayudarnos y cuéntales porqué tú quieres que nos ayuden, convéncelos! Contamos contigo!

GRACIAS!

story:
The Story of 'Swipe Right'

‘Swipe Right’ is a MGM-styled musical comedy set in the modern era of internet dating. The film will feature four original musical numbers in the style of the Great American Songbook, but also will focus on the modern effects on dating culture with 21st century technology.  

The film follows college student, Miles during a voyage through the world of internet dating over the course of one night in New York City. 

What We Need & What You Get

I’m expected to begin shooting in January, and without some sort of budget for production, this film will be very difficult. The app in the film is called “Adoor” (pronounced ‘adore’), which many of the characters use in the film. I need an animator, and a graphic designer to work side by side design this app for the characters to use on screen. I’m also looking for motion graphics to appear on screen, whenever the characters type texts, or messages via social media. This is crucial, because a problem that Hollywood struggles with nowadays, is how to make our ever growing, non-stop world of texting entertaining and presentable on camera. With the use of graphics, we can see these characters reading, and typing a text message, instead of showing a mundane camera shot of the text. We must not forget funding for my composer/lyricist, transportation for the equipment, actors, a choreographer, locations, craft services, permits for shooting on the streets of New York at night, someone to fine tune the sound mix of the film, as well as a colorist to add a splash of color to our upbeat, jazzy picture. Funding can make or break this film.

Of course me, and my team will be very happy with your donations, so we must reward you in some way! Check out some of the perks on the side of this page. If you donate enough money, I may even take you out for the most important meal of the day, breakfast. 

Who's Involved?

Sean Patrick O'Brien

First of, myself, Sean Patrick O'Brien directed and wrote the film. When I started writing the screenplay, I found that my influences for the story could be placed into two categories. Mainstream, often comedies, of the likes of Judd Apatow, Seth Rogen, and the wonderful Nora Ephron, and also romantic musicals such as ‘The Umbrellas of Cherbourg’, and ‘Singin' in the Rain’. At this point, I had decided to hire a composer, and turn the film into a musical!

Spencer Robelen

My work always somehow relates to music, and with my love for old film musicals, I was eager to begin work on this film. I quickly hired NYU-alumni Spencer Robelen, who wrote four jazz-influenced songs for the film.

Chris Lombardo & Peter Angelinas

However, the story of 'Swipe Right' has been in pre-production for quite some time now. Back in 2014, myself, and my two great friends Peter Angelinas, and Chris Lombardo had sought out making a feature film based on internet dating. We spent countless summer nights in diners working on the script. I can't even tell you how many french fries, and milkshakes I've must of consumed writing this with them. Eventually I did rewrites, and it's finally at where it is today. However, many of the scenes from the original script are still a part of the story, hoping to stay somewhat true to our original vision.Peter & Chris, two of the funniest people I know, also have acting roles within the film.

Anto Gharibian

It is also being produced by my great friend, and frequent collaborator, Anto Gharibian, who has produced my past two films with me.

Rose O'Brien

And last but not least, the film is being shot my wonderfully talented Director of Photography, Rose O'Brien (no relation!!)

Together, we all strive to make a great film, one we hope you all enjoy.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't contribute, doesn't mean you can't help.

Help me spread the word. After all, this is a story about social media! Share this on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Snapchat, uhhhh, AIM if you still use that, even MySpace! Maybe even MySpace Tom will donate!!*

(*he probably won't)

Any help spreading the word would be greatly appreciated!

story:
Summary

HEY YOU! If you don't know me, my name is Karly Ruesen and I am a fourth year student at York University. I am majoring in Film Production and just recently added a minor in Marketing under my belt. For my final film this year,  I want to create a music video that bridges contemporary art and technology as one. The song, "It's Just You and Me", was written and produced by fellow York students who are almost as excited as me to see their lyrics come to life!

The only problem is... money! And as students we barely have any! This music video requires some $$$ in order to bring it to its full potential. We need sets, sets that need wood, tools, plaster, paint, lights, and equipment. And then we need the cool stuff like a dolly, fog machines, smoke bombs, gels, costumes, chrome makeup (ouuu), and a projector. Then we need to feed people, a crew and cast of people, and if your Italian you especially know that doesn't come cheap! Along with transportation, a universal understanding that gas prices suck... BUT this is where you come along to make it all better!
 

 

 

The Impact

You are truly valuable to us and your help does NOT go unnoticed. Go check out the perks you receive on the right-hand side of this page because YOU truly do deserve it! With your support, young artist like us get to create without boundaries! In fact, your contribution helps us with our prospective careers by showcasing this piece to future employers. 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help us still! We ask that you folks get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. On this page are Indiegogo share tools such as posting to Facebook and forwarding to emails, which would be a HUGE help! As my marketing minor has taught me, Word of Mouth (WOM) is an extremely powerful tool ;)

And that's all there is to it.

 

 

MEET THE TEAM:

DIRECTOR (PRODUCER & EDITOR)


KARLY RUESEN:
So you already know a little bit about me, such as my Film major and Marketing minor, but to give you a little more... my passion is with editing. Whether it is manipulating a scene or photograph, creating a design or graphic, it's truly what I love to do. I am SO excited to not only direct (since it's been 3 years!!!) but also edit because I have total creative freedom with a music video. The best thing about the Alternative Course Stream is NO RULES. This piece is really all about exploring the music and creating visually stimulating images that correlate. With my background as a painter, this video is essentially a blank canvas ready to made into art (with your help)!

 

THE CINEMATOGRAPHER


ELANA EMER:
Elana Emer is a cinematographer and photographer based out of Toronto, with film work ranging from short dramas and documentaries to experimental cinema. Her shooting style, reflected in both her film and photography work, is intimate and candid, with an emphasis on character, colour, and mood. Currently finishing her BFA in film production at York University, Elana spends much of her time collaborating with other students and maintaining her freelance career.

 

THE PRODUCTION DESIGNER


NICOLE ZIMMER:
Nicole Zimmer is a passionate production designer and art director, with a wide range of experience including short fiction and alternative films, as well as music videos. Nicole has a passion for visual aesthetics, and notices design and colour everywhere she goes. With great attention to detail, Nicole has brought to life the battle fields of World War II, set the stage for a Victorian drama, and created the world of outer space, among many other intricate and exciting mise-en-scènes.

 

THE STAR (AND SINGER)


ANNA ZELKO:
I wrote this song a few years ago sitting in the summer sun anticipating a young summer night out with my friends in the city. I was picturing a humid night cooled by a few drinks, enjoying the company of my friends when my eyes meet with someone across the room, inviting a curiosity for a stranger. The song explores the moment that all that seems to matter is the connection between you and this one person.

Nicole has a passion for visual aesthetics, and notices design and colour everywhere she goes. With great attention to detail, Nicole has brought to life the battle fields of World War II, set the stage for a Victorian drama, and created the world of outer space, among many other intricate and exciting mise-en-scènes. THE STAR (AND SINGER)ANNA ZELKO:I wrote this song a few years ago sitting in the summer sun anticipating a young summer night out with my friends in the city. I was picturing a humid night cooled by a few drinks, enjoying the company of my friends when my eyes meet with someone across the room, inviting a curiosity for a stranger. The song explores the moment that all that seems to matter is the connection between you and this one person.
