story:
Synopsis 

(Ver Mas abajo en español)

What are the parallels existing between the ancestral indigenous traditions in Mexico and Bön, the most ancient indigenous tradition of Tibet? Their deep respect for nature and their connection to the elements––water, fire, air, wind, space––, their basis in self-knowledge and their intimate relationship with the figure of death, are shared characteristics that help us recognize who we are.

Mexico––a country with a remarkably rich ancestral heritage both in customs and traditions and a profound relationship with the spiritual world, as well as with a history of multiple polarities and contrasts––is going through extremely difficult times in which uncontrollable situations of corruption, impunity and violence disturb peace and the welfare of the many, while or environment is being affected by the mismanagement of natural resources.

In the year 1996, Tenzin Wangyal Rinpoche, a renowned Master of Bön Buddhism, the most ancient, indigenous tradition of Tibet, first came to Mexico to impart his teachings. Here he found fertile ground in which to manifest, through a committed sangha (community of practitioners) distributed across the country, the dream of Yongdzin Tenzin Namdak Rinpoche, the most experienced Teacher of the Bön tradition: the construction of the Great Stupha for World Peace, the largest Buddhist temple in Latin America.

The relevance of this documentary lies in its contribution to the understanding and profound recognition of the ancestral values like the Bon Buddhism and the ones that remain alive in most of Mexico and of the manners in which these are already permeating other cultures, enabling us, through this shared perspective, to discover our true essence. These values are the foundation upon which we can recognize our purity and luminosity, and therefore they provide us with the necessary balance to maintain a harmonious relationship with our environment. 

Your support 

Will help us to continue and finish the production process, footages of Nepal and Tibet and just the last interviews in the Monastery of Menri and Dharamsala (India), and eminent personalities in the areas of the environment, healing and personal growth here in Mexico.

Meet the Director

Salvador Espinosa is the Director and producer of Teokari, Companion on the Path, a documentary that has been selected for participation in various festivals in Mexico and included in the official selection at film festivals in Argentina, India and California; in 2015, this documentary won the award to the best indigenous documentary at the Red Nation Film Festival in Los Angeles, California.

What we need

We need to go to Nepal, India and Tibet,  The filming team consists of the director and a camera assistant. The final filming will be carried out in the months of September to December, 2018. The last production expenses will amount to 6,000 USD; this sum will cover, lodging expenses, car rental, meals, gasoline, etc., and will also include trips to Chihuahua, Torreón, Veracruz and Yucatán to interview sangha members in Chihuahua, Torreón, as well as personalities of the, Mayan and Nahua traditions.

For this reason we need people like you, who enjoy documentaries and who understand that, by showing the value of the indigenous traditions and their relationship of balance with the natural environment, you contribute to expand awareness and you support and enhance the appreciation of these cultures and their ancient wisdom. 

Any sum––large, medium or small––will be helpful.

We are convinced that, once we have filmed the main parts, we will be able to obtain the necessary funds for the post-production process around 15,000 US.

Risks & Challenges

We had a delay in the production process and we apologise to our supporters, because the goals we had where not accomplished in time, but with determination and the right timing we are very close to conclude this process.  

 

Contribute –  Share – Provide support

We truly need help in order to be able to film this documentary, and all support is very welcome.

·       Make a contribution. Challenge others to make a contribution. Any amount helps!

·       Share with your friends. We wish to raise awareness: this money will serve the purpose of contributing to raise awareness, of bringing the message to many. Please share our campaign with your friends and relatives on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.

** Use the  Indiegogo share tools this helps us a lot! **

 

www.authenticwisdomfilms.com

 www.audiomagiavideo.com

Last campaign video

 

Sinopsis en Español

¿Cuáles son los paralelismos que existen entre las tradiciones indígenas ancestrales en México y las del Bön, la tradición indígena más antigua del Tíbet? El respeto profundo que guardan con la naturaleza y sus conexión con los elementos––agua, fuego, aire, viento, espacio––, su base en el autoconocimiento y la íntima relación que tienen con la figura de la muerte éstas características comunes que nos ayudan a reconocer quiénes somos.

México––un país con una herencia ancestral de una gran riqueza en sus costumbres y tradiciones, con una relación profunda con el mundo espiritual y también con una historia de muchas polaridades y contrastes––actualmente atraviesa tiempos sumamente difíciles en los que se viven situaciones incontrolables de corrupción, impunidad y violencia que están afectando la paz, el bienestar de muchos, así como el mal manejo de los recursos naturales está afectando a nuestro entorno. 

En el año de 1996, Tenzin Wangyal Rínpoche, reconocido Maestro del budismo Bön, que es la tradición indígena más antigua del Tíbet, llegó a México a dar sus primeras enseñanzas. Aquí encontró tierra fértil para manifestar, a través de una sangha (comunidad de practicantes) comprometida y esparcida por todo México, el sueño de Yongdzin Tenzin Namdak Rínpoche, el más experto Maestro de estas enseñanzas: la construcción de la estupa Bön para la paz del mundo, el templo budista más grande de América Latina. 

La relevancia de este documental consiste en su aportación a la comprensión y el reconocimiento profundo de los valores ancestrales como el budismo Bon y de los que permanecen vivos en gran parte de México y de las maneras en que éstos ya están permeando a otras culturas y que nos develan, desde esta perspectiva compartida, lo que realmente somos. Estos valores constituyen la base a partir de la cual podemos reconocer nuestra pureza y luminosidad, y en consecuencia nos proporcionan el balance necesario para relacionarnos en armonía con nuestro entorno.

Tu apoyo 

Nos ayudará a continuar con el proceso de producción, tomas de Nepal y Tibet y hacer las ultimas entrevistas en el monasterio de Menri y Dharamsala (India)  y antropólogos especialistas y reconocidas personalidades relacionadas con el medio ambiente, el crecimiento personal y la sanación aquí en Mexico.

Conoce al director

Salvador Espinosa es el Director y productor del documental Teokari Compañero de camino, el cual fue  seleccionado en varios festivales en México y en el extranjero, resultó ganador del premio al mejor documental indígena en el Red Nation Film Festival en Los Ángeles California en 2015, y formó parte de la selección oficial en festivales en Argentina, India y California.

 

Lo que necesitamos

Necesitamos ir a Nepal, India y Tíbet. El equipo de filmación está formado por director y un asistente de cámara.La grabación final  se llevará a cabo entre los meses de septiembre a diciembre del 20178, equivalen a 6,000 USD; esta suma cubrirá los gastos de equipo, hoteles, renta de automóvil, comidas, gasolina, etc., e incluye además viajes a Chihuahua, Torreón, Veracruz y Yucatán,  para realizar entrevistas con miembros de las sanghas de Chihuahua, Torreón, así como con personalidades de las tradiciones, maya, nahua.

Por esto necesitamos de personas como tú, que gusten de los documentales y entiendan que al mostrar el valor de las tradiciones indígenas y su relación de balance con el entorno natural contribuyen al cambio de conciencia y apoyan a fortalecer el aprecio a estas culturas de sabiduría ancestral.

 Cualquier cantidad nos ayuda, así sea grande, mediana o pequeña. 

Estamos convencidos de que, una vez que tengamos las grabaciones principales, vamos a conseguir los fondos necesarios para el proceso de la post producción que tendra un costo aproximado de 15,000 US.

Riesgos y Retos

Tuvimos un retraso en el proceso de producción y ofrecemos disculpas a los que nos apoyaron en la anterior campaña porque las metas que nos pusimos no fueron terminadas a tiempo, pero con determinación y los tiempos adecuados estamos muy cerca de concluir el proceso. 

Contribuye –  Comparte – Apoya

Realmente necesitamos ayuda para poder hacer este documental, y cualquier cosa en que nos puedas apoyar es muy bienvenida.

·       Haz una aportación. Reta a otros a hacer una aportación. ¡Cualquier cantidad ayuda!

·       Comparte con tus amigos. Queremos crear conciencia: el propósito para juntar el dinero es finalmente el de ayudar a crear conciencia, a que llegue el mensaje a muchos. Por favor haz saber a otras personas sobre nuestra campaña en Facebook, Twitter y Instagram. 

** Nos ayuda mucho si usas las herraminetas de compartir que tiene indiegogo !! **

 

www.authenticwisdomfilms.com

 www.audiomagiavideo.com

Video de la campaña anterior

story:
Resumen

 

Hace 17 años llegamos a casa de Elena  para pedirle que nos apoyara con una denuncia de corrupción en el Instituto nacional de las Mujeres, tocamos el timbre, Martina nos abrió y así, sin conocernos, nos pasó a la sala. Elena bajó, nos ofreció un té, nos escuchó, tomó nota, recogió las pruebas y a la semana publicó un reportaje en "La Jornada". Esa es Elena, la que hace suyos todos los problemas que aquejan al país.

Estamos haciendo un documental sobre esta mujer porque tiene muchas cosas qué contar importantes para la memoria de este país. Ella lo conoce desde sus entrañas, ha sido parte de su historia, política y cultural.

Es la primera vez que Elena abre las puertas de su intimidad, nos presenta a su familia, nos deja verla hacer su día a día mientras nos cuenta de sus presentes, pasados y futuros.

Entre todas y todos podemos hacer un documento histórico para que las futuras generaciones sepan quién es Elena Poniatowska, la ciudadana comprometida, la abuela cariñosa, la mujer de acero, la princesa roja.

 

 

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

 Estamos pidiendo $25 000 usd para ayudar con los costos de producción. Queremos que la película sea de un gran nivel, compita o se vea en festivales internacionales y tenga una buena difusión. Para eso necesitamos de todas y todos ustedes.

Al participar de este proyecto serás parte de la historia, porque este documental se va a ver en muchos lados, en muchas plataformas y en muchos periodos de la historia. Será un referente para las siguientes generaciones.

Además te invitaremos a la premiere o te mandaremos un Dvd o blue ray. 

 

 

El impacto

 El impacto de este documental será muy grande. Todo el equipo queremos que lo vea la mayor cantidad de gente posible en distintas partes del mundo. La Universidad Autónoma de México y las librerías Gandhi han puesto a nuestra disposición todos sus canales de difusión en  donde tienen presencia. Réplica films hará una campaña especial en redes sociales para difundir el documental. Y quedará en los archivos de varias plataformas para que varias generaciones conozcan a esta increíble mujer.

 

 

Riesgos y desafíos

 

El único riesgo que tenemos encima es el tiempo. Pero si no llegamos a la meta seguiremos buscando la forma de financiar este proyecto. No vamos a parar. 

 

 

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

 

Si no puedes donar en este momento te pedimos que nos ayudes a difundir la campaña. Usa las herramientas de la plataforma, tus redes sociales, anima a tus amigas y amigos, familiares y colegas de trabajo a que formen parte de este proyecto. 

Muchas Gracias!!!

story:
My name is Daniel Tomlin, a senior at Liberty University, currently pursuing a B.S. in Cinematic Arts. This project is very important to me and is based on the pain and suffering I see the homeless and hurting veterans in our community. After getting the knowhow of how to make a shortfall, I decided to do something about that hurt I see so common. If you and I can cause more awareness for these people and get more people involved in these aspects of our community, we will see a huge increase in support and aid for these people who have done so much for us. By contributing to this project, you will help start a movement towards becoming a more compassionate people group for those who are most hurting.

I have budgeted about $2000 for the success of this project. This amounts for the cast and crew, most importantly the canine actor, food for the crew, locations, makeup, and wardrobe. The short film is pretty well contained, and shouldn't require anything over this amount, but this amount of money not only covers the funds required to even film the project, but also gives protection in case of an on-set emergency. Additionally, here is the best part, if we complete the project and have extra money leftover, every last bit of it will go to charities that support the homeless and veterans! By donating money, it is GUARANTEED to make a difference! 

Like any film production, this is going to be a difficult challenge. Throughout the whole film making process, funding, and marketing, pulling this off is going to take a lot of work. I am confident, however, that we will succeed! As a Senior in the Cinematic Arts major at Liberty University, I am surrounded by wonderful peers and professors all willing to help and lend a hand to our efforts here. That, coupled with my passion for change and your contributions, there are no hurdle tall enough that we can't jump over!

If you can't contribute, please spread the word! Share this project to your friends or family, or perhaps to someone you know who went through these kind of experiences! Every little bit helps, whether that be spare change or a generous sum, its all going into the creation of something beautiful and constructive for our community. Additionally, sharing this project is easy with Indiegogo's share tools! With a click of a button, you can send this campaign to anyone you know on social media platforms, getting them involved as well.

Thank you for your time,  and I can't wait to work with you!!

The short film is pretty well contained, and shouldn't require anything over this amount, but this amount of money not only covers the funds required to even film the project, but also gives protection in case of an on-set emergency. Additionally, here is the best part, if we complete the project and have extra money leftover, every last bit of it will go to charities that support the homeless and veterans! By donating money, it is GUARANTEED to make a difference! 
Like any film production, this is going to be a difficult challenge. Throughout the whole film making process, funding, and marketing, pulling this off is going to take a lot of work. I am confident, however, that we will succeed! As a Senior in the Cinematic Arts major at Liberty University, I am surrounded by wonderful peers and professors all willing to help and lend a hand to our efforts here. That, coupled with my passion for change and your contributions, there are no hurdle tall enough that we can't jump over!
If you can't contribute, please spread the word! Share this project to your friends or family, or perhaps to someone you know who went through these kind of experiences! Every little bit helps, whether that be spare change or a generous sum, its all going into the creation of something beautiful and constructive for our community. Additionally, sharing this project is easy with Indiegogo's share tools! With a click of a button, you can send this campaign to anyone you know on social media platforms, getting them involved as well.
Thank you for your time,  and I can't wait to work with you!!

story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is Lisa Donmall-Reeve of LDR Creative, and I am the lead producer for 'Double Exposure'

I started LDR Creative 2 years ago. We produced a short film called 'Early Mourning' (www.earlymourningfilm.com) which featured in 22 film festivals, had 6 nominations and won 5 awards. I am currently just finishing off production for a feature length documentary called 'Transmission - Roots to Branches' and about to shoot a short film called 'Free' with the creatives of 'Early Mourning'

I started LDR Creative to give emerging artists in all creative fields a chance to shine. There are so many fantastic creative professionals with amazing ideas, and I love to collaborate with them to make the idea become a reality. www.ldrcreativellc.com

Daryl and Austin have been active within the entertainment industry for many years, and we have been working on this project for over a year to get it right! We are all very excited at the possibility of what it will become. Their combined creative vision and talent will make this a short film to remember.

By contributing to this project and helping us complete filming, you will be aiding two very talented writers and an inspiring female director into the work of film making. You will also help create the opportunity of a feature length version become a reality.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $50,000.00

We have a cast of 14 union actors, as well as dancers and background actors. Our crew is a team I have worked with many times before - On The Rocks Films - and our 10 crew members strong. We have 6 different locations in Brooklyn and Manhattan, to help us create the world our leading lady, Dani, over the course of our 4 day shoot.

The budget will be spent on casting, wages, locations, transport, food (very important on set)  creative fees, music rights, post, film festivals and marketing. I am very good at making a budget go as far as it possibly can! But I also like to make sure everyone is paid fairly and fed and treated well.

We have some awesome perks for certain donation levels.

We are also running a lottery competition at the $50 donor level

Signed poster and CD (one of your choice  - Hamilton, Dear Evan Hansen, Greatest Showman) from our amazing multi Grammy Award winning composer Alex Lacamoire.

Premiere Tickets to the film (dependant on the amount given - with guests)

Executive Producer Credit.

** When donating - please note there is no decimal point in the amount box - ie : $25  $10  $50

**IF the full amount is not fully raised , we will secure what you have contributed in an account for 'Double Exposure' ONLY. Your contribution will ONLY be used for the production of this film.

 

Risks & Challenges

Your donation will be one for the arts. With the current political climate, we need support of the public more than ever.

Short films notoriously do not make money. Which is why this is not a financial investment but an investment into the arts and  for the artists.You will help create traction and awareness of this wonderful story, which will ultimately take us to our end goal - a feature length version.

I have been in the entertainment industry for almost three decades, and I have worked with some of the most incredible creatives. You don't survive in the world of show and film , unless you are determined, smart, resourceful and have good instincts - something I pride myself on. With these attributes, your kind contributions will be in safe hands, and well spent, creating a wonderful, inspiring, funny and moving film.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't in a position to help right now, please share this link and all our social media tags.

Thank you!

story:
The writer/director:

My name is Christopher Hewitt, alumnus of the Worlewind Video School of Film, high-functioning-cinemaniac and a self-taught screenwriter. I made my directorial debut on the independent anthology feature I Saw You (2013) for Reel People Films, also co-writing the script, and followed it up with my micro-budget short film One Shot in 2014. Most recently I wrote the feature script Bharal that is currently in pre-production with a fellow filmmaker.

I consider myself a man of my word and of my words.

About the Film:

On a cold, wet night in the middle of nowhere stands Will, the prince of last chances who finally hit zero. He’s nowhere to go but he starts to walk, huddling against the biting wind, telling himself life can’t be any more unfair when a passing car clips a puddle, soaking him. The car pulls over and the driver, Martin, on his way home from a late night in the office, offers him a lift seemingly out of guilt before it turns into a sordid proposition. Will doesn’t want to say yes but he can’t say no and the two find a quiet spot to park up…

...but something starts to go bump in the night before they do.

‘Out at Night’ is a horror film that subverts its genre, where hiding in the shadows is a death sentence and letting yourself be exposed is the best way to stay alive. It’s a story that pushes its boundaries because being human doesn’t mean you can’t be a monster too.

Why Was This Film Written:

First and foremost this was written because I love writing and consider screenplays an art form. A great script deserves to be viewed on a level with all other classic works of literature.

The short is based on a feature horror script I wrote. Inspired by the more psychological horrors of the genre (because I’m too scared to watch the gorier ones) I wanted to explore human nature and the anxieties that don’t go away when the sun comes up, and paranoia that snap at us worse than any ghoul ever could. It's about the instinct we all have to survive no matter the cost to ourselves or to others…

…especially to others.

I wrote both scripts as I wanted to explore my own fears and because what's happening inside our heads can be a darker, lonelier place than a bitter night in the middle of nowhere.

Why Are We Crowdfunding:

Because ambition and enthusiasm are priceless, but filmmaking comes at a cost. We already have a final draft of the script, storyboards and a hugely talented cast and crew who are excited to tell this tale, but we need to cover the other essential costs and need your help to fully bring this project to life. Your investment ensures the best possible film gets made and the craft of everyone involved is seen by as wide an audience as possible.

We all deeply believe in this film and we’re asking you to believe in us.

How Will the Money Be Used

CAST AND CREW PAY – because talent and enthusiasm shouldn’t be exploited.

PRODUCTION INSURANCE – because everyone involved has value beyond their pay (and so does all their stuff).

TRAVEL EXPENSES – because if the cast and crew can’t get here it’s just me standing alone on a road at night yelling ‘action’ to myself.

FOOD – because all artists are starving and everyone is secretly doing this just to get fed.

MAKE-UP/PROSTHETICS/PROPS/WARDROBE – because clothes (and fake blood) maketh the actor (and the actor maketh the character).

EXTRA KIT RENTAL – because we do not want to compromise on the quality of our shared vision.

PERMITS  & LOCATION FEES – because we do not want to be stopped before we have started.

DISTRIBUTION – because we’re not doing this just for ourselves. We want everyone who supports this project to be able to watch it and everyone involved to have their work seen by as many people as possible.

Who Are We:

Cast:

Alastair G Cumming (as Martin) - Alastair has been acting professionally for over two decades, garnering an impressive list of credits that include Velvet Goldmine, Welcome to the Punch, Skins and Dr. Who to name only a few. His experience and talent gives him the depth and subtlety needed to portray a conflicted and complex character such as Martin and his involvement with this project is a huge compliment to everyone involved.

Andrew Dennis (as Will) - chances are that you’ve heard Andrew before, a respected voice actor for over ten years in various audiobooks, computer games, animations and commercials. Well now you’re going to get to know the rest of him and we’re delighted that we get to show you one of Bristol’s best kept secrets playing a nuanced character, one running from the truth of who he is and how he got there.

Ellie Ekers (as Dharma) - a graduate of the National Youth Film Academy, Ellie made her stage debut in 2015, and many more diverse roles in theatre and film quickly followed. She is an actor with an extremely engaging screen presence and we cannot wait to work with her on this short, which we are sure will help take her a very long way in her career.

Laurie French (as...that would be telling) - a man of many talents and passions, Laurie is a gifted performer whose ability to inhabit unconventional characters makes him the perfect choice for the key role of...you’ll see.

Key Crew:

Christopher Hewitt (screenwriter/director) - enough about him already.

Jacob Parish (director of photography) - if the eyes are the window to the soul then Jacob is exactly that to ‘Out at Night’. A collaborator of rare insight he is both a skilled cinematographer and a talented editor, working for the likes of Netflix, the BBC, and a wide range of other exciting companies and producers. He is able to perfectly visualise the project from first shot to last cut and we are very excited to have him on board.

Catarina Oliveira (co-producer/editor) - Catarina edits with the timing and grace of a conductor playing the orchestra. Her body of work boasts the award-winning documentary Alice and Agnes, BBC's Blue Planet II, and hundreds of other credits with production companies all over the world. Catarina has also directed and produced two of her own short films, ‘Escalation’ and ‘The Sea and Sky’, so she is no stranger to the challenges (and wonders) of micro-budget filmmaking.

Inma Azorin (makeup artist/prosthetics) - the title 'makeup artist' has never been so apt as Inma turns every actor into a living, breathing work of art. Her impressive credits talk for themselves (Pirates of the Caribbean, Captain America, Wonder Woman) but her mastery with each human canvas silently enhances every character from biggest lead to smallest extra.

Eduardo Gama (sound) - his 'it's good' in everyone else's 'it's great', and it's that understated perfectionism that finds him on a higher level and makes him ideal for a film where sound is such and important element. Like the others involved Eduardo brings immense value and experience to the project, a hugely talented theatre director in his own right.

 

Your contribution makes a HUGE difference. Thank you for visiting our campaign page. We look forward to making this film and sharing it with you soon.

story:
Short Summary

Hollywood, 1968. Jason Price, a struggling screenwriter whose agent is about to drop him unless he comes up with the next big moneymaker, is forced to move into a low-rent housing complex in West Hollywood. Here he discovers that Kay Gonda, a movie star from the early days of Hollywood, now in her late 60s and a recluse, lives across the hall. A chance meeting with this Greta Garbo-like actress intrigues the young writer, and they strike up an unlikely friendship. Despite growing closer to the actress, Price feels she isn’t telling him the whole story of her life or why she abandoned her career at the height of her popularity. Soon, he becomes obsessed with her story, and uncovers facts surrounding her having been accused of murdering an infamous tycoon, Granton Sayers. He also learns that, on the eve of the murder and on the run from the police, she visited six of her fans who had written her letters of undying devotion. As Price struggles to write his commercial movie script, he is plagued by Gonda’s story and begins to have dreams where parts of her life come to him as black and white scenes from a ‘30s movie. He imagines what might have happened to Gonda as she visited her fans at the time of the alleged murder, building to a climax that he cannot resolve until he learns the truth from the forgotten star on the eve of her death. Knowing Kay Gonda has given Price a newfound commitment that allows him to finish his screenplay. Will it be a success or another failure on his part to finally "make it" in Hollywood? More importantly, he has attempted to do justice to Gonda and to a heroine possessing integrity of the highest order.

The Impact

Gonda is a much-needed antidote to today's predominant climate of personal and societal helplessness, the abject frustration and hopelessness that many of us feel when we watch the news and talk to friends and colleagues about the state of the world. In 1934, when Ayn Rand wrote her play, Ideal, she addressed some important issues that we still grapple with today: What is integrity? Is it important to be honest? Do the ends justify the means? What is success? Happiness? The meaning of life? These are the questions that she answered philosophically and dramatically in her non-fiction works and novels until her death in 1982. And, these are the same issues the characters in Gonda are confronted with, but in the turbulent era of the late 1960s. Gonda: A Hollywood Story will hopefully incite more conversation and analysis over these issues, and offer some clarity in today's complex world where so many have difficulty on a daily basis sorting through the challenges they are confronted with. And how, in the face of these things, pursuing our values with integrity is the only way to truly succeed in life.

What's Needed & What You'll Get

Academy Award nominated filmmaker Michael Paxton's new feature film, Gonda, will incorporate archival scenes from Ayn Rand's 1934 play, Ideal. These scenes were originally adapted for film and shot in 1994 for Paxton's award-winning feature documentary, Ayn Rand: A Sense of Life.  A new “contemporary” story (taking place in the late ‘60s) will be shot in color, while all of the imaginary scenes (the previously shot scenes from Ideal) will be in black and white and interwoven into the same story. Gonda will create a unique opportunity to incorporate a contemporary spin on Ayn Rand's themes of integrity and honesty in a new feature film.

Cast & Crew

It is a wonderful plus that the original actress who portrayed Kay Gonda in the World Premier theatrical version of Ideal (as well as the scenes adapted for film by Michael Paxton)--Janne Peters--will be reprising her role almost 25 years later. This coincides nicely with the fictitious passage of time for the character of the infamous actress in Gonda. The newly created characters of Jason Price (and two others) are still being cast. There are some wonderful actors who are interested in these roles, and they will be announced in the coming weeks when we officially sign them on to the project. This will also be true of the essential crew (Director of Photography, Production Designer, Musical Composer, etc.). Their names and experience in the film industry will also be shared when they come on board as the project progresses.  As of now, the following personnel are officially part of the cast and crew of Gonda:

  • Executive Producer/Writer/Director: Michael Paxton
  • Producer: Ellen Raphael
  • Kay Gonda: Janne Peters
  • Jason Price: Seamus Dever
  • Sharon: Sharmila Devar

Michael Paxton (Executive Producer/Writer/Director) has been in the film industry for over 30 years, working on a variety of live action, animated and stage productions along the way. He directed the world premier of Ayn Rand's play, Ideal, in 1989 at the Melrose Theater, and was the first filmmaker to write, produce and direct a documentary about the author in 1997. The film won an Oscar nomination in 1997 and a Golden Satellite Award for Best Documentary Feature in 1998 and it changed the landscape by exposing Ayn Rand's background and sense of life to the movie-going public. Since then, Michael has been shepherding feature film projects, educational videos and writing screenplays while teaching film production, production design and film history at the Art Institute - Hollywood. He is a member of the Actors Studio as well.​ His list of producing credits include, Lion King 1 1/2 for Disney, Bionicle 3: Web of Shadows. He also co-directed the short, A Place in the Circle with Pixote Hunt, was the Visual Effects Supervisor on Stuart Little 2  for Sony Imageworks and was the Assistant Director on The Pagemaster for Twentieth Century Fox. (https://michaelpaxton.com/)

Ellen Raphael (Producer) came to film and television from an exciting background in theater as a Stage Manager on and off Broadway and in regional productions. She has worked with Directors such as Sir Peter Hall, Peter Sellars, Joseph Papp, Elia Kazan, Alan Schneider, Edwin Sherin Wole Soyinka and Vivian Matalon. Her television and film productions include Line Producing the Emmy and Peabody award-winning PBS series, A Place of Our Own and Los Ninos En Su Casa, the Academy Award-nominated Documentary, Ayn Rand: A Sense of Life, the Emmy Award-winning Public Television series, California Connected, and--with KCET--Wired Science , Power in the Pacific and These Trying Times. Ellen worked as Production Executive on the Disney Theme Park film: Cinemagique which married 64 films together with actors Martin Short, Julie Delpy and Alan Cumming. Ellen also worked with Disney on Soarin’ California and on the animated film, Dinosaur. She later worked on the film Blessed Art Thou, and the television shows Rescue 911 and True Detective.  At the Production Company 44 Blue she Line Produced many Documentary and Reality series including: Cell Dogs, The Christopher Lowell Show, Family Court with Judge Penny, Married to the Army Alaska, Deadliest Warrior and The Wahlburgers.  Ellen is currently working to help produce a civil rights documentary, Wednesdays in Mississippi.

 

Janne Peters (Kay Gonda) originated the role of Kay Gonda in 1989 for the World Premier of Ayn Rand’s Ideal and won a Dramalogue Award and a Drama Critics Circle nomination for her performance. In New York, she received an ACE Award for her role as Marlene in the Off-Broadway production of Fassbinder’s The Bitter Tears of Petra Von Kant. She has worked at various regional theatres, including the Douglas Fairbanks Theatre, Ford’s Theatre, and the touring company of the Washington DC Shakespeare Festival. Her film and TV credits include Lizzie Borden’s Working Girl, Wes Craven’s Shocker, L. A. Law and Parenthood. Most recently, she did a play reading of Our Town with Robert Forster.

   

Seamus Dever (Jason Price) has played authoritative figures on     Army Wives and General Hospital; both of which had him starring  as a doctor. Other forays into television include Mad Men, Drop Dead Diva, NCIS, and all three CSI franchises. He’s also appeared in such films as Hollywoodland with Adrien Brody and Ben Affleck, as well as the independent comedy Ready or Not. His most recent success was as Homicide Detective Kevin Ryan on ABC’s critical and audience favorite, Castle. In addition, Dever is well known to theatre audiences; he  assumed the iconic role of Alex in A Clockwork Orange for which he received rave reviews and nominations for an Ovation, Garland, and Los Angeles Drama Critics Circle Award. Another highlight amidst his over 60 plays and musicals is his notable performance in iWitness at The Mark Taper Forum. Dever is also a lifetime member of the renowned Actor’s Studio. (www.seamusdever.com)

Sharmila Devar (Sharon) began her professional acting career on the stages of Chicago while attending The University of Chicago.  Her television credits span both drama and comedy.  She is best known as Lata on NBC’s groundbreaking comedy Outsourced, and as Lauren Wellman for 3 seasons on the ABC hit Scandal.  Sharmila has performed theater throughout the US, most notably at South Coast Repertory and Steppenwolf Theatre Ensemble.  Recent stage credits include Ayushi in the world-premiere of Mice (EST/LA) and Chicago’s Route 66 Holiday Reading of Love, Actually (playing Sarah aka Laura Linney).  In addition to her TV, stage and commercial work, she narrates audiobooks and is the voice of Countess Ursa Wren on Lucasfilm/Disney XD’s animated Star Wars series.  Sharmila will next be seen in director Noah Baumbach’s new film starring Scarlett Johansson and Adam Driver.  (https://demoreel.com/sharmila-devar)

The Plan

To produce a quality feature film, a total budget of $600,000 will need to be raised. This will include pre-production, production, post production and distribution of the final film. If the total amount of funds are not raised, here's where the funds will go at the various levels of money raised (these are estimated figures):

  • LEVEL 1: When $20,000 is raised, this will enable the digitization and preservation of the Ideal scenes which were shot in 1994 but never finished.
  • LEVEL 2: When $125,000 is raised, this will enable the pre-production (completion of the script, casting, etc.) to be completed.
  • LEVEL 3: When $475,000 is raised, the pre-production and production (shooting the film) can be completed.
  • LEVEL 4: When $600,000 (the entire budget) is raised, the film can finally go into post-production and be distributed.

The Perks

Here are the "perks" that you can take advantage of when you participate in the campaign (from the lowest to highest level of contribution). All of these will also ensure that you get updates on any important news about the project's progress (script completion, casting, distribution, etc.):

  • $25 - Supporter: Download of movie.
  • $75 – Movie Buff: Download and DVD or Blu-ray.
  • $100 – Movie Collector 1: Download and DVD or Blu-ray, custom bookmark, still autographed by the cast.
  • $275 – Movie Collector 2: Download and DVD or Blu-ray, custom bookmark, still autographed by the cast and a mini-poster.
  • $500 - Director “Thank You” 1: Download, DVD or Blu-ray, custom bookmark, mini-poster and a "Thank You" in the end credits of the movie
  • $1,000 – Director “Thank You” 2: Download, DVD or Blu-ray, custom bookmark, autographed mini-poster and one-sheet poster and a “Thank You" in the end credits.
  • $5,000 – Director “Special Thanks": Download, DVD or Blu-ray, custom bookmark, autographed mini-poster and one-sheet poster, an autographed custom-made coffee table book of Kay Gonda’s movie roles and a "Special Thanks" in the end credits.
  • $10,000 – Associate Producer: Download, DVD or Blu-ray, custom bookmark, autographed mini-poster and one-sheet poster, an autographed custom-made movie still book, a visit to the set and an Associate Producer credit.
  • $25,000 - Producer: Download, DVD or Blu-ray, custom bookmark, autographed mini-poster and one-sheet poster, an autographed custom-made movie still book, a visit to the set, a visit to the mixing stage during post production and a Producer Credit.
  • $50,000 & above – Executive Producer: Download, DVD or Blu-ray, custom bookmark, autographed mini-poster and one-sheet poster, an autographed custom-made movie still book, a visit to the set, a visit to the mixing stage during post production, dinner with the director (Michael Paxton) and the star (Janne Peters) and an Executive Producer credit.

Distribution Challenges

When the total budget amount is achieved and the film is completed, Michael Paxton will be distributing the film directly to the contributors to the campaign. In addition, it will be sent to festivals. Theatrical distribution for Gonda will be pursued, but there is no guarantee of this for an independent film. At the very least, the finished film will be available for download, made into a DVD/Blu-ray and screened in a theater for donors.

Other Ways You Can Help

NEW MATCHING CONTRIBUTION OPPORTUNITY!

 

If you cannot contribute to make the film, you still can help us tremendously to reach our goal by doing the following:

  • Please use any way you can to spread the word on the campaign (whether through social media or through personal contacts). Remember that you can also use Indiegogo's share tools!

Thanks again for participating in this project!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hollywood, 1968. Jason Price, a struggling screenwriter whose agent is about to drop him unless he comes up with the next big moneymaker, is forced to move into a low-rent housing complex in West Hollywood. Here he discovers that Kay Gonda, a movie star from the early days of Hollywood, now in her late 60s and a recluse, lives across the hall. A chance meeting with this Greta Garbo-like actress intrigues the young writer, and they strike up an unlikely friendship. Despite growing closer to the actress, Price feels she isn’t telling him the whole story of her life or why she abandoned her career at the height of her popularity. Soon, he becomes obsessed with her story, and uncovers facts surrounding her having been accused of murdering an infamous tycoon, Granton Sayers. He also learns that, on the eve of the murder and on the run from the police, she visited six of her fans who had written her letters of undying devotion. As Price struggles to write his commercial movie script, he is plagued by Gonda’s story and begins to have dreams where parts of her life come to him as black and white scenes from a ‘30s movie. He imagines what might have happened to Gonda as she visited her fans at the time of the alleged murder, building to a climax that he cannot resolve until he learns the truth from the forgotten star on the eve of her death. Knowing Kay Gonda has given Price a newfound commitment that allows him to finish his screenplay. Will it be a success or another failure on his part to finally "make it" in Hollywood? More importantly, he has attempted to do justice to Gonda and to a heroine possessing integrity of the highest order.
The Impact

Gonda is a much-needed antidote to today's predominant climate of personal and societal helplessness, the abject frustration and hopelessness that many of us feel when we watch the news and talk to friends and colleagues about the state of the world. In 1934, when Ayn Rand wrote her play, Ideal, she addressed some important issues that we still grapple with today: What is integrity? Is it important to be honest? Do the ends justify the means? What is success? Happiness? The meaning of life? These are the questions that she answered philosophically and dramatically in her non-fiction works and novels until her death in 1982. And, these are the same issues the characters in Gonda are confronted with, but in the turbulent era of the late 1960s. Gonda: A Hollywood Story will hopefully incite more conversation and analysis over these issues, and offer some clarity in today's complex world where so many have difficulty on a daily basis sorting through the challenges they are confronted with. And how, in the face of these things, pursuing our values with integrity is the only way to truly succeed in life.
What's Needed & What You'll Get

Academy Award nominated filmmaker Michael Paxton's new feature film, Gonda, will incorporate archival scenes from Ayn Rand's 1934 play, Ideal. These scenes were originally adapted for film and shot in 1994 for Paxton's award-winning feature documentary, Ayn Rand: A Sense of Life.  A new “contemporary” story (taking place in the late ‘60s) will be shot in color, while all of the imaginary scenes (the previously shot scenes from Ideal) will be in black and white and interwoven into the same story. Gonda will create a unique opportunity to incorporate a contemporary spin on Ayn Rand's themes of integrity and honesty in a new feature film.
Cast & Crew
It is a wonderful plus that the original actress who portrayed Kay Gonda in the World Premier theatrical version of Ideal (as well as the scenes adapted for film by Michael Paxton)--Janne Peters--will be reprising her role almost 25 years later. This coincides nicely with the fictitious passage of time for the character of the infamous actress in Gonda. The newly created characters of Jason Price (and two others) are still being cast. There are some wonderful actors who are interested in these roles, and they will be announced in the coming weeks when we officially sign them on to the project. This will also be true of the essential crew (Director of Photography, Production Designer, Musical Composer, etc.). Their names and experience in the film industry will also be shared when they come on board as the project progresses.  As of now, the following personnel are officially part of the cast and crew of Gonda:

Executive Producer/Writer/Director: Michael Paxton

Producer: Ellen Raphael

Kay Gonda: Janne Peters

Jason Price: Seamus Dever

Sharon: Sharmila Devar


Michael Paxton (Executive Producer/Writer/Director) has been in the film industry for over 30 years, working on a variety of live action, animated and stage productions along the way. He directed the world premier of Ayn Rand's play, Ideal, in 1989 at the Melrose Theater, and was the first filmmaker to write, produce and direct a documentary about the author in 1997. The film won an Oscar nomination in 1997 and a Golden Satellite Award for Best Documentary Feature in 1998 and it changed the landscape by exposing Ayn Rand's background and sense of life to the movie-going public. Since then, Michael has been shepherding feature film projects, educational videos and writing screenplays while teaching film production, production design and film history at the Art Institute - Hollywood. He is a member of the Actors Studio as well.​ His list of producing credits include, Lion King 1 1/2 for Disney, Bionicle 3: Web of Shadows. He also co-directed the short, A Place in the Circle with Pixote Hunt, was the Visual Effects Supervisor on Stuart Little 2  for Sony Imageworks and was the Assistant Director on The Pagemaster for Twentieth Century Fox. (https://michaelpaxton.com/)
Ellen Raphael (Producer) came to film and television from an exciting background in theater as a Stage Manager on and off Broadway and in regional productions. She has worked with Directors such as Sir Peter Hall, Peter Sellars, Joseph Papp, Elia Kazan, Alan Schneider, Edwin Sherin Wole Soyinka and Vivian Matalon. Her television and film productions include Line Producing the Emmy and Peabody award-winning PBS series, A Place of Our Own and Los Ninos En Su Casa, the Academy Award-nominated Documentary, Ayn Rand: A Sense of Life, the Emmy Award-winning Public Television series, California Connected, and--with KCET--Wired Science , Power in the Pacific and These Trying Times. Ellen worked as Production Executive on the Disney Theme Park film: Cinemagique which married 64 films together with actors Martin Short, Julie Delpy and Alan Cumming. Ellen also worked with Disney on Soarin’ California and on the animated film, Dinosaur. She later worked on the film Blessed Art Thou, and the television shows Rescue 911 and True Detective.  At the Production Company 44 Blue she Line Produced many Documentary and Reality series including: Cell Dogs, The Christopher Lowell Show, Family Court with Judge Penny, Married to the Army Alaska, Deadliest Warrior and The Wahlburgers.  Ellen is currently working to help produce a civil rights documentary, Wednesdays in Mississippi.
 

Janne Peters (Kay Gonda) originated the role of Kay Gonda in 1989 for the World Premier of Ayn Rand’s Ideal and won a Dramalogue Award and a Drama Critics Circle nomination for her performance. In New York, she received an ACE Award for her role as Marlene in the Off-Broadway production of Fassbinder’s The Bitter Tears of Petra Von Kant. She has worked at various regional theatres, including the Douglas Fairbanks Theatre, Ford’s Theatre, and the touring company of the Washington DC Shakespeare Festival. Her film and TV credits include Lizzie Borden’s Working Girl, Wes Craven’s Shocker, L. A. Law and Parenthood. Most recently, she did a play reading of Our Town with Robert Forster.
   
Seamus Dever (Jason Price) has played authoritative figures on     Army Wives and General Hospital; both of which had him starring  as a doctor. Other forays into television include Mad Men, Drop Dead Diva, NCIS, and all three CSI franchises. He’s also appeared in such films as Hollywoodland with Adrien Brody and Ben Affleck, as well as the independent comedy Ready or Not. His most recent success was as Homicide Detective Kevin Ryan on ABC’s critical and audience favorite, Castle. In addition, Dever is well known to theatre audiences; he  assumed the iconic role of Alex in A Clockwork Orange for which he received rave reviews and nominations for an Ovation, Garland, and Los Angeles Drama Critics Circle Award. Another highlight amidst his over 60 plays and musicals is his notable performance in iWitness at The Mark Taper Forum. Dever is also a lifetime member of the renowned Actor’s Studio. (www.seamusdever.com)

Sharmila Devar (Sharon) began her professional acting career on the stages of Chicago while attending The University of Chicago.  Her television credits span both drama and comedy.  She is best known as Lata on NBC’s groundbreaking comedy Outsourced, and as Lauren Wellman for 3 seasons on the ABC hit Scandal.  Sharmila has performed theater throughout the US, most notably at South Coast Repertory and Steppenwolf Theatre Ensemble.  Recent stage credits include Ayushi in the world-premiere of Mice (EST/LA) and Chicago’s Route 66 Holiday Reading of Love, Actually (playing Sarah aka Laura Linney).  In addition to her TV, stage and commercial work, she narrates audiobooks and is the voice of Countess Ursa Wren on Lucasfilm/Disney XD’s animated Star Wars series.  Sharmila will next be seen in director Noah Baumbach’s new film starring Scarlett Johansson and Adam Driver.  (https://demoreel.com/sharmila-devar)
The Plan
To produce a quality feature film, a total budget of $600,000 will need to be raised. This will include pre-production, production, post production and distribution of the final film. If the total amount of funds are not raised, here's where the funds will go at the various levels of money raised (these are estimated figures):


LEVEL 1: When $20,000 is raised, this will enable the digitization and preservation of the Ideal scenes which were shot in 1994 but never finished.

LEVEL 2: When $125,000 is raised, this will enable the pre-production (completion of the script, casting, etc.) to be completed.

LEVEL 3: When $475,000 is raised, the pre-production and production (shooting the film) can be completed.

LEVEL 4: When $600,000 (the entire budget) is raised, the film can finally go into post-production and be distributed.

The Perks
Here are the "perks" that you can take advantage of when you participate in the campaign (from the lowest to highest level of contribution). All of these will also ensure that you get updates on any important news about the project's progress (script completion, casting, distribution, etc.):

$275 – Movie Collector 2: Download and DVD or Blu-ray, custom bookmark, still autographed by the cast and a mini-poster.

$500 - Director “Thank You” 1: Download, DVD or Blu-ray, custom bookmark, mini-poster and a "Thank You" in the end credits of the movie

$1,000 – Director “Thank You” 2: Download, DVD or Blu-ray, custom bookmark, autographed mini-poster and one-sheet poster and a “Thank You" in the end credits.

$5,000 – Director “Special Thanks": Download, DVD or Blu-ray, custom bookmark, autographed mini-poster and one-sheet poster, an autographed custom-made coffee table book of Kay Gonda’s movie roles and a "Special Thanks" in the end credits.

$10,000 – Associate Producer: Download, DVD or Blu-ray, custom bookmark, autographed mini-poster and one-sheet poster, an autographed custom-made movie still book, a visit to the set and an Associate Producer credit.

$25,000 - Producer: Download, DVD or Blu-ray, custom bookmark, autographed mini-poster and one-sheet poster, an autographed custom-made movie still book, a visit to the set, a visit to the mixing stage during post production and a Producer Credit.

$50,000 & above – Executive Producer: Download, DVD or Blu-ray, custom bookmark, autographed mini-poster and one-sheet poster, an autographed custom-made movie still book, a visit to the set, a visit to the mixing stage during post production, dinner with the director (Michael Paxton) and the star (Janne Peters) and an Executive Producer credit.

Distribution Challenges
When the total budget amount is achieved and the film is completed, Michael Paxton will be distributing the film directly to the contributors to the campaign. In addition, it will be sent to festivals. Theatrical distribution for Gonda will be pursued, but there is no guarantee of this for an independent film. At the very least, the finished film will be available for download, made into a DVD/Blu-ray and screened in a theater for donors.
Other Ways You Can Help
NEW MATCHING CONTRIBUTION OPPORTUNITY!
 
If you cannot contribute to make the film, you still can help us tremendously to reach our goal by doing the following:
Please use any way you can to spread the word on the campaign (whether through social media or through personal contacts). Remember that you can also use Indiegogo's share tools!
Thanks again for participating in this project!

story:
If you actually have time to read this, I'm impressed.

It has been said that life gives you the test, then the lesson. 

This is to fund the feature intelligent film "Answers". A film that will give clueless people the lesson first. You can provide as little as $1,

Here is the script. We're letting you see it to be fair. If you're using a phone, you may have to download a pdf reader. We don't think you'll agree with everything, but we hope you will like enough.

The rest of this is for any questions you might have and includes screen tests of other cast.

 

The cast will memorize a few pages at a time.

There is no conflict in the story because it will be in the audience.

The video is a little different from the script because we don't want to risk offending cream puffs. The feature will stick to the script.

Many people are going to be concerned about the scenes from other movies and licensing. I cite fair use. Worst case they just won't go in.

None of the video will be in the feature. If this gets funded, we're doing those parts again and better.

Business is a woman in the trailer and a man in the script because in my opinion that character, and Politics, can be either gender. The actor who played Politics, Odell Crayton, will be in the feature.

There are many smart men who are dumb with women. That's why. Watch the intro to Idiocracy.

Let's make this a real team effort. We are willing to consider changes to the script depending on how much sense your suggestion makes, if you have one.

    A small group of dedicated people want to change the world.

    J King is Associate Producer due to his connections. He might also be cast, depending on auditions. I'm picky.

    Julie Kida will play the title role. She has connections too. Permission to use photo by Johnny Quattlebaum. And yes I agree that she could play a live action Little Mermaid.

    Lisa DeLeon plays the Girlfriend.

    Screen tests for other characters:

    J King referred 

    The models are there to add scenery to the substance. We are not depending on their looks to make it work, but people will be looking at it.

    Mohammad Ahmed will be the Muslim. It's hard to find a Muslim actor. Please respect I could cast a hispanic to be the Muslim. I just want to keep it real.

    Mohammad's IMDB

    The incomplete cast is partly because it is not a paying gig yet.  Put money into this and you will get updates.

    Locations

    We only have one location set up, but it's the hard one to get. This pub will serve as the restaurant. But that makes sense anyway due to the intelligent discussions that happen at pubs.

     

    More Perks

    Life will begin... to get better for everyone.

    Keep the receipt of your donation. Having something to do with this could help you in the future, like with a date or job interview.

    In reference to the script perk, I am not expecting to raise funds for it because it would cost so much, especially to do it... justice. I estimate minimum 25 million.

    If this actually gets 25m, both get produced.

    Distribution

    We'll do it online first for donors, then go from there.
     
    Budget

     

    The money mostly pays the cast and director of photography. I will volunteer to be the crew in addition to providing direction. It's a simple project with an unknown cast, which explains the modest budget. The ironic thing is I'm the only one who won't get paid. This is for the film, not me.

    J King can get the locations, vehicles and props. We just need money to pay for rental.

    I will use public domain sound effects for the car accident. I might even record audio of me screeching a car off the road. I want to anyway, sounds like fun!

    Also

    If you share I recommend you also email the link. A lot of people don't check their social accounts that much, especially if they have a schedule.

    I want to hire a producer. In film a producer is a supervisor. Everyone will be taking this seriously, which means making obviously good decisions, but I hope to have someone on set who really knows what they're doing. That will require more than 25k. How much more depends on the person.

    I'm going to have this filmed like El Mariachi as much as possible. As possible may just be a few scenes. If you haven't seen EM, you need to. It was selected for preservation in the Library of Congress. Yes that is action and this isn't, but the cinematography is spectacular and I want to apply the style if I can.

    The more money this gets the better it will be.

    I need to thank Maria's Taco Xpress for letting us use their restaurant in the video.

    I'm not happy with how I came across in the video. I only had the money for 1 hour. Perfection would have taken more.

    Fixed funding would provide a refund if this doesn't make enough money but not everyone has Paypal. If it doesn't get enough, we'll produce what we can and try this again if necessary. You will see what we are able to do.

     

    I end with a joke I came up with:

    What happens when an irresistible force meets an immovable object?

    They get married.

J King can get the locations, vehicles and props. We just need money to pay for rental.
I will use public domain sound effects for the car accident. I might even record audio of me screeching a car off the road. I want to anyway, sounds like fun!
Also
If you share I recommend you also email the link. A lot of people don't check their social accounts that much, especially if they have a schedule.
I want to hire a producer. In film a producer is a supervisor. Everyone will be taking this seriously, which means making obviously good decisions, but I hope to have someone on set who really knows what they're doing. That will require more than 25k. How much more depends on the person.
I'm going to have this filmed like El Mariachi as much as possible. As possible may just be a few scenes. If you haven't seen EM, you need to. It was selected for preservation in the Library of Congress. Yes that is action and this isn't, but the cinematography is spectacular and I want to apply the style if I can.
The more money this gets the better it will be.
I need to thank Maria's Taco Xpress for letting us use their restaurant in the video.
I'm not happy with how I came across in the video. I only had the money for 1 hour. Perfection would have taken more.
Fixed funding would provide a refund if this doesn't make enough money but not everyone has Paypal. If it doesn't get enough, we'll produce what we can and try this again if necessary. You will see what we are able to do.
 
I end with a joke I came up with:
What happens when an irresistible force meets an immovable object?
They get married.

story:
"What I say is, a town isn't a town without a bookstore. It may call itself a town, but unless it's got a bookstore it knows it's not fooling a soul."

-Neil Gaiman (AMERICAN GODS)



The Last Independent Bookstore in Bloomsburg...

The Cloak and Dragon Bookstore has seen it all: theft, vandalism, bad economies...even a brief tangle with that most terrible enemy of all, fire. It has survived for 18 years at the heart of Bloomsburg, linking generations through the wild and tumultuous beauty of the English language (and several others besides!) across half a hundred genres and subgenres, and through the singular and irreplaceable delight of browsing, unfettered by sidebars and pop-ups, in the atmosphere of exploration and discovery that is the hallmark of bookstores the world over.

Now it stands at the brink of extinction.

A bookstore is more than a business. It's a place of culture, a place to learn, a place to find joy in both memory and anticipation of the future. We have done our best to expand upon that tradition with locally-made luxuries of all kinds, in addition to our reading stock, and we have every confidence that the Cloak and Dragon has what it takes to flourish. So what's stopping us?

Time.

Put simply, we are an independent bookstore with a staff of three, all of whom are now facing expansions in the traditions of their personal lives - expansions that offer new opportunities but also meet a marked shortage of hours available, and in fact, by autumn, it will be impossible to maintain our regular schedule. Unfortunately, our profits are not such that we can cut out most of the week and still expect to manage all of our bills. The necessity now is to sell, but sale is a delicate proposition, involving a period of search and courtship, and if we can't sell - well, there's nothing for it. We'll disappear, and there will be one less light on Main Street at night. We don't want that. We don't want what it will mean to Bloomsburg. We don't want to see our legacy die.

So we come, humbly, to you.

Our goal is simple. Keep the bookstore open - keep us breathing. We need time, more than anything else, to find a worthy heir to continue on the Cloak and Dragon's lineage, and that's all we're looking to achieve. 

What We Need From You

  • We need least $18,000 to cover continued operational costs over the next five months - these include our rent to the Philipps Emporium, the cost of book and coffee shipments, and bills for our wi-fi, our phone and merchant services, our refreshment offerings, and assorted store supplies. Our goal is to remain open through Christmas for several days a week, to be with our community for at least one more holiday season. There's no limit to our commitment in this regard; if we exceed our campaign goal, we'll keep going as long as we can at whatever hours we can manage.
  • Our ultimate purpose - our best-case scenario - is to attract a buyer willing to carry on our legacy. Bloomsburg needs a bookstore, and the benefits a bookstore offers are truly timeless. We have absolute faith in the literate community of our town, but a marked shortage of TIME - with love and enthusiasm, we think the Cloak and Dragon, and Bloomsburg, are ready for a revival that'll send shockwaves right through Main Street. We want to see that dream come true. We hope that this campaign will communicate our faith in it, and showcase exactly how much Bloomsburg wants to see our legacy survive.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate directly, that's okay! There are lots of ways you can help:

  • We live and die by word of mouth. Tell your friends, spread the word, use the Indiegogo share tools - every soul you reach is one more chance for us, and maybe a few of those souls will be kind enough to keep the message going!
  • Shop locally! We'd love to have your business - but every small business in Bloomsburg is part of a greater whole, and every contribution you make ultimately strengthens that whole. Small businesses face new challenges in this increasingly digital and globalized world, but so long as they have heart - as long as YOUR heart is with them - they'll have a place and a purpose in our world.

Unfortunately, our profits are not such that we can cut out most of the week and still expect to manage all of our bills. The necessity now is to sell, but sale is a delicate proposition, involving a period of search and courtship, and if we can't sell - well, there's nothing for it. We'll disappear, and there will be one less light on Main Street at night. We don't want that. We don't want what it will mean to Bloomsburg. We don't want to see our legacy die.
So we come, humbly, to you.
Our goal is simple. Keep the bookstore open - keep us breathing. We need time, more than anything else, to find a worthy heir to continue on the Cloak and Dragon's lineage, and that's all we're looking to achieve.    What We Need From You  We need least $18,000 to cover continued operational costs over the next five months - these include our rent to the Philipps Emporium, the cost of book and coffee shipments, and bills for our wi-fi, our phone and merchant services, our refreshment offerings, and assorted store supplies. Our goal is to remain open through Christmas for several days a week, to be with our community for at least one more holiday season. There's no limit to our commitment in this regard; if we exceed our campaign goal, we'll keep going as long as we can at whatever hours we can manage.
Our ultimate purpose - our best-case scenario - is to attract a buyer willing to carry on our legacy. Bloomsburg needs a bookstore, and the benefits a bookstore offers are truly timeless. We have absolute faith in the literate community of our town, but a marked shortage of TIME - with love and enthusiasm, we think the Cloak and Dragon, and Bloomsburg, are ready for a revival that'll send shockwaves right through Main Street. We want to see that dream come true. We hope that this campaign will communicate our faith in it, and showcase exactly how much Bloomsburg wants to see our legacy survive.    
Other Ways You Can Help

 If you can't donate directly, that's okay! There are lots of ways you can help:  We live and die by word of mouth. Tell your friends, spread the word, use the Indiegogo share tools - every soul you reach is one more chance for us, and maybe a few of those souls will be kind enough to keep the message going! Shop locally! We'd love to have your business - but every small business in Bloomsburg is part of a greater whole, and every contribution you make ultimately strengthens that whole. Small businesses face new challenges in this increasingly digital and globalized world, but so long as they have heart - as long as YOUR heart is with them - they'll have a place and a purpose in our world.

story:
What is Inkless?

 Inkless is about being comfortable in your skin no matter what society says you should be, whether you have tattoos or not. I choose this story because it explores the idea of finding yourself in an unaccepting society. 

My vision for Inkless is to bring my script to come to life by creating a short film that can be simple to understand, fun to watch and have great inlining meaning and subtext underneath the surface. 

What is Inkless about?

 Sklyer, our main protagonist, tries his best to impress his dates, each woman expressing her disinterest in him through text messages. He decides to take a risk for the first time in his life: getting his first tattoo. Since tattoos are out of his comfort zone, Skyler goes a bit further with each session hoping to impress each new date but fails miserably. Finally, after a series of ridiculous tattoos over his body, he finally musters up enough courage to ask out the one girl in the tattoo shop that has been having her eyes on him. What happens next? That's where your donations come into play!

What am I looking for from you?

I have a passion for making films and a unique voice in this world. I wish I could have a large body of work to display but the truth is that is why I am here. Everyone deserves a start and here it is for me. I have directed a few small things but this project is my first major film.  

I feel shooting micro short films are a great way to begin a career in the film industry as a film director. I have an amazing crew here in Savannah at my side ready to bring my script to life. Your Indie gogo contributions will help with getting our production off the ground.

The Impact of help and giving

I try to be transparent and believe if you explain things in detail to people, you have a better chance of success. I have a wife and two daughters, work two jobs and have minimal time for many things such as working on film projects. But my dream to one day tell great stories through film allows me to persevere through my challenges. My support from my family and the help of each and every one of you will be very helpful if given the opportunity to help bring my vision to life.

Risks & Challenges

I want to be honest and communicate with you every step of the way. I am not here to take any donations for personal gain. I rather work three jobs for that. But I am not ashamed to say that I need help in raising the money for production design, catering, location fees, transportation and film festival fees to make it happen. 

Where is all the money going, anyways?

I have included below a general breakdown of where the money will go: 
Production Design Costs $1,000.00
Location Fee (A warehouse) $500.00
Make-up Costs $300.00
Tattoo Sign $300.00
Film Festival Fees $1,000.00
Tattoo Art (for actors) $100.00
External hard Drives (editing and backup) $500.00
Gas and Transportation (Atlanta crew; total of 4) $300.00
Props for tattoo shop $250.00
U-Haul Rental (2 trucks: Props and Film Equipment) $250.00

story:
ASIAN VOICES NEEDS YOUR HELP TO KEEP OUR SHOW ON AIR!

Hello! We are the cast of Asian Voices. Our passion is to create a better understanding and awareness of the Asian and Pacific Islander communities in Southern California through the power of media! We need your help in raising funds to complete our second season of Asian Voices!

Asian Voices currently airs on TV through Channels 4SD, Cox 3 OC and TvK24 in LA. You can also find full episodes on the Asian Voices YouTube Channel after they air on TV. Please help us keep this show on air!

Asian Voices is the direct result of a small but dedicated, creative, passionate and talented team who have a common vision to provide the Asian community with a positive representation on mainstream television. While many Asian communities have their own native language channels, most don’t have access to mainstream cable outlets or English programming. We want to help these communities be recognized in a positive light for their contributions to Southern California's social and economic success while giving them their own "voice" in the media. This is why Asian Voices is so valuable to both the API community and all communities living here. Asian Voices plays a major part in being the cultural bridge for these communities!

We need to raise a minimum of $8,000 to cover the remaining production costs and expenses. Our second season premiered on cable TV August 8, 2015. We need to deliver the remaining 6 episodes by the end of September.

As an independently produced program, our success directly depends on support from our sponsors and community. By sponsoring Asian Voices, you will keep the show on the air and support its important mission of providing a voice in media for the API community. 

As a bonus, your name will be credited on our show and you have a chance to view the upcoming episodes before they air! Anyone who donates $750 or more will be credited as an Executive Producer on the closing credits in each of our remaining 6 episodes.  

About Asian Voices TV Show 

Supported by Asian Culture and Media Alliance, Asian Voices is a Lifestyle & Entertainment show in English featuring the Asian and Pacific Islander community in Southern California. 

The cast includes talented hosts who cover stories about the API community ranging from cultural events, food fashion, music, and film to relevant issues that affect the local API community. Important API community leaders and organizations are also featured.

Asian Voices provides an important role for the various API communities through an un-biased lens. The goal is to educate and enlighten viewers about the valuable contributions from the API community, both culturally and financially through promoting their achievements and providing a better appreciation of this diversified community.

Asian Voices also inspires underprivileged Asian youth and women by providing career opportunities for them to learn about media production as well as a chance to work directly with the cast and crew on the show.

Meet the Asian Voices Season Two Cast and Connect with us on Facebook!

Main Host and Producer - Cathlyn Choi

Segment Host - Wendell Pialet

Segment Host - Melodie Tao

Segment Host - Ivan Cheong

Segment Host - Alice Kim

Segment Host - Melissa Deleon

Segment Host - Howard Ou

Segment Host - Teresa Meng

What We Need

Our goal is to raise $20,000 for the production of our remaining 6 episodes. This is only a fraction of what it would normally cost to produce a broadcast quality tv show. However,  we need a minimum of $8,000 to produce and deliver at least 3 more episodes (9 segments) to channel 4SD by the end of September, 2015. If we miss this deadline, our show will be cancelled from the programming lineup. 

To be clear, this is NOT a web or Youtube series. The show is aired on a local cable television networks, reaching an estimated 20 million households, specifically on Channel 4, Cox 3 and tvK24. Please help us keep our show on air so we can continue to get our voices heard! 

Who can Help

Anyone interested in learning about the Asian and Pacific Islander culture and community and supporting our mission of this wonderful program!

You can also help by connecting with us on Facebook and Twitter and sharing this campaign. Let your friends, family and co-workers know about us on social media.

On behalf of the Asian Culture and Media Alliance Board and Asian Voices Production Crew and Cast, we thank you for your help in keeping our TV show on air!

story:
Short Summary

Hi internet person. My name is Josh Denny, and I'm a Stand-Up Comedian living in Los Angeles, CA. We're raising money for my newest one-hour special called "Provoked," which we hope to have out some time this year! The special will feature an hour of new comedy by me, and will be directed by filmmaker Chris Raab a.k.a. Raab Himself from Jackass, CKY, and Viva La Bam.

What We Need & What You Get

Here's where we need your help:

  • We're currently raising $5000 to get us started on the project. If we raise more, that's great and you're awesome. The money goes towards our production of the show that evening, including our equipment and labor costs for the filming, as well as post-production.
  • We've included some cool perks for your help & donations.
  • If we don't reach our goal, we'll just spend your money on sandwiches and prostitutes. Just kidding, we'll still make the special. It just won't be as awesome as we want it to be.

The Impact

We can't do it without you. Seriously. If we could, we wouldn't be here. We'd just be making specials.

  • If you like comedy and comedians that push boundaries and try to find humor in all of the things that surround us in every day life, then you want to be a part of this project. Provoked is a special about the how our brains work, and the way we tend to be as people, and why we're ridiculous. It will also be a unique special in that it will show you a side of comedy with footage that you haven't seen yet. 
  • Raab makes incredible projects, and has filmed many of your favorite shows. He recently made a super cool short film called "Borrowed Happiness." Go check it out!
  • We want to make a special that is original, unique, intimate, and all of the things you'd experience at a live show, and we can't do that without you.

Risks & Challenges

Filming a special is a HUGE undertaking. We've got several cameras to rent, a crew to pay, lighting, set design, editing, etc.

  • We're extremely resourceful filmmakers, and know how to stretch your dollar to give you the best possible finished product on a budget.
  • We're calling in favors, and working with only our closest filmmaking friends to do this on the cheap, and still make it look like a great special that you would see from a large studio or production company.

Other Ways You Can Help

Money is tight all around. We get it. Maybe you can't donate, but you can still play a big role in helping us get this thing off the ground:

  • Share our project on social media, through Twitter, Facebook, Email, even text messages. There are share buttons all over our page, so feel free to use them to help us out!
  • Pass it on to anyone that you think would dig the project: fans of comedy, people that want to produce content, or whoever you think can help play a part. We can't have too much help.
Thanks for taking time out of your day to check out our project, and thanks for all of your shares, comments, donations, and feedback!
