story:
Invention Background

When the inventor of Snap It screw was repairing a broken pair of glasses she thought there had to be an easier way. On a mission to finding a solution that would save time and make this process much easier she came up with the revolutionary SnapIt screw.  The patented screw has a unique feeder tab that makes repairs fast and easy. Further information on the Snap It screw itself is below:-

There are three simple steps involved in fixing your glasses with Snap It :-

The Snap It can be used by optical professionals to fix glasses but we also made a kit for consumers to fix their glasses at home,  The product highlights of the Revolutionary Snap It Repair Kit are as follows:-

Each kit contains the following:-

The repair kits look like this:-

They can be displayed using shelf ready packaging or via clipstrips:-


What is the project we are looking for help with?

With the help of Indiegogo we are going to fully launch Snap It in the UK and increase the awareness of the Consumer Repair Kit.  Our key challenge is no one has heard of the Snap It brand and does not know the benefits our our revolutionary product.

Where will the money be spent?

A) Buying Stock

The first thing the money will be spent on is acquiring our first shipment of SnapIt repair kits in the UK.  SnapIt is a new product in Europe so we are hoping after we get the inventory purchased we can expand into retail stores all across Europe. With the help of Kickstarter and your investment we know that we can make SnapIt a household name available at retail stores all over Europe. 

B) Marketing/PR

We will try to obtain as much 'free' PR as possible and are currently sending information to a lot of online bloggers and mainstream media writers.  That said, we do need to spend some money hence why we are on IndieGoGo.  

The majority of the money will therefore be used to run a cost effective marketing campaign through social media and Google Ads; our product lends itself to being demonstrated so we think this strategy could work well.  This will involve creating a short online viral video as well as a creative advert for offline media spend.  There is obviously then the actual marketing spend to get the viral video and other adverts out there.

C) Trade Shows

We will also use some of the money to attend a couple of key trade shows to get the product out to potential retail customers. 

FAQ

1) Will the Repair Kit work on any glasses?

Yes the Kit will fix regular glasses, prescription glasses, sunglasses, childrens glasses etc

2) Are all the screws the same size?

There are five different screw sizes in the retail kit

story:
A Brief History

In 2014, the City of Philadelphia officially recognized “N3rd Street” as a growing corridor of Philly’s thriving collaborative, creative, startup, and technology community. N3rd Street is a melting pot of industries and interests, including but not limited to design nerds, art nerds, fashion nerds, technology nerds, startup nerds, food nerds, sustainability nerds, science nerds, game nerds, history nerds, and a whole lot more. 

The official naming ceremony took place in Liberty Lands Park. Since then, we’ve seen the N3rd Street community continue to grow with N3rd Street Farmers Market, N3rd Street Gamers, N3rd Street Prom, and more. 


This year, we celebrate the 1-year birthday party of N3rd Street, in the place of its birth, Liberty Lands Park. The event will take place on a First Friday and will include interactive & informational booths from Philly-based startups and tech companies, games, live entertainment, and local drinks and food! Additionally, due to the efforts of Bamboo Wifi & Jarvus Innovations, Liberty Lands Park will be enabled with free Wifi, the first install of the N3rd Street Wifi Network.

Our Goals

1) To celebrate N3rd Street, the local businesses, and highlight companies doing great things in our community!

2) Fundraising for N3rd Street initiatives: 

 • To create micro-grants for Code for Philly developers to build software tools to improve N3rd Street and Philadelphia as a whole

 • To build a free “N3rd Street Wifi Network” with Bamboo Wifi

 • To support local community centers, parks departments and cleaning efforts, and after-school programs

 • To support local schools and neighborhood associations to involve kids in projects with the tech, music, and artist community

3) To spread national awareness of the City of Philadelphia’s support of entrepreneurs and the strength of our technology community

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Help get the word out and make some noise about your campaign
  • Tweet @N3rdSt
  • Get involved!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Introduction 

The Tall, Directed by Max Hardyk, is about a man, David, who struggles to survive in a world dominated by tall, enigmatic beings, and tries to hold on to his own sanity and moral values. 

This is a story about what it truly means to be human and at what lengths would one go through to survive?

The Story

Our story takes place in a post-apocalyptic world where monstrous giants now wander and decimate the land. David, a mere survivor of it all, walks a lone gravel road with a pack of supplies and a gun for protection. These days everything is a threat.  

The life he had before was everything, now he has nothing. Haunted by his past, it's the only thing keeping him sane. Pieces of his past form together as David goes on his journey, seeing what his life was like before and how he got here in the present. 

As David walks down this gravel road, he comes across an abandoned vehicle. With slight hope, he goes over and searches for supplies. As he walks to the driver's side, he then sees a stranger sitting in the driver's seat. They both quickly pull up their weapons, aiming at each other, but neither shoots.

David grips his rifle nervously and shifts his mouth, unsure if he'll be able to shoot if necessary. After a moment, he notices the stranger is holding his side. He was injured. David is now faced with a choice to kill this man, or to help him. 

This choice spirals into a mad journey of what it truly means to be human and just how much is one willing to do to survive?

 

The Crew

Risks & Challenges

There are a lot of risks and challenges that come with this project. Black Medallion Productions is very new and is still taking off. As filmmakers, we want to tackle these challenges together and make our project reality. One of our biggest challenges is making this film look realistic. We want realistic props, costumes, and VFX. Those three words alone are already expensive. With proper funding, we can make this project have the look we want.

This project will require a lot of time and resources and the only thing holding us back is lack of funding. Help would be greatly appreciated. We offer cool and exciting rewards for those who help sponsor and support us such a posters, colored story boards, and even special props! So please consider becoming a donator today!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is able to donate, but that doesn't mean you can't help! Help us by spreading the word about the project to your friends and family and share this with others on social media!

Conclusion

As a lover of Sci-Fi, Horror, and Filmmaking, I am excited to merge these together and make The Tall. I've been wanting to make this project for a while and it would be a dream come true. If this campaign is successful, we'll be submitting The Tall to various film festivals and eventually put online for all to enjoy. 

We're excited to bring this project to life, but this can only happen with your help. If you are as excited as I am to experience an apocalyptic world dominated by The Tall, then please consider sponsoring us today!
story_txt:
Introduction 
The Tall, Directed by Max Hardyk, is about a man, David, who struggles to survive in a world dominated by tall, enigmatic beings, and tries to hold on to his own sanity and moral values. 
This is a story about what it truly means to be human and at what lengths would one go through to survive?

The Story
Our story takes place in a post-apocalyptic world where monstrous giants now wander and decimate the land. David, a mere survivor of it all, walks a lone gravel road with a pack of supplies and a gun for protection. These days everything is a threat.  
The life he had before was everything, now he has nothing. Haunted by his past, it's the only thing keeping him sane. Pieces of his past form together as David goes on his journey, seeing what his life was like before and how he got here in the present. 
As David walks down this gravel road, he comes across an abandoned vehicle. With slight hope, he goes over and searches for supplies. As he walks to the driver's side, he then sees a stranger sitting in the driver's seat. They both quickly pull up their weapons, aiming at each other, but neither shoots.
David grips his rifle nervously and shifts his mouth, unsure if he'll be able to shoot if necessary. After a moment, he notices the stranger is holding his side. He was injured. David is now faced with a choice to kill this man, or to help him. 
This choice spirals into a mad journey of what it truly means to be human and just how much is one willing to do to survive?
 

The Crew


Risks & Challenges
There are a lot of risks and challenges that come with this project. Black Medallion Productions is very new and is still taking off. As filmmakers, we want to tackle these challenges together and make our project reality. One of our biggest challenges is making this film look realistic. We want realistic props, costumes, and VFX. Those three words alone are already expensive. With proper funding, we can make this project have the look we want.
This project will require a lot of time and resources and the only thing holding us back is lack of funding. Help would be greatly appreciated. We offer cool and exciting rewards for those who help sponsor and support us such a posters, colored story boards, and even special props! So please consider becoming a donator today!


Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that not everyone is able to donate, but that doesn't mean you can't help! Help us by spreading the word about the project to your friends and family and share this with others on social media!
ConclusionAs a lover of Sci-Fi, Horror, and Filmmaking, I am excited to merge these together and make The Tall. I've been wanting to make this project for a while and it would be a dream come true. If this campaign is successful, we'll be submitting The Tall to various film festivals and eventually put online for all to enjoy. We're excited to bring this project to life, but this can only happen with your help. If you are as excited as I am to experience an apocalyptic world dominated by The Tall, then please consider sponsoring us today!

story:
FATE (short film), a burnout hitman wants to leave the criminal world behind to raise his daughter and become a productive person in society.

FRANKO is a 41 years old guy, father of a nine years old girl named KEYLA. He grew up in a violent and rough environment dominated by drugs. Eventually, FRANKO was involved in the criminal world. That environment led him to do dirty jobs. First, he started doing small jobs to survive, then he got used to that kind of lifestyle that even doing jail time was not enough to rehabilitate him. The world of crime finally caught him with bigger and relentless jobs. In the course of time, FRANKO became a hitman.

FRANKO now has a dream...He wants to go on the path of redemption and reconcile with his girlfriend, VICKY, who is also KEYLA's mother. FRANKO desires to dedicate himself to his family but first he must do one last job for his boss THE QUEEN. Would he accomplish his dream?

​FATE's underlying messages include good and evil, the importance of family, redemption and destiny.

This project is very significant for us because we would have the opportunity to showcase our skills and advance our careers in the filmmaking industry which would be extremely rewarding. I thank you if you can donate anything and as a gesture of appreciation, I would like to put your name in this film. Please check the PERKS section for more details.

 

 

  

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Your donations will be used for the following:

  • Feed cast and crew
  •  Gas stipend (if possible)
  • Production costs
  • Post production costs
  • Advertisement on social media
  • Festival fees
  • Premiere costs

 

 

We are looking to raise a minimum of $3, 947

 

Even if you can't help financially please share this campaign with as many people as possibly to increase the exposure for all of us!

And that's all there is to it. Thanks!

story:
Short Summary

With this new Documentary, you will find yourself emerged into the story of Charles Manson and his childhood in Cincinnati, Ohio.  Meeting people who knew him, some family and locations to which he roamed and even some of the jails to where he got his start of developing into the man you knew him to become.

  • My name is Nick Pirrmann and I have over 10 years of film making experience working with people like Bruce Willis, Mark Ruffalo, Anne Hathaway, Ron Howard and James Franco, just to name a few, Helping create wonderful films many of you have probably enjoyed yourselves. Now I want to explore another form of story telling and  bring you this documentary.  Not only to draw you into a true story but also to help educate you about something interesting, and the exploration of a wonderful City as well.
  • This campaign is important to us because it sheds light on the city I grew up in and grew to love and call my home. Also, to show the history and beginnings of one of America's most famous and infamous people to be named top leader of villains who committed such heinous murders known to man.
  • If you contribute to this project it will help grow the knowledge of a great city but also the education of what the world can do to a young soul and fragile mind, and what can become of a person when the people he knew can turn on him, making him turn to the only life he learned to know before his death in prison. It will also help you become a part of history and have a hand in making something great!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Let us explain a little bit what we are looking for:

  • In order for us to make this Documentary we need $3,500.  Why that much? well because we would like to have the state of the art equipment and talented team to help produce a great quality product for YOU, the viewers to enjoy, to give you astonishing shots and amazing visuals of the great City of Cincinnati, Ohio and to get great audio and picture of the people being interviewed. we would also like to hire a Narrator who is well spoken and has a great voice to help guide you through this experience.
  • We need to pay the crew attached to this project, we also need to feed the crew, and pay for travel (fuel) for when we drive around the city to film the specific locations. we also will need to use a portion of the funds to pay for some locations, to pay for releases of pictures and rights to use some material in our documentary.
  • Let's make things even more interesting, those who donate will not only get their name in the credits of the film, they will also be able to receive a copy of the film signed by me and the crew in thanks for your support, you can also receive a limited edition poster along with other perks. Each perk is different and are different dollar amounts.
  • Now if we do not reach the entire goal, all of the funds will still go towards the production of this film, and those who donated here on INDIEGOGO will still receive their perks. but unfortunately  we will still have to finish funding this project before we can start production, so we will find other ways to finish funding it, if we do not reach our goal here.
  • Some other goals and things we would like to do with this project after it is finished, is to take it to festivals and to make it as huge as possible! and with your help we can do that. Thank you so, so much in advance!! and we hope we can make this a reality for you to enjoy!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • If you are unable to contribute, that's OK we understand. One way you can still help and contribute is to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign, "From Whence He Came".
  • Also remember to use the Indiegogo share tools! it will help out a bunch!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
The Story

This is Control  is about loneliness and the lengths someone will go to fight it. It explores how different people view relationships and how this is molded by their past experiences. How a need for control and manipulation leads to self destructive tendencies. 

Sam is the new kid in school. He struggles making friends but desperately wants the typical high school posse that everyone else seems to have. One day he meets Andie, a stoic and mysterious girl who gives Sam the friendship he greatly wants. Andie’s controlling nature leads her down a path of manipulation with Sam as an easy target.  

Why This Film?

My name is Jacob Schermerhorn, I am currently a senior at the University of Kansas and This is Control  will be my final Capstone project for the film program. This story has been something I had been planning since I started studying film at KU. It deals with ideas and themes that I enjoy exploring and have experienced in my friendships and relationships. I want to be able to display the complexities of friendships and relationships, a topic that has always fascinated me. 

A majority of the film will be shot in my hometown of Wamego, Kansas. This is a detail I knew I wanted to include since the idea came about. I want to replicate the visual experience I had growing up in a midwestern small town. A setting that feels so small and contained when growing up. 

“Coming of Age” films have always been some of my favorites. No matter the audience, these films are able to connect with the viewer. Everyone has once been a naive teen, where relationships (platonic and not) are the most important aspect of everyday life.

Filmmaking has always been a passion of mine. I grew up making videos with my family’s old camcorder and the toys I had around me. Once I entered high school, I started making shorts with my friends. College has shown me my passion for cinematography and having my hands on the camera. This film will be my first short film directorial debut, which my four years of film school has prepared me for. I wanted to wait to direct a film that I had a personal connection with and I could make my own. Thanks to our wonderful writer Celia Tise, the story was translated from my ideas into a fully fledged script.

What We Need

Films are made up of a lot of moving parts, and each part comes with a cost. We need the funds to make sure our film helps these parts run as smoothly as possible. 

Contributions to this film will go towards the items listed below:

Paying actors

Feeding crew

Paying location fees

Renting equipment

Props / Costume

All of these parts are equally important to our production and every bit of your contribution helps immensely.  

Other Ways to Help

If you are unable to donate, or want to help us more, please consider sharing our Indiegogo page! This will help get our film in front of more people who may want to help us tell our story.

story:
Dropping Out tells the story of two sisters, living with their parents in a working-class town, attempting to reconnect; one is destined for greatness, while the other has squandered it. Told in the style of great social realists such as Ken Loach, Chantal Akerman, and Vittorio De Sica, this film chronicles the lengths that people go to for a meaningful connection and what circumstances lead others to reject such connections.

If you contribute to this film, you will be helping to create a piece in the tapestry of cinema, while also supporting independent filmmaking. Because our production is small, any amount of funds is appreciated and will go towards creating the best possible film that we can make.

story:
Say what?!? A DOGSLEDDING DOCUMENTARY!?!?

Dogsledding is more than just a sport, it's a bond that lasts a lifetime! If you're a dog lover, THIS film is for YOU!!

My name is Robert Michael and I'm thrilled to be creating the documentary, Heartprints in the Snow! Join me as I venture back to where it all started for me, Michigan, as I explore the bonds that are built between humankind and canine, and experience the love and connection behind the sport as seen in Hollywood films such as Togo, 8 Below, Snow Dogs, and so many more! With stories out of Michigan, Texas, New York, and more!

I grew up within the MUSH organization, AKA Mid Union Sled Haulers from 1996-2009. My father was the president of the organization for a period of time and my mother on the board herself. In 2004 my father co founded MIDD, AKA Michigan Dog Drivers Association with Rick and Linda Lange, and both clubs are currently thriving! I'll be focusing on these groups and the mushers who's lives have been changed forever by their furry family members! 

 

QUALIFICATIONS!

My production company, GEEPAK Entertainment, produced "By the Grace of God" with 6 wins and 7 nominations at festivals worldwide. We also produced "Modern American Nightmare" with 3 wins and 5 nominations! In television, we produced the soundtracks for the REELZ Network originals "Titanic: Sinking the Myths" and "The Zodiac Killer Trap" 

 

What We Need To Bring You an AMAZING film!

For a full list of incentives to funding, see the "perks" section!

For this film to be of impact, there are certain things we need to raise funding for. First and foremost,

TRAVEL - Living in Los Angeles, I need to venture back to Michigan to conduct interviews and highlight the MUSH and MIDD organizations, as well as the mushers that live out there. This will take a good chunk of money, and my ability to conduct specific number of interviews will rely HEAVILY on the amount of money I can raise, including an option to do some business in Alaska!

 

CREW - Though minimal, I will require at least one crew member to travel with me and run camera and sound operations

 

INTERVIEWS - I need to pay my interviewees! 

 

POST PRODUCTION/EQUIPTMENT - I will require a camera rental and post production services. Nothing lavish, but high quality 4K content requires 4K camera! I want my interviewees to look their best!

 

FESTIVALS - I'm not planning a huge festival run, but submission fees to the BIG festivals with big audiences require a good amount of money

 

The Impact

This film will highlight the bond between mushers and their animals, and those who might be a little skeptical of the sport will watch the film with a new understanding about the respect, love, and care that mushers in the state of Michigan have for their teammates. Mushers and dogs run together, not as master and obeyer, but as a pack - all working for the same goal and building a lifelong relationship in the process.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this page with your friends, family, and if you know of any, dogsledders and mushing organzations! You can view our IMDB page here:

https://www.imdb.com/title/tt11863394/

 

Also, be sure to follow our FB page for updates and social media shout outs!!!

fb.me/Heartprintsinthesnow

 

Thanks everyone!!!!! LETS MAKE THIS THING!!!!

story:
¿Cómo colaborar?

Para colaborar económicamente, pulsa el botón Back It, y decide si quieres aparecer anónimamente, y la forma de pago. ¡Muchas gracias!

Sobre el Cortometraje

Somos Berenjenas en Almíbar, un grupo de jóvenes apasionados por el cine, que en 2019 empezamos este proyecto llamado Jean, y que queremos sacar a la luz antes de septiembre de 2020, para poder lanzarlo a festivales.

Qué necesitamos y Qué ofrecemos

Necesitamos:

  • Terminar la mezcla de audio, y la corrección de color.
  • Distribuir el corto por festivales.
  • Todo esto no es gratis, necesitamos un mínimo de 500 euros para llevarlo a cabo

Ofrecemos:

  • El cortometraje terminado en formato digital y físico, con los extras añadidos
  • Acceder al material antes del estreno, y de forma privada
  • Título de "Productor ejecutivo" en los créditos

¿Cómo ayuda tu contribución?

Tu contribución es muy importante, no solo para nosotros, sino también para toda la comunidad de jóvenes cineastas que están buscándose su lugar en este difícil mundo. Estás apostando por el futuro y la cultura.

Otras formas de ayudar

Si no puedes ofrecer ayuda económica, pero aun así quieres apoyar el proyecto, por favor distribuye esta página para que más gente pueda ayudarnos a lanzar nuestro cortometraje. ¡Muchas gracias!

Si no puedes ofrecer ayuda económica, pero aun así quieres apoyar el proyecto, por favor distribuye esta página para que más gente pueda ayudarnos a lanzar nuestro cortometraje. ¡Muchas gracias!

story:
Earl Biss (1947-1998) 

Photo by Louisa Davidson

 

I believe in magic. In fact, I live magic. It's the only way to be . . . that is real.

                                          ~ Earl Biss

 

Short Summary

Earl Biss, The Spirit Who Walks Among His People is a documentary that sheds light on this ground breaking, dynamic, mystical, and controversial Crow artist.

EARL BISS was a catalyst during the golden era when a group of young Native artists came through the Institute of American Indian Art and transformed Native art from primitive, stylized forms to fine art. This miracle generation contributed to the explosion of Contemporary Southwest Art that began in the 1960s. Considered the lead Native American painter of this movement by many critics, Biss was recognized by one Southwest art critic and collector as the greatest colorist of the 20th Century.

Influenced by European masters, yet forging an evolving style all his own, Biss drew upon his rich heritage of the Crow Indians – the Apsáalooke – as a primary force shaping his art. At the heart of his work was always his love of the Apsáalooke, which shone through his art like a beacon of light bursting through a storm.

The film showcases masterful art while giving deep insight into the man that created it. Rare archival footage of Biss speaking and painting, and interviews with tribal members, friends, art dealers, and patrons paint an unforgettable story – a joyous, dynamic, tumultuous journey to success in the art world.

The documentary is directed and produced by Lisa Gerstner, the author of the biography Experiences with Earl Biss - The Spirit Who Walks Among His People. Earl Biss had asked Lisa to write his biography. They worked together on his story in 1994-1995. And now the movie will bring further understanding of his life and art.

Your contributions and support will bring to light Earl Biss' well deserved place in Art History. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Production is complete. We are now seeking $35,000 for Post-Production. 

Check out the unbelievably generous perks! They includes Earl Biss Books and Art donated by American Design Ltd.

Be a part of the action! Good News! Our guarantors ensure completion: American Design Ltd and Wild Horse Films LLC. 

POST-PRODUCTION BUDGET COVERS:

  • Editing
  • Color correction
  • Sound engineering
  • Licensing of footage/photos/music
  • Filmscore
  • Post-production consulting and finalizing by award-winning post-production expert, Jayme S. Parker.

EXCEEDING THE GOAL MOVES US TOWARD:

  • Film Festivals
  • Marketing
  • Distribution

 

The Impact

Your contribution will make a difference.

  • Further the legacy of world class master painter, Earl Biss
  • Join Lisa Gerstner, experienced author and filmmaker, in emphasizing the value of Contemporary Native American Art and the importance of Native American Culture.
  • Earl Biss said, "If I had to do it over again, I would make films. There is so much more you can say in a movie than you can say in a two-dimensional image." Earl's dream of film is coming to fruition.

 

Giants in the Art World: T.C. Cannon, Fritz Scholder and Earl Biss. Photograph © Dana Ivers.

 

Exciting Perks!

BOOK - $60 value

Included in all giving levels $60 and up! It is a page turner with high reviews.

Experiences with Earl Biss - The Spirit Who Walks Among His People, by Lisa Gerstner, written in cooperation with Earl Biss. BIOGRAPHY, soft cover, 324 pages, 175 Illustrations

 

POSTER - $50 Value

Unsigned

Included in Poster Package and Poster Package Plus

Autumn Storm in the Crazy Woman Mountains, offset lithograph, 25 x 28 in

 

COMMEMORATIVE PLATE-SIGNED NUMBERED EDITION - $800 Value

High Quality Giclee

Included in the Advocates Circle and Champions Circle

Riding below Pryor Gap with Dogs, giclee, 24 x 30 in

A canvas Giclee is a fine art reproduction using a high-quality inkjet printer to make individual copies. The term giclee originated in the early 1990s by a print maker whose aim was to distinguish the higher quality prints he was making from the negatively perceived term "inkjet." However, giclee printing is ink-jet printing. In fact, the word giclee is derived from the French word "gicler" which means to squirt or spray – as inkjet printers spray ink onto canvas. Over time, the usage of the word has evolved to be a catch all term for quality and best printing practices. Archival inks are designed to resist fading and the chemical composition allows the ink to hold fast to the printed surface. Simply put, a giclee is a well made canvas print that will last a long time.

 

SERIGRAPHS - $1800 - $4200 Value

Hand Signed Lifetime Numbered Edition

Included in the Associate Producers level (one serigraph) and Executive Producers and Mogul levels (two serigraphs).

Choose between the beautiful serigraphs below. 

They Stood Like the Glory of The Sun, 35 x 45 in

$4200 value

A Serigraph is a silk screened image. Biss serigraphs are limited editions, each one involving the artist's hand. Earl Biss hand drew color separations on Mylar. Each serigraph involved 60 to 80 screens. A separate silk screen was created for each and every color and was washed out after use. Each screen was precisely placed over high quality serigraph paper, and then by hand squeegee, paint for a specific color was applied. This single application of one paint color had to dry for at least 24 to 48 hours before the next color paint could be applied. It can take a serographer up to 6 months to produce a run of as many as 300 serigraphs of the same image. 

Earl Biss was a purist when it came to reproducing his work. He was a master lithographer earlier in his career and he was a master at serigraphs. His hand was in every step, and every color printed was approved by him in person. The colors of the serigraphs had to match the original paintings as closely as possible.

​

Shipping Info

ART does not include frames. Allow 6 weeks for delivery.

DOMESTIC SHIPPING: Free

INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING: Additional shipping charges apply.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word!

  • Share the Earl Biss documentary campaign with friends, family, and co-workers.
  • Share the news through email and social media.
  • Know bloggers and journalists? Put us in touch!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools.

 

Meet the Crew

LISA GERSTNER, Director/Producer

Author of the biography "Experiences with Earl Biss", Lisa Gerstner is a producer, director, film score composer, writer, and artist. She has co-produced a feature film, produced a documentary, and directed/produced many educational videos in the arts field, including a series of short films on renown sculptor, Gib Singleton. Well versed in multiple creative disciplines, film brings together her skills to produce highly engaging stories. She is adept at getting to the heart of a message and portraying it in a way that resonates deeply with the audience for which it is intended. Lisa has a Master of Science in Education Media Design and Technology, and a Bachelor of Fine Arts.

 

PAUL ZUEGER, Executive producer

President of American Design Ltd (ADL), Paul Zueger has been in the Fine Arts Business for over 40 years. His company handles artwork from prominent artists from all over the world. ADL is a key sponsor for the Earl Biss Documentary and the publisher of two art books and a biography on the artist. He is dedicated to putting forth the legacy of master oil painter, Earl Biss, in a number of ways.

 

JAYME S. PARKER, Film Consultant

Twenty-four years in the motion picture industry, Jayme served as a documentary producer and network TV camera operator (NBC), managed a Post-Production Facility in Toronto, was instrumental in the application of Digital Sound to Feature Films, and earned several nominations and awards, including Golden Reel and Oscar. Jayme has worked on numerous major films such as Field of Dreams, Lethal Weapon 3, The Thin Red Line, Die Hard 2, and The Bridges of Madison County. For this film, Jayme lends his expertise as film consultant, co-editor, and audio post-production.

 

TOM BOSTON, Sound Recorder, Grip

Tom holds bachelor’s and master’s degrees in music composition and performance. Tom has live recording experience using the Tascam 680 digital recorder for film/video production: Documentaries - “Earl Biss - The Spirit Who Walks Among His People”, “Girls on Purpose”,Gib Singleton art videos. He has live-sound mixing experience for a large ECK Temple in Lakewood Colorado using Midas M32R digital mixer. Tom has mentored under award-winning motion picture sound production engineer, Jayme Parker. He also has professional live performing experience in Pop/Rock/Jazz bands.

 

JOEL SHUTE, Camera/Grip

An expert kayaker and back country skier, Joel Shute has shot and edited extreme skiing videos in Alaska and Colorado. Joel is a nature photographer which developed in his work as a botanist and as an avid outdoorsman. Currently, Assistant Manager for Pipeline Solutions LLC, Joel has a Bachelor of Science in Environmental Studies.

 

Production Stills

 

More Info:

EarlBissMovie.com

EarlBiss.com

LisaGerstner.com

facebook.com/AuthorLisaGerstner

 

Join Our List of Dedicated Sponsors:

American Design Ltd

Gib Singleton Museum of Fine Art

Law Offices of Victor L Abbo

story:
Brìgh na Sgeòil

Ann am Marram, tha stòiridh air innse mu theaghlach ann an eilean Innse Gall an Alba. Fad is a tha iad a‘ deanamh moran strì gu am mac gràdhach a thuigsinn is a bheothachadh, tha am muran a dh' fheumas iad airson mullach an taighe a chòmhdach, air fàs gann bho cnàmhadh talmhainn-a-chladaich.

Synopsis

Marram tells the story of a family on a Scottish Hebridean island. While they are going to great lengths to understand and revive a beloved son, the marram grass they need to thatch the roof over their heads recedes from a gradually eroding coastline.

 

Who we are...

Hello! We are writer Elspeth Turner and DOP Robbie Jones, and together we're directing Marram.

 

What we're doing...

We began collaborating on this idea several years ago, and this year we are really delighted to be moving this film into production. We have secured our dream cast of actors, gathered together an incredible crew, and teamed up with the incredible producers at RPP Productions. We are planning a one week shoot on the Scottish Hebridean island of Berneray, Harris, this winter. Because the film revolves around a family who are cutting and gathering marram, we are committed to shooting in November, when the marram is being cut in the community. We are raising money to support us in the production of this film.

 

Writer's Statement

The idea of making a film on Berneray occurred to me in November 2015. My father is from the island, and I was there with my brothers, gathering marram grass out on the West side, for thatching the roof of our family cottage there. I was especially intrigued by the sounds I was hearing whilst doing this work - which is sometimes quite meditative. I grew up spending summers on the island, and so I have always been in awe of the beauty of the landscape. However, I wasn’t prepared for the beguiling quality of the light, wildlife, and the land itself, which can be seen in the winter months, and I thought: I think this place will always be unravelling itself to me. So it occurred to me to make a film which might communicate this majestic and in some ways unknowable place to other people.

The characters then grew out of my love for and fascination with the place, and I knew I wanted to follow a family who were working with the marram – I think it’s interesting to watch modern characters carry out this very old practice. This is particularly interesting and important to explore these days, as coastal erosion and other environmental pressures mean that some areas of marram grass which must have once seemed plentiful, are now under threat.

I always wanted the story to be a modern story, complete with some very old beliefs, and to be told in Gaelic. It is very important to me that Gaelic be recognized as a living language, and therefore it’s important for me, as an artist, to show it as such. Therefore I hope we can make the film in such a way that the characters speaking Gaelic is not a big deal, but a matter of course.

I have done some writing for screen before, but this is my first venture as a director of film. I am running towards the opportunity with lots of excitement, partly because I’ll have the chance finally to collaborate with DOP Robbie Jones, who will co-direct. Robbie and I got to know each other working on the feature film Riptide – a schizophrenia love story. I saw first hand just how endlessly inventive and determined Robbie can be as a DOP, and I can’t wait to work with him in capturing the landscape in the Outer Hebrides, and in finding the most interesting and beautiful ways to turn this script into a film.

 

Previous Work

 

Robbie T Jones - Narrative Showreel
 
 
 

Elspeth Turner - Writing

The Idiot at the Wall - Play, directed by Emily Reutlinger.
Pleasance Theatre, June 2012,
Edinburgh International Fringe Festival August 2012
Scottish Tour October 2013
Trailer by Robbie T Jones
 
 
 
SpectreTown - Play, directed by Matthew Lenton.
A co-production with Cumbernauld Theatre.
Edinburgh International Fringe Festival, August 2015
Scottish Tour, September 2015
Trailer by Yutsil Hoyo Diaz Martinez and Aron Cairns
 
 
 
Staran Na Sanntachd - Short film, directed by Catriona Rubenis Stevens.
Filmed on location in New York City, December 2010
 

 

 
 

Timeline

 

Pre- Production | October 2019 

Production | November 2019 

Post- Production | November 2019- January 2020 

Festival Submissions | Spring 2020 

Premiere |  Summer 2020

 

The Team

 

Elspeth Turner | Writer - Director

Elspeth Turner is originally from Fife, and a graduate of the American Academy of Dramatic Arts. She has worked with various theatre companies in the UK and North America, including NTS, Magnetic North, and Eastern Angles. She can be seen in the forthcoming feature film, Riptide from Lyre Productions. Her new play, Savage Nation / Buaireas anns an Uisge, explores the legacy of Scotland’s role in Transatlantic Slave Trade, and is currently in development. More information at www.elspethturner.com

 

Robbie T Jones | Director of Photography - Director

Originally from Manchester, Robbie studied photography and film at Screen Academy Scotland for four years, leaving with a 1st class Honours degree and an ambition to become a DP. He has since shot several short films, music videos and promos, creating online content for BBC Proms, BBC Radio 3, Edinburgh International Festival, BAFTA Guru, Decca Records and the NHS. He shot the pilot episode of web series 'Last Exit To Ricklesburgh' which was nominated for Scottish BAFTA New Talent, and provided additional camera work on five feature films, most recently Zebra Girl, directed by Stephanie Zari. His debut feature film as cinematographer is Riptide, directed by Tim Barrow for Lyre Productions. It is a love story, road movie exploring the relationship between two people with schizophrenia. Filmed in countless beautiful Scottish landscapes, it is due for release this year. More information can be found at www.robbietjones.com

 

Dolina Maclennan | Actor

The writer, actress and singer Dolina Maclennan is one of Scotland’s most beloved artists. One of the originators of the Edinburgh folk scene of the 1960s, she first made her name in the ground-breaking 7:84 production, The Cheviot, The Stag, and the Black, Black Oil. Her many credits in theatre, TV and film include Hamish Macbeth, The Queen, Seachd: The Inaccessible Pinnacle, and Machair.  Recent film work includes Duck Daze and Finky. In recognition of her significant contribution to Scotland’s life and culture, she received the Saltire Society’s Fletcher of Saltoun Award in 2012, while 2016 saw her presented with an honorary doctorate by Edinburgh University. Dolina has also entered into Scottish Traditional Music Hall of Fame for Services to Gaelic.

 

Daibhidh Walker | Actor

Daibhidh Walker has been acting for over 20 years, in TV, radio and theatre, and is originally from South Uist. Some of his recent credits include Bannan, Outlander, Da la sa Damhair, and Rough Magik, and he has also worked on Gaelic versions of Macbeth and A Midsummer Night’s dream. His voice can be heard on various Gaelic cartoons.

 

Ewan James Armstrong | Actor

Originally from Lewis, Drag entertainer, Singer and actor Ewan James Armstrong has resided in Edinburgh for over a decade, working mainly in the Cabaret and Television circuit. He appears regularly at the Edinburgh International Fringe Festival, most recently in the Civil Disobedience produced show Try Slaying, as well as his weekly Drag residency on Edinburgh's prestigious George Street

 

Amanda Rogers | Producer

Originally from the USA, Amanda is the owner and founder of RPP Productions, a production company that is based both is the UK and the US. She has been producer/director, videographer, and editor for over a decade. Amanda has worked on films of all kinds, from documentary to non-profit and educational as well as various creative projects with organisations such as Carnegie Hall, the United Nations and Alvin Ailey American Dance Theatre. First working in NYC, Amanda moved to Edinburgh to complete her MSc in Film, Exhibition, and Curation at the University of Edinburgh and continues to work on films in  as well as working on her startup film event and exhibition company, Cinetopia.

 

Anni Asikainen | Producer / 1st AD

Originally from Finland and a graduate of film studies at University College Dublin, Anni has a background in short film production, cinematography and editing, as well as working with film festivals as a production assistant, programmer and submissions viewer. Anni moved to Edinburgh to complete her MSc in Film, Exhibition, and Curation and continues to work as a freelance filmmaker and programmer as well as working on Cinetopia.

 

Visual References

 

 

What We Need 

We are currently raising money to cover the cost of shooting the film. Between us all, we own or can borrow certain items, so the figures below are based on what we will need to cover the remainder of necessities.

This does not include a budget for post production or festival submissions.

 

EQUIPMENT RENTAL - £1000

 

PRODUCTION COSTS - £200

Props/wardrobe: £100

Flashdrives (for footage): £100

 

TRAVEL, FOOD & ACCOMMODATION - £2000

Accommodation: £900

Fuel and ferry tickets: £600

Food: £500

These numbers are calculated based on the needs of catering for 13 people for the duration of the 4-day shoot.  Some of the accommodation is being generously donated to us.

 

ARTIST/CREW FEES - £2500

This amount allows us to pay the cast and crew for their work. With a team of 13, this was always going to be the largest portion of our budget. We are immensely grateful to have such a gifted team and believe their skills are worth paying for. 

 

INSURANCE - £300

 

TOTAL TARGET : £6000

 

If we do not reach our entire goal, but we raise enough to survive the shoot (basics only), we will proceed with filming if at all possible, as the content is so time-specific to November.

 

Your impact

We can't bring this story to production without you - our audience.

We heartily believe in the potential power of this film. Firstly because it is vital to the survival of indigenous, minority languages that we use them to tell compelling, contemporary stories around characters you can recognize. Secondly, we believe we can contribute in a positive way to conversations around LGBTQ+ narratives.

By getting involved with us, you will be supporting our belief that stories like this do need to be told in this way, and that there is an audience out there passionate about watching them.

We are immensely grateful for your contributions, and have designed an array of perks over on the right hand side of this page. They're named after some beautiful Hebridean islands!

 

Other ways to support us

If you would like to support us but don't feel you can contribute financially, there's loads of other ways you can help, for which we'd be most grateful!

  • Share our campaign
  • If you think any of your pals would be interested in our work, let them know what we're up to!
  • Follow us on social media - we're on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram (hover and click!)

 

Thank You

Lastly, mìle taing / thank you so much for reading our page, a considering contributing to our film. Any support is greatly appreciated.

We also wish to thank Kristina Low and Malcolm Turner for the stills from Berneray, and Roderick Turner for the footage, used in our video here. Also thank you to Brian the dog for use of his image in the video :-)

Sincerely,

The Marram Team

Who we are...
Hello! We are writer Elspeth Turner and DOP Robbie Jones, and together we're directing Marram.
 
What we're doing...
We began collaborating on this idea several years ago, and this year we are really delighted to be moving this film into production. We have secured our dream cast of actors, gathered together an incredible crew, and teamed up with the incredible producers at RPP Productions. We are planning a one week shoot on the Scottish Hebridean island of Berneray, Harris, this winter. Because the film revolves around a family who are cutting and gathering marram, we are committed to shooting in November, when the marram is being cut in the community. We are raising money to support us in the production of this film.
 
Writer's Statement
The idea of making a film on Berneray occurred to me in November 2015. My father is from the island, and I was there with my brothers, gathering marram grass out on the West side, for thatching the roof of our family cottage there. I was especially intrigued by the sounds I was hearing whilst doing this work - which is sometimes quite meditative. I grew up spending summers on the island, and so I have always been in awe of the beauty of the landscape. However, I wasn’t prepared for the beguiling quality of the light, wildlife, and the land itself, which can be seen in the winter months, and I thought: I think this place will always be unravelling itself to me. So it occurred to me to make a film which might communicate this majestic and in some ways unknowable place to other people.
The characters then grew out of my love for and fascination with the place, and I knew I wanted to follow a family who were working with the marram – I think it’s interesting to watch modern characters carry out this very old practice. This is particularly interesting and important to explore these days, as coastal erosion and other environmental pressures mean that some areas of marram grass which must have once seemed plentiful, are now under threat.
I always wanted the story to be a modern story, complete with some very old beliefs, and to be told in Gaelic. It is very important to me that Gaelic be recognized as a living language, and therefore it’s important for me, as an artist, to show it as such. Therefore I hope we can make the film in such a way that the characters speaking Gaelic is not a big deal, but a matter of course.
I have done some writing for screen before, but this is my first venture as a director of film. I am running towards the opportunity with lots of excitement, partly because I’ll have the chance finally to collaborate with DOP Robbie Jones, who will co-direct. Robbie and I got to know each other working on the feature film Riptide – a schizophrenia love story. I saw first hand just how endlessly inventive and determined Robbie can be as a DOP, and I can’t wait to work with him in capturing the landscape in the Outer Hebrides, and in finding the most interesting and beautiful ways to turn this script into a film.
 
Previous Work
 

Robbie T Jones - Narrative Showreel

 


 
 

Elspeth Turner - Writing

The Idiot at the Wall - Play, directed by Emily Reutlinger.
Pleasance Theatre, June 2012,
Edinburgh International Fringe Festival August 2012
Scottish Tour October 2013
Trailer by Robbie T Jones
 

 
 

SpectreTown - Play, directed by Matthew Lenton.
A co-production with Cumbernauld Theatre.
Edinburgh International Fringe Festival, August 2015
Scottish Tour, September 2015
Trailer by Yutsil Hoyo Diaz Martinez and Aron Cairns
 


 
 

Staran Na Sanntachd - Short film, directed by Catriona Rubenis Stevens.
Filmed on location in New York City, December 2010
 


 
 


 
Timeline
 
Pre- Production | October 2019 
Production | November 2019 
Post- Production | November 2019- January 2020 
Festival Submissions | Spring 2020 
Premiere |  Summer 2020
 
The Team
 
Elspeth Turner | Writer - Director
Elspeth Turner is originally from Fife, and a graduate of the American Academy of Dramatic Arts. She has worked with various theatre companies in the UK and North America, including NTS, Magnetic North, and Eastern Angles. She can be seen in the forthcoming feature film, Riptide from Lyre Productions. Her new play, Savage Nation / Buaireas anns an Uisge, explores the legacy of Scotland’s role in Transatlantic Slave Trade, and is currently in development. More information at www.elspethturner.com
 
Robbie T Jones | Director of Photography - Director
Originally from Manchester, Robbie studied photography and film at Screen Academy Scotland for four years, leaving with a 1st class Honours degree and an ambition to become a DP. He has since shot several short films, music videos and promos, creating online content for BBC Proms, BBC Radio 3, Edinburgh International Festival, BAFTA Guru, Decca Records and the NHS. He shot the pilot episode of web series 'Last Exit To Ricklesburgh' which was nominated for Scottish BAFTA New Talent, and provided additional camera work on five feature films, most recently Zebra Girl, directed by Stephanie Zari. His debut feature film as cinematographer is Riptide, directed by Tim Barrow for Lyre Productions. It is a love story, road movie exploring the relationship between two people with schizophrenia. Filmed in countless beautiful Scottish landscapes, it is due for release this year. More information can be found at www.robbietjones.com
 
Dolina Maclennan | Actor
The writer, actress and singer Dolina Maclennan is one of Scotland’s most beloved artists. One of the originators of the Edinburgh folk scene of the 1960s, she first made her name in the ground-breaking 7:84 production, The Cheviot, The Stag, and the Black, Black Oil. Her many credits in theatre, TV and film include Hamish Macbeth, The Queen, Seachd: The Inaccessible Pinnacle, and Machair.  Recent film work includes Duck Daze and Finky. In recognition of her significant contribution to Scotland’s life and culture, she received the Saltire Society’s Fletcher of Saltoun Award in 2012, while 2016 saw her presented with an honorary doctorate by Edinburgh University. Dolina has also entered into Scottish Traditional Music Hall of Fame for Services to Gaelic.
 
Daibhidh Walker | Actor
Daibhidh Walker has been acting for over 20 years, in TV, radio and theatre, and is originally from South Uist. Some of his recent credits include Bannan, Outlander, Da la sa Damhair, and Rough Magik, and he has also worked on Gaelic versions of Macbeth and A Midsummer Night’s dream. His voice can be heard on various Gaelic cartoons.
 
Ewan James Armstrong | Actor
Originally from Lewis, Drag entertainer, Singer and actor Ewan James Armstrong has resided in Edinburgh for over a decade, working mainly in the Cabaret and Television circuit. He appears regularly at the Edinburgh International Fringe Festival, most recently in the Civil Disobedience produced show Try Slaying, as well as his weekly Drag residency on Edinburgh's prestigious George Street
 
Amanda Rogers | Producer
Originally from the USA, Amanda is the owner and founder of RPP Productions, a production company that is based both is the UK and the US. She has been producer/director, videographer, and editor for over a decade. Amanda has worked on films of all kinds, from documentary to non-profit and educational as well as various creative projects with organisations such as Carnegie Hall, the United Nations and Alvin Ailey American Dance Theatre. First working in NYC, Amanda moved to Edinburgh to complete her MSc in Film, Exhibition, and Curation at the University of Edinburgh and continues to work on films in  as well as working on her startup film event and exhibition company, Cinetopia.
 
Anni Asikainen | Producer / 1st AD
Originally from Finland and a graduate of film studies at University College Dublin, Anni has a background in short film production, cinematography and editing, as well as working with film festivals as a production assistant, programmer and submissions viewer. Anni moved to Edinburgh to complete her MSc in Film, Exhibition, and Curation and continues to work as a freelance filmmaker and programmer as well as working on Cinetopia.
 
Visual References



 

 

What We Need 
We are currently raising money to cover the cost of shooting the film. Between us all, we own or can borrow certain items, so the figures below are based on what we will need to cover the remainder of necessities.
This does not include a budget for post production or festival submissions.
 
EQUIPMENT RENTAL - £1000
 
PRODUCTION COSTS - £200
Props/wardrobe: £100
Flashdrives (for footage): £100
 
TRAVEL, FOOD & ACCOMMODATION - £2000
Accommodation: £900
Fuel and ferry tickets: £600
Food: £500
These numbers are calculated based on the needs of catering for 13 people for the duration of the 4-day shoot.  Some of the accommodation is being generously donated to us.
 
ARTIST/CREW FEES - £2500
This amount allows us to pay the cast and crew for their work. With a team of 13, this was always going to be the largest portion of our budget. We are immensely grateful to have such a gifted team and believe their skills are worth paying for. 
 
INSURANCE - £300
 
TOTAL TARGET : £6000
 
If we do not reach our entire goal, but we raise enough to survive the shoot (basics only), we will proceed with filming if at all possible, as the content is so time-specific to November.
 

Your impact
We can't bring this story to production without you - our audience.
We heartily believe in the potential power of this film. Firstly because it is vital to the survival of indigenous, minority languages that we use them to tell compelling, contemporary stories around characters you can recognize. Secondly, we believe we can contribute in a positive way to conversations around LGBTQ+ narratives.
By getting involved with us, you will be supporting our belief that stories like this do need to be told in this way, and that there is an audience out there passionate about watching them.
We are immensely grateful for your contributions, and have designed an array of perks over on the right hand side of this page. They're named after some beautiful Hebridean islands!
 
Other ways to support us

If you would like to support us but don't feel you can contribute financially, there's loads of other ways you can help, for which we'd be most grateful!

Share our campaign
If you think any of your pals would be interested in our work, let them know what we're up to!
Follow us on social media - we're on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram (hover and click!)

 
Thank You
Lastly, mìle taing / thank you so much for reading our page, a considering contributing to our film. Any support is greatly appreciated.
We also wish to thank Kristina Low and Malcolm Turner for the stills from Berneray, and Roderick Turner for the footage, used in our video here. Also thank you to Brian the dog for use of his image in the video :-)
Sincerely,
The Marram Team

story:
Overview

Letters to Eloisa  is a documentary film on Cuban writer José Lezama Lima, legendary poet and writer, considered one of most influential figures in Latin American literature in the twentieth century.    Lezama's life story is told through letters written to his sister living in exile, between 1961 and 1976. 

The film is a first-hand look at the transformative impact of politics on the family and society; and shows the struggle between Cuba’s revolutionary government and artists and intellectuals, as the space for creative freedom disappeared in Cuba during the first two decades of the revolution.   Letters to Eloisa  is a window into a human soul crushed by repression and intolerance.

We have completed production of this film and have put together a 62-minute rough cut but we need funds to cover some post production expenses including: 

  • Additional Archive
  • Additional Editing
  • Sound Design and Mix
  • Color Correction and Grading
  • Graphics 
  • Promotion and Film Festival entries.

"Stories reveal themselves in very unusual ways.  While finishing up a documentary on Fidel Castro for PBS’s American Experience, I “discovered” a remarkable body of correspondence written by Cuban writer José Lezama Lima between 1961 to 1976 to his sister living in exile.  I was immediately driven to tell the dramatic life story of this seminal literary giant, and embarked on a decade-long journey. "  (Adriana Bosch)

José Lezama Lima is considered one of Cuba’s greatest 20th century writers and poets.  Beginning with his first poem "Muerte de Narciso" in 1937,  based on the Greek Myth, Lezama elevated Cuban literature by adding a timeless, universal dimension to literature.   He founded a cultural group around a journal Orígenes that was read in every corner of the Spanish speaking world.  Lezama's  work influenced succeeding generations of writers and contributed to the Mid-Century literary explosion known as The Latin American Boom.  During this period, novelists Alejo Carpentier, Gabriel García Márquez, Carlos Fuentes, Julio Cortázar, Mario Vargas Llosa created a dazzling and inventive Latin American literature which transformed the novel for all time.   But unlike the others who enjoyed the limelight and achieved immortalized status, Lezama Lima lived his final years ostracized, silenced and alone.  

The revealing letters Lezama writes to his sister Eloisa weave together the public and the private, the literary and the political, and tell how the writer’s voice, at first amplified by the revolution’s emphasis on culture, was ultimately silenced as the Cuban Revolution narrowed the sphere of cultural and intellectual freedom in Cuba.

The story begins with the publication of Lezama's emblematic work Paradiso,  a semi autobiographical and poetic, was hailed as a literary masterpiece and created a sensation in literary circles across Latin America and Europe.  It also included a surprisingly homoerotic "Chapter 8" which brought Lezama into conflict with Cuba's contemporaneous campaign against homosexuals which included sending homosexuals and suspected homosexuals to concentration camps and removing them from any position of cultural influence, including teaching, writing, or participating in public performances.

The film narrates Lezama's confrontation with the Castro regime in the late 1960s as well as his state imposed ostracism that lasted through his death in 1976.  It includes the crackdown on intellectual freedom following the famous Padilla Affair,  when Cuban poet Heberto Padilla was jailed after publishing poetry deemed "anti-revolutionary."  At his "trial", Padilla performed a public act of self-recrimination, naming other artists and writers as fellow counterrevolutionaries, among them,  José Lezama Lima. 

Once regarded as Cuba’s most important intellectual, Lezama was never again published in Cuba and saw his books removed from libraries and bookstores.  Visitors to his home became politically suspect.  Censored, ostracized and forbidden to travel outside the island at a time when his novel was garnering worldwide acclaim, Lezama Lima faded into obscurity within the walls of his Havana home.   His obituary, a short column hidden on page 3 of the official newspaper Granma, simply read "una sensible pérdida" - a regretful loss. 

I am an independent documentary filmmaker with more than 30 years of experience.  I was Series Producer of Latino Americans, a six-hour series on the history of Latinos in the United States (2013) and Latin Music USA, a four-hour series series highlighting the contribution of Latino artists to American culture (2009).  Both aired nationally on PBS. 

From the 18th President Ulysses S. Grant to American soldier of fortune William Morgan, I have had the privilege of creating biographies of influential figures in US and Cuban history including several American presidents and a two hour biography of Fidel Castro.  My last documentary  (2016) about a US soldier of fortune executed in Cuba in 1961  after fighting for the revolution, aired on PBS and NETFLIX

With your help, we can finish this important documentary which is a condemnation of authoritarianism in all its forms, and places intellectual and sexual freedom, at the center of our lives.   We invite you to be a partner as we move towards the film's premiere in the spring of 2020.  

Since our last appeal, the film received production funds from the National Endowment for the Humanities and Latino Public Broadcasting and this enabled us to complete production and begin post-production.  We have completed production and a majority of post-production including recording voiceover narration with Alfred Molina.  Composer Arturo Sandoval has begun to write the music score.

But we need to raise $20,000 to be able to move the rough cut into a fine cut and begin the final stages of post production. 

We are offering wonderful perks that bring you and the film closer and open the door to your becoming part of what we feel is an important endeavor.

This is a story that has been a long time in the making and needs your help to reach its conclusion.

It's a story that stands for twentieth-century Cuban history and the pain of family separation as witnessed through the lives of one Cuban family.

It is also a story captures the essence of an extraordinary artist and his work and that needs to be shared with a larger audience far beyond literary circles.

With your help, we can get this done!

• Donate directly to this Indiegogo campaign. 

• Share our Indiegogo page with your social networks. Let them know why you support our project and why they should too. 

• Forward our email to 10 friends and family. Tell them why you're supporting our film and how they can too by making a contribution to the campaign.

• Host a fundraising party. Invite a few friends and we will send you a ten-minute clip from the film for you to show and if possible, one of the film's key team members will be present to present the program and answer questions.

You believe in the power of good stories and this film has the potential to reach a broad audience to tell the fascinating story about a writer whose life stands for the heavy toll of intolerance on the arts and the individual.

We look forward to your support.

Help us get to our goal and be our partner in this adventure.

story:
Story Summary

Any Which Way is a new coming of age story about the trials of post graduate friendship in the 21st Century.  Our story follows AJ and Parker, two college best friends now living in the real world and struggling to make ends meet.  Parker values success above all else, and an image of wealth and maturity is what he values most in life.  AJ on the other hand is a musician and idealistic to a fault.  He doesn't care about financial success and views accepting any job unrelated to his dream of becoming a successful musician as failure.   The character's values start to stress the once solid foundation of their friendship.  So when AJ meets a confident young actress working at his local coffee shop and Parker's job becomes more stressful than he could have imagined, both learn what it means to pursue their dreams while dealing with the responsibility of adult life, and how that affects a friendship they once thought to be unbreakable.  

What We Need

  • We're asking for $4,000 to feed our cast and crew, rent camera and lighting equipment, and pay for the locations we'll be using to film! 
  • If we do not reach our goal we may have to scale back some of the more extensive lighting setups we envisioned for the film, but production will continue nonetheless!

The Impact

We want create a film that accurately portrays the struggle of the modern job market and how it affects all aspects of our lives, from our dreams to our friendships.  If we have done our job correctly we hope everyone that watches the film can relate to not only the struggles of these individuals but also their passion and motivations as well. 

Key Crew

Directors - Kyle Decker and Joe Schneider

Director of Photography - Brennan Miller

1st Assistant Director - Steven Hoffmeister

Production Design - Alison Pirie

Script Supervisor - Rachel Hemsley

Production Sound - Austin Chee

Unit Production Manager - Noah Rashba

Cast

Parker - Andrew Gandy

AJ - Tommie Russell

Meagan (Amanda in video) - Sajel Parekh

Hailey (Ally in video) - Sierra Green

Mrs. Zimmerman - Eileen Dunn

Risks & Challenges

  • One of our scenes is set at night which means large lighting setups.  That being said if we have enough money to rent the proper lights, this should not be an issue. 
  • We have long days of shooting in which the angle of the sun constantly changes. However through the use of lights and other equipment we can control the angle of light to ensure continuity in the scenes. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word!  Even if you can't contribute to the film we would really appreciate it if you could share our campaign on your favorite social media site!

If we do not reach our goal we may have to scale back some of the more extensive lighting setups we envisioned for the film, but production will continue nonetheless!


The Impact

story:
A freeze frame from the real-life abduction video. 

                        

                                There are two...  Can you see them?

On July 10th, 2012, a middle-aged man, from Florida, scrolls through the videos stored in his cell phone... and he finds a video that he doesn't remember ever recording. 

On the video, unrecognizable beings move through the darkness of his bedroom while he sleeps, pinned to his bed, trapped in a tight silk-like cocoon.

Thus begins a chain of extraterrestrial encounters that still go on to this very day.  

Our film, Red Light, will dramatize one abductee's story,  interlaced with the actual video that was recorded.

$960,000 is what we need to make this film.  


UPDATE!   Actor MATTHEW BOYLAN has signed on to act in our film.  Matthew loved the script and believes in the project!  You can see Matthew in last years film "STRAIGHT OUTTA COMPTON". 

UPDATE!  A-list special FX Make up wizard RANDY WESTGATE has signed on to handle the make-up fx for the film.  Randy has worked on "Wolverine", "Fight Club" and many other big movies.


The crew is ready!

The screenplay is ready! 

                            -- Excerpts from the RED LIGHT screenplay --

All we need is you!

What would you like?  You can have everything from a t-shirt, hoodie, a dvd of the film, your name in the credits, a copy of the script or maybe signed / autographed Hollywood memorabilia.  You can even come and make the film on set with us! But more importantly, YOU will be making this film happen.

The awesome contribution / perks would make any movie buff, sci-fi fan or UFO enthusiast excited.

Thousands of people have had extraordinary experiences but are unable to provide any tangible proof or footage to back their experience.  We admit we were skeptical when we stumbled upon the abductee and his story.  We spent a year analyzing his video.  We shared it with video professionals who have examined the abductee's video and have come to the conclusion, that unless the abductee is a VFX (visual effects) wizard, he's gotten something that is very out of the ordinary visiting him in his home.  Maybe others who are afraid to share their experiences can bring forward their evidence to show the world, driven forward by our film and the abductees experience.

Red Light is based on one of the best visual references of an alien encounter in history.

MEET THE FILMMAKERS

WHY THIS TEAM?

This filmmaking team has decades of film experience writing, directing and editing.  They have been a part of some of the biggest films in Hollywood such as...

​Lawrence Razo is a passionate Latino filmmaker who strives for excellence in the entire filmmaking process.  He has successfully produced 5 award winning Indy films: A Gangster's Word, Smile Now Cry Later, La Guapa, Lock Down at Harborside, and Sins Of a Call Girl.   Lawrence got his start with indie film production company Plus Entertainment in Los Angeles.

Lance Hyden is a published author and film producer.  His story “Crazy 8” is published and sold on Amazon.com in a book titled, “Irrational Fears”.   Lance also produced the award-winning short film "Collector" starring the late Brad Renfro and "The Art of Human Salvage" starring Edward James Olmos.  Lance served faithfully in the United States Marine Corp.  He was deployed in Korea, Japan, Thailand, Philippines, Saudi Arabia, Iraq, and Kuwait during the Gulf War.

Dempsey Tillman is a writer / director.  He has worked with many accomplished producers, directors and actors over the past two decades in Hollywood while creating his own award-winning short films.  He has won over 50 awards for his short films and feature screenplays.  In 2008, Dempsey was awarded the BEST DIRECTOR award by NBC UNIVERSAL Shortcuts film festival where he was given a promo assignment by the SciFi Channel.   His latest proof of concept short film "The Art of Human Salvage" has over 1.4 million views on Youtube alone.

You can see some of his work below...




...and yes, what director doesn't have a music video that cost $75 bucks on his reel!



                              


Ted Dewberry is our "Ace In The Hole" writer.  Partnered with Dempsey, Ted brings his extreme writing talent to the screenplay of RED LIGHT.  Ted is an accomplished writer and published novelist.  His two books "East Hollywood" and "Polybius" are both available for purchase on Amazon.com.  Ted's screenplays "The Last Meal Project", "The First Holocaust" and "West Bank IPA" have all been honored by the prestigious Academy Nicholl Fellowship competition.  Ted is also the writer of the Bladerunner-ish feature film, "The Art of Human Salvage".  He also penned the short film, "The Art of Human Salvage", that was honored earlier this year at the Philip K. Dick film festival in New York with a Best Short Film award.  Philip K. Dick's works produced many great Hollywood sci-fi films such as Bladerunner, Total Recall and Minority Report. 

John Bussard is a master at "no budget" indie films.  To this day, we still don't know how he pulls it off.   John has made several indie films which include his work in progress "Hollywood Horror Story", "Mosquito" with director Gary Jones and "Frostbiter:  Wrath of the Wendigo" directed by Tom Chaney.  John was also a producer and script consultant on the two award winning short films "Collector" and "The Art of Human Salvage".  We've even caught John running the camera, holding the boom mic, and acting in the scenes... ALL AT THE SAME TIME!  If anyone can help make RED LIGHT a success, its a  guy who can do all of that!  Go get 'em, John!


                                      


We can't make our film without you.  Maybe you need more perks to go along with your contribution!

We want you to see every dime on the screen.  From great visual effects to awesome Dolby surround sound, we want you to hear and feel a great experience when watching the finished Red Light film.

Here's how we plan to allocate the funds raised through our Indiegogo campaign.

...so graciously, through you, we raise the money to bring RED LIGHT to the big screen...

John (Johnny G) Garrett has worked on many blockbuster films such as "Man Of Steel", "Captain America", "The Borne Legacy" and Will Smith's "Hancock" to name a few.  He was honored by the International Cinematographers Guild as an EMERGING CINEMATOGRAPHER in 2015.  In 2010, John was honored with the BEST CINEMATOGRAPHER award for the short film "Collector".  He shared this honor with another incredible cinematographer Thomas Scott Stanton.   John's incredible talent would again be showcased in the short film "The Art of Human Salvage" starring Edward James Olmos.

John went on to be the cinematographer for the upcoming film "Sugar Mountain", starring Game of Thrones star Jason Momoa.   "Johnny G" is going to make Red Light look incredible!

We want to have the best cast possible and it all starts with you!
With your help, we'll make offers to these actors to star in Red Light!


We are making a movie inspired by one man's true experiences.   Although it is inspired by this man's video of his extraterrestrial experience, it is still a movie that is meant to inform, inspire, and entertain.  We have dramatized his story in a captivating and exciting way.  Red Light will be similar to these films...

RED LIGHT is unique when compared to these films,  We have an actual video of alien abduction to support our story.  We aren't only creating a film, but sharing this phenomenon with the world!
You can be a part of this, too!

Use Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest, Tumblr, WhatsApp, LinkedIn, SnapChat... to get the word out about our project, about your project!  We need a lot of support to make this a success.

Well, you can see that too.  We'll give you the chance to form your own conclusion based on what you see.  We've put together a 15 min documentary where we show you the video (dissecting it frame by frame) with our video tools and also a brief interview with the abductee.   Oh, you also get a cool LED lamp!  Just remember to pick up a wall mount USB power adapter for it.  Otherwise, plug it into any powered USB port and your good to go!   P.S.:  I wouldn't sleep with this in your bedroom at night!

This perk is only available to those that have chosen one of the other perks first!   Oh yeah, that was supposed to be a secret.
story_txt:
A freeze frame from the real-life abduction video.                                                         There are two...  Can you see them?On July 10th, 2012, a middle-aged man, from Florida, scrolls through the videos stored in his cell phone... and he finds a video that he doesn't remember ever recording. On the video, unrecognizable beings move through the darkness of his bedroom while he sleeps, pinned to his bed, trapped in a tight silk-like cocoon.Thus begins a chain of extraterrestrial encounters that still go on to this very day.  Our film, Red Light, will dramatize one abductee's story,  interlaced with the actual video that was recorded.$960,000 is what we need to make this film.  UPDATE!   Actor MATTHEW BOYLAN has signed on to act in our film.  Matthew loved the script and believes in the project!  You can see Matthew in last years film "STRAIGHT OUTTA COMPTON". UPDATE!  A-list special FX Make up wizard RANDY WESTGATE has signed on to handle the make-up fx for the film.  Randy has worked on "Wolverine", "Fight Club" and many other big movies.The crew is ready!The screenplay is ready!                             -- Excerpts from the RED LIGHT screenplay --All we need is you!What would you like?  You can have everything from a t-shirt, hoodie, a dvd of the film, your name in the credits, a copy of the script or maybe signed / autographed Hollywood memorabilia.  You can even come and make the film on set with us! But more importantly, YOU will be making this film happen.The awesome contribution / perks would make any movie buff, sci-fi fan or UFO enthusiast excited.Thousands of people have had extraordinary experiences but are unable to provide any tangible proof or footage to back their experience.  We admit we were skeptical when we stumbled upon the abductee and his story.  We spent a year analyzing his video.  We shared it with video professionals who have examined the abductee's video and have come to the conclusion, that unless the abductee is a VFX (visual effects) wizard, he's gotten something that is very out of the ordinary visiting him in his home.  Maybe others who are afraid to share their experiences can bring forward their evidence to show the world, driven forward by our film and the abductees experience.Red Light is based on one of the best visual references of an alien encounter in history.MEET THE FILMMAKERSWHY THIS TEAM?This filmmaking team has decades of film
