story:
About The Film

"To Me, With Love" is a semi-fictional film about Jade, a 20-something writer, who moves back to her hometown of Flint, Michigan after living in New York for several years. Upon her return, she's met with a water crisis that's affecting half of the city's residents.

She also faces a personal crisis in the form of unresolved issues from strained family relationships and friendships. As Jade strives to love her home all over again and mend what's broken, she hopes she has enough drive to achieve her dream of becoming a successful writer.

The film will be shot in Flint and feature a cast and crew of Flint natives. A short clip was filmed in 2019 that can be seen above.

Production is scheduled to begin in mid-May 2020.

About Me

My name is Breona Johnson and I am a screenwriter/director that was born and raised in Flint, Michigan.

For as long as I can remember, I've had a love for film, and since I was 18 years-old, I've been involved in film in some form or fashion. I purchased my first camera while living in a homeless shelter and educated myself on the ins and outs of shooting. I was accepted into Columbia College Chicago for film, but couldn't attend due to financial reasons.

However, I sought out opportunities to shoot projects for creatives right in my hometown. Since then, I've shot numerous music videos, two short films and have been a behind-the-scenes videographer for multiple music artists. Filming has allowed me to travel to over 27 different states, and to live in Los Angeles for close to five years.

The Mission

My mission for "To Me, With Love" is to tell an overlooked story and to bring more awareness to social issues from a personal and intimate narrative. I love researching mental health and emotions, and consider myself an empath.

A dream of mine is to be able to examine human emotion and depict it in a movie so well that people who watch would think, "That's exactly how I felt when something like that happened to me." Ultimately, I want to make movies that everyday people can relate to and I feel like "To Me, With Love" will be just that.

What We Need To Make This Happen

We are looking to raise $12,000 to complete "To Me, With Love" and to ensure that it is released in 2020. All of the funds raised will go towards the following:

  • Purchasing and/or renting major and minor film equipment (cameras, lenses, lighting, props, etc.)
  • Acquiring city and state permits
  • Paying the film crew and cast
  • Covering travel expenses
  • Securing shoot locations 

What You Get For Helping

By supporting "To Me, With Love" you are directly supporting emerging filmmakers, writers, photographers, musicians and overall creatives from the city of Flint, Michigan.

Coming from such a hard-working, blue-collar environment, we will appreciate every dollar we receive in order to bring this film to life. We also would like to show our appreciation by offering you some awesome perks when you make a donation!

Other Ways To Help

If you aren't able to donate money, you can still help out by spreading the word!

Feel free to share this campaign with your friends, family and followers on any social media platform you like. We appreciate each and every share!

story:
Overview

THE LIFE OF MINE is a musical-dramady feature-Length film about a young musician & rapper, Allo, who has grown up in a close knit musical family along with his sister Mila.  One of his primary motivations is to always protect his sister and to keep their family close.  Allo discovers that his sister has started dating a new guy, and he is puzzled as to why it was kept as a secret from him.  When Allo finally meets him, he is shocked to discover that he is an unwelcomed character from his past.  Allo is then determined to not let this dude win under his watch….so the adventure begins!     

 

The film is currently in production with about 80% of the scenes shot.  We have had 2 Advanced screenings of a rough version of the film and this was done to obtain  feedback from our target audience.  The screenings were a huge success!  We had overwhelmingly positive feedback from the audience.  One comment was that “the movie played like one of my favorite music CD’s”.  Another comment was that this type of content is refreshing and loaded with some amazing music".   Of course there is still post production work needed including audio, color correction and color grading.  Help drive this project to completion by offering your support with getting these things done!

 

Who we Are:

The Life of Mine is the first feature length film by Art8 productions. Art8 Productions is a family owned freelance company with experience in the areas of Web Series, Comedy Skits, Short Films and Documentary style videos.  Our Team consist of people that have experience, knowledge, skills and talent gleaned from years of experience in entertainment primarily in the music and Film/TV areas. This has enabled us to be effective and perform a range of complex task with a small team. One of those tasks included shooting the Feature Length film “The Life of Mine“.  The film features a brother and sister duo (Jamila and Diallo Thompson) and tells a story about family, trials and triumphs through the Lens of Hip-hop and R&B.

Company Goals:

Our intentions are to provide entertainment that present positive messages about courage, intelligence, family and fun. We want to tell stories that follow African American youth thru adventures and Misadventures.

 

What We Need

WE CAN’T DO THIS ALONE!  The film won’t get finished without the aid of a talented cast and crew and equipment.  In addition, Post-Production and distribution also costs time and money.  Some of what we will raise will help to cover the costs of shooting the remaining scenes along with post production editing, scoring, color grading and starting distribution.  Of course, the amount that we are requesting will not cover all of these costs, but with your help we can complete the lions share of it.  We will cover the rest out of pocket.

 

What's In It For You?

Those that contribute will gain access to a wide variety of awesome perks!  Everything from shout outs, credits in the film, t-shirts, VIP screening/access to view the completed film, and many more!

The Life of Mine doesn’t get finished without the generous contributions from people like you, and we want to return the favor by offering a wide variety of perks for your help!

*A shipping charge will be added during checkout

 

Other Ways You Can Help

The number one way to help The Life of Mine become a reality is to make a contribution, but there are many other ways to help! The film won't get made unless people know about it, so PLEASE SPREAD THE WORD! 

Share our IndieGoGo page, email your friends and family, post about us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc! 

We truly feel that this project will not only be awesome, but it will be something that you are proud to have been a part of!  Please join us on this exciting adventure!

story:
Writer and Producer Dee Simms
Currently Residing: Washington, DC
Currently Studying: Acting at The National Conservatory for Dramatic Arts



 

THE IDEA

My project

"BE" is about a young woman who wants to be famous so bad that a lot of her morals and responsibilities slip. 

 

 

A BLURB FROM THE SCRIPT

A young woman sits at a vanity in her place. She sits and stares at her face in the mirror. She looks up and sees her vision board hanging up on her wall. It has pictures of Victoria Secret models, famous IG models, famous reality tv stars and magazine clippings of a red Bugatti and a mansion in Los Angeles CA. She walks over to her wall mirror and it has an outline of a coke bottle shape figure written in black marker on the mirror. She huffs. She’s on her phone scrolling through her Instagram account. She stops to look at how many likes she has on her last picture posted. She goes to the page of a known beautiful IG model. She double clicks the picture. She starts to pose and take a few pictures to emulate hers. After she takes a few dozen pictures she gets frustrated because she doesn’t like them. She posts one anyway with a heavy filter to hide her imperfections.

 

 

MY PLAN

I am a content creator who envisions stories that I would like see on the big screen someday. I know that the only way to see what you want to see is to make your own lane and create it yourself. I just hope along the way that there are a few people who like my stories as much as I do and would like to see more from me.

I know the more that I create the more content I can put out there to be seen. I won’t stop until I’ve been heard.



WHAT IS NEEDED FROM YOU

The meat and potatoes of this whole thing, funding. Things start to add up when shooting a film and everything costs money so here is what it’s all going to.

Budget: $500

$140 - Equipment.
As I am shooting with my own limited equipment, a certain lens is needed for certain shots. This lens will give so much depth and quality to the film that there’s no way around this cost. And as you know, you can’t skimp on quality.

$90 - Location.
Most of my locations won’t cost me a thing to film but one location is needed to secure. This venue is needed for a pivotal direction where the story goes.

$100 - Post-Production.
This is where the real work begins. Marketing is a huge factor in getting your content out there. Marketing alone can be a costly thing but for me I plan to make some movie posters and subscribing to Vimeo.

$80 - Production Incidentals.
Catering and a little buffer for production. 

$75 - Festivals.
Finishing the film is only the start of the journey. A short film's best shot at sustained life and exposure is the festival circuit. Most festivals request substantial submission fees and may require the core team to travel as needed.

$15 - Props.
Props are an essential part of a film and are needed for this film.

 

 

REWARDS

Anyone who gives graciously to this project will get a personal invite from me to the premiere of this film as a big fat thank you.

 

 

TIMELINE

I will start shooting this project the first week of December and I am planning to have all shooting done by the middle/end of December to give me enough time to edit the film. My deadline is the first week of February to have a finished product to enter into film festivals.

 


PAST WORKS WRITTEN AND DIRECTED BY DEE SIMMS

 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nsyln72UZQM&amp...

*This is the short film I made this year to enter into the 2019 American Black Film Festival. Now "BE" will be made and entered in 2020 in hopes of becoming a finalist for the HBO short film competition next year. Fingers crossed and prayers up!

 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iocz32-8v4M

*This is a short I made while in the ART program at The National Conservatory for Dramatic Arts. It will be premiered on November 15, 2019. 

 

 

 

Thank you,

Dee Simms

P.S.: If you have any questions or concerns please send them to DeeSimmsDream@gmail.com
